content: My advice is to avoid the product altogether. It seems like it is getting worse by the day. Annoyingly different for different platforms which is due to pure laziness of the developer. Sync is a continuous problem. Requires too much time to sync and then get through "failed to sync" messages. Reinstalling does not fix the problem. My android does not see the watch. Additional advertisement in food obscures views. All calorific values nullified and have to be re-entered again....and again. I wish I would not buy this product at all.

Sleep analytics, period & fitness tracker, almost every single feature on this app is difficult to navigate. The period tracker is set up where you "predict" when you will be off your period instead of just having you input when you start & when you end it. It's difficult to maneuver the "prediction" once it's set. You cannot add a workout in if you forget your fitbit. I haven't been able to find a single feature that is simple to use on this app. We want fast and easy, not whatever this is.

12/25/20: The device is great but the app rarely works. Ever since getting the Charge 4 I've had nothing but issues with the app sync. I would really like to get my data but it's impossible with the app syncing maybe 1 or 2 days out of an entire week. Uninstalling today just made it worse. Now I can't even log in to the app. Please fix this so we can log in to our apps and don't have to reinstall our apps 10 times a month just to get it to sync a few times. 1/15/21: App still won't work.

I thought I was the only one having issues with syncing, but I see I'm not. I actually thought about buying another watch, but my versa is still in good shape. I do have access to other watches, but Fitbit needs to fix their issues quickly. I know others having the same issues, and your about to get cut off. Plz give us some type of info asap.

The app is awful! First they want you to pay for premium because you know fit bits are so cheap! Let's keep things so people are constantly paying for things. Then you try and add people on a friends level and of course you can't. I have googled the issue and there is no answers to why you can not add people. It's just not right. If I knew this I would have just gotten a different watch! I would give it no stars but that's not possible. Please change things!

The app is complete garbage. I got my new Versa over the summer. A week later, it stopped syncing properly after an update. I tried to hang in there for the next update. Tried it, and nothing. Tried various "fixes" that have been suggested, and nothing. It's now January and it still will not sync regularly. The data is essentially useless, as it only includes partial data. I'm switching to something I can actually use because Fitbit clearly is not capable of getting it together.

It hardly ever syncs, I have do this manually, even then it doesn't work. It's not a smart watch at all as I very rarely syncs when a message comes through on my phone. Will not be purchasing a fitbit in the future. To make matters worse, I have to swap wrists every day, otherwise my wrist is bright red and I don't have sensitive skin.

4 years since I last used this app and its still horrific. It won't sync. Bought myself a new fitbit for Christmas and I regret it. The watch is fine but this app is complete garbage. Unfortunately you can't use the watch without it... The connectivity is tragic, and some actions are impossible to perform. Seeing "Please wait..." for minutes for the most mundane tasks. Looking at the reviews here is much worse. Unfortunately going to have to return it and get my money back

Having been a avid fitbit person for the last 4 years, I am infuriated with the new products and app. Will not sync. I repeat will not sync. I have followed all the protocols in an attempt to get it to sync but to no avail. What a waste of money. Do not purchase fitbit!!!!!!!!!! I guarantee you will be disappointed to the point of incredible frustration. I will record my smashing of my new fitbit Charge 4 with a hammer and send it to corporate HQ to show my intent to never use their product!!!!!

Suddenly unable to sync. Last app update was 12/9, last sync was 12/8. Not a coincidence. There is an email address listed for developer contact, but when you email, you get an auto-reply saying they no longer offer support by email. Guess we're on our own until a new update, if one ever occurs. Note: I have done all of the suggested corrections and none have worked. I even unpaired, and am now unable to re-pair. Update the app please, or Roll Back!!!

My charge 2 fitbit quit pairing and syncing after Dec. 19, 2020. Went thru all the fixes on the site. Didn't work Called and Stacey walked me through, again, all the fixes. Didn't work. Tried a different fitbit on the same phone and a different phone and the app still does not work. We believe it is their update to the app that is causing this issue. Who's to say that a discounted fitbit, from them, will even work?? Unhappy customer.

Too much extra garbage that I don't want. Now it forces me to have access to my location and have it turned on, just to sync the app to the unit. The sync process fails too often. The wrist flip to activate the time display hasn't worked for over a year. Don't waste your money or personal information on this poorly written app and unit.

I've had this for almost 3 years and it has gotten progressively worse. First I stopped receiving text notifications and attempted several resets, but gave up. Most recently, the watch has not synched with my phone since Oct 6. I have again attempted multiple resets to no avail. Three months later and it still isn't synching and to add further to this piece of garbage, it no longer has the correct time so I can't even use it as a watch. Just save yourself some grief and buy another brand

First review 11/20 (?) - Doesn't count the floors correctly. You have to refresh the app constantly to get a correct floor count. I have climbed 28 floors today and my count is currently 21. Occasionally, it catches up later but usually not. I've been a user for 2 yrs. This has always been an issue. 1/16/21 - With the new Google owned update, my floor count today is currently at 46 floors when I haven't climbed a single one. So disappointed.

Well, like MANY of the reviews I've read, my app used to work well. For Christmas I received a new Versa 2. I love it. For the first week it worked well with the app. It would sync fine. I love that it works with Alexa. I have to take pills throughout the day, and I loved programming it to remind me. Well starting yesterday, I've had a hell of a time getting my Versa to sync to the phone. I'm beyond frustrated! I guess I'm going to have to try calling customer service. Hope that works.

When I first tried to link my fitbit to my phone, it took hours of playing around trying to get it to work and to sync. Finally it synced for a few days and now hasnt synced in over a month. Very disappointed that I can't access my data and that all methods I've tried to get the damn thing to sync wont work. I've tried everything from playing with bluetooth settings, restarting my phone, uninstalling app, nothing works. I've given up and would not recommend fitbit.

Keeps resetting my step count to zero when syncing. Today I smashed my daily step goal. This evening I turned on my Bluetooth and synced my Fitbit. My step count immediately reset to zero, data just completely gone. This has happened a few times before, it's sad when you've had a step-filled day!! The heart rate and "sleep tracking" measurements are also no longer syncing. This app *used* to work nicely, not sure what's happened.

Too inaccurate, doesn't let you delete it bad data. I ride my motorcycle every day to commute, and it adds around 600 more calories, 15,000 steps and 150 floors... I'm not kidding, there is a lot of people with the same problem, search on internet (some in cars too) but the app doesn't delete the extra calories/steps. Don't waste money with the watch

Like many others my device and app suddenly stopped working correctly on January 1st 2021. It stopped tracking sleep, stopped syncing, began displaying conflicting data, etc. after over a year of no issues whatsoever. Everything is up to date and I've tried every fix they suggested which of course didn't work. After reading all the event reviews I'm starting to get a little suspicious of what may have caused this. Please fix this.

I've had to change my review from 3 stars to 1. I have a Huawei P30 pro. Maybe it's the phone, but I have to reinstall this app at least once a week. Either it disconnects from my phone and won't send me notifications to my watch, or the app gets stuck in the loading screen. I can't personalize my auto messages, since reinstalling the app turns them back to default. So frustrating. edit: reinstall #7 today.

Judging by other recent reviews, it seems fitbit has implemented planned obsolescence. Older models no longer connect to the app, making them completely useless. You can't change any settings on the fitbit withput the app including the time. I'm using a charge 2 that has been lightly used, and it will no longer connect after the most recent update. I can say for certain I will never buy another fitbit product again.

This app is useless, wish I new about this sooner, it won't connect to my fitbits, Uninstalled it, (work the first time), did it again because it did not connect, EVERY THING WAS WAS WORKING BUT THE APP DOES NOT CONNECT AND THIS IS THE THIRD TIME WITHIN 2 YEARS, I just going to see about returning it, it happened after every update. Want a good watch get a casio from Walmart. Not planning to buy anything from this company again. All happened after it died. Can't wait for a response. :(

*2 months later 1/13, still doesn't work even after 2 new updates from Fitbit. The Fitbit Versa itself is fine but the app is glitchy. It won't save my period details (flow, mood, etc) no matter how many times I save it. I contacted help who said they needed to upgrade my case and someone would be in contact with me within a few hours via email. It was over 24 hours when I got an email and it was a generic reply. 1 week later got reply of "we are monitoring the situation"

Never pairs or syncs properly. It's such a waste of time having to constantly re-pair my Versa 2, or turn Bluetooth on and off, or remove the app and reinstall it. It's such a hassle. Fitbit never listen to customer feedback or product suggestions either. It's now essentially just a very expensive basic watch that needs charging every other day. Might as well wear an analogue, it would be more reliable!

It no longer tracks my runs correctly. The map feature only shows a line for about 300 yards and then abruptly stops. The paces are also hilariously low. I'm flattered Fitbit thinks I can run as fast as it says I do. Ever since Fitbit was bought out, it's gone steeply downhill. Don't bother with them anymore. Update: now it's urging me to vote. There is also a "puzzle matching game." Is this even a fitness app anymore? Apparently not...

I like the layout and I don't have any complaints about the app per se, but the synchronization with my band is an issue. I also have a Garmin and whenever I "wake up" the watch, it synchs right away with the app; however my Fitbit 4 struggles to synch and it can last days without showing me the latest data even when I press "synch" on the app.

Awful app. If I could give this 0 stars I would. Nothing syncs properly. Constantly having to reinstall app as it keeps freezing. Doesn't track with GPS properly. I know I've done x amount of miles yet fitbjt states 0.6 miles. So frustrating. This used to be a great app. My husband has now stopped wearing his fitbit as the app basically renders the watch unless. Come on Fitbit, sort it out once and for all.

This software is Malware. I'd give it negative stars if it was an option. App won't find my network or scale and deleted my data from the scale. So the money paid for the "smart" part of the scale is no longer applicable, at the end of the day, it's just an overpriced "dumb" scale. If your considering a smart health device, you might look at Garmin, Nike, or one of the major phone manufacturers. I would'nt recommend this app or fitbit for that matter. Thanks for listening hope this review helps.

Once again the update makes syncing impossible. Like others, I'm going so long before it connects that the time on my Charge 3 is way off. I'm losing data constantly. Yesterday I apparently only took 108 steps. My sleep no longer tracks at all. I sell these things at work and it's becoming impossible to recommend Fitbit. Haven't been able to sync since Oct 11. It's no longer a tracker, its a watch. And now my clock face has lines so soon it won't even be that.Update: still wont sync. Since Oct.

Updated....I have a Versa 2. All I've gotten since December 23rd is basic information when I wake up. I've emailed support numerous times, they all tell me to do the same thing. Restart it, uninstall/reinstall the app. I've canceled my premium membership and I'm now looking at buying a Samsung smart watch. Thanks for nothing.

If I can give it 0* after the latest update I would. The fact that you can't stop the automatic sync is bs. It causes all sorts of issues with one of my other devices & even after I forget the device in my Bluetooth settings, the app forces the connection! Surely this is in violation of some sort. If I force forget the device & the app some how makes the phone connect to it, that makes me feel that this app could also be stealing my data and doing other things without my consent!

Your syncing process on this app is subpar. This has been an ongoing issue with you. My device is not synced since December the 17th. I have tried loading the app it still doesn't work. Every time you have an update this is a problem I have to reload the the app, but this time that's not even working. Now I'm even having problems tying in with the Bluetooth. Think I shall be going with either Garmin or Samsung I have been a Fitbit customer for 6 years. I think google wants fitbit to die!

I got a fitbit flex2 as a gift 2 years back and installed the app only to realize it just wouldn't pair. So I gave up threw it into my drawer. Now with a new phone and finally exercising again the exact same issue with sync. I've tried reinstalling, Bluetooth on off, diff internet providers and wifi, pc, reset button and nothing. I can't even say it's the firmware because that refuses to install the device. On a brand new device. I don't know if the device is crappy or the app or both!!!

I'm so done with Fitbit! Been a customer for years, and have had sync issues on and off after updates, but this is by far the worst! I'm done wasting my time on a brand that won't even sync regularly. Can't even use it as a watch because even the time is off when it can't sync! I'm moving on to a different company. Gave all the chances I can give! Another customer lost to tech issues that they don't even want to acknowledge. I refuse to throw my money away on this junk anymore. Goodbye Fitbit!ðŸ‘‹

It has been 10 days since I've paid for premium service and still don't have access to those services. I've been told by customer support I haven't made a purchase but my bank account and google support both say that I have made the payment. Horrible at providing services that a customer has paid for. Let alone getting ahold of some to actually fix it. I just get told someone else will email me. And still not a word or fix

I got a Fitbit Sense as a gift in early Dec and I have had nothing but problems with it staying connected and syncing. Insanely hard getting it to connect and then it only stays connected for a few hours. I have to continuously turn off everything and restart to get it to sync/connect. Totally useless if I cannot count on if to stay connected. Looks like I'll be going back to Garmin. Super disappointed in this expensive experience.

I've had trouble with my phone on and off since having it last July, now as of the 23/12 it doesn't notify me of any texts calls or announcements, I've spoken to both the cc in America and the UK for help but not being to solve the problem, one even told me my phone wasn't compatible with the fitbit which I think is rubbish , I got the impression he just wasn't interested in helping to fix the problem and only interested in me upgrading my fitbit !

Have been using the fitbit app for 3 years. However over the last week it so the Fitbit device will not sync with the App. Have tried every option available but frustratingly nothing works!!! This is the third time its occurred. To be fair to Fitbit they replaced the first device but it appears to be a recurring issue. Need to sort out the firmware issues. Something as simple as EVERY device (3 phones, tablet and PC) not finding the device on Bluetooth tells me the problem is with the device

I don't know what has happened lately, but I can't get my Versa to sync with the app anymore unless I reboot the Versa. I have done all the troubleshooting I have found in the forums with no luck. Very bummed because I used to love this thing. And now after reading reviews I see many people having the same issue. Guess it's time to start looking at other watch options.

What used to be a seamless process of automatic syncs no longer works. The app worked great until mid-December. The app no longer syncs with my Charge 3 unless I have opened the app, and even then if fails considerably. Not sure why this is the case but I noticed it started Mid December when my daily data was missing. A basic analysis of missing daily sync data should reveal when the application broke. The same sync issues occur using the PC and other devices.

I used to love fitbit. I lost my old one when I moved and got a new one last year for my birthday. Nothing but problems since then! Half my exercises dont track, if I set it to track manually on the fitbit it doesn't show how long i exercised, only distance, half the time my active minutes will literally disappear randomly. Looks like its time for me to find a different tracker to invest in!

Doesn't like to sync up. Have to uninstall and reinstall to try to get it to sync. Weather doesn't sync. Always stuck in CÂ°can change it to FÂ°. Weather was stuck in my home town and not the location I was in. I uninstalled and reinstalled and still the weather didn't sync. What ever you all did to your app fix it. Until then ðŸ–•. I will change my review and stars when it is fixed and working properly. ðŸ–•

App & watch's tenuous hold on Bluetooth connections leave a lot to be desired. Updating is about the most frustrating thing ever. Using the supposed WiFi connection does not work, but then thats not surprising since it seemingly has nothing to do with WiFi since it can't do a WiFi update without a Bluetooth connection? That and the fact that you cannot control Spotify while running. Why make Spotify a selling point if I can't actually use it while exercising? Will not buy another Fitbit product

Since October/November the app has struggled to sync with my fitbit charge 3. I've trouble shooted every possible option and it is still a problem. I even have a new phone and the issue is continuing. My watch starts telling the incorrect time as it is failing to sync. The only way I can resolve it is to connect to my computer to sync, but thats only a short term solution.

Fitbit finally gave in and sent me out a replacement. I have the new one now about 1 month and have only been able to sync it once with my phone. I did everything suggested on fitbit website, Inc turning on and off Bluetooth, unistalling and reinstalling the app, rebooting device as well as disconnecting all other Bluetooth devices, and it still won't sync. I cannot even install it on the fitbit app. Beyond disappointed. Never buy Fitbit! Get a better device from another company.

I've been using Fitbit for 4 years and loved it! Until recently, I'd say around Oct/Nov I started having some issues with things I would log on the app and then the next day it would be gone. Here and there it wouldn't sync. But NOW over the last few weeks I'm lucky if I can get it to sync once a week. I've jumped through all the hoops on how to "fix" it and it's just not working. If this can't get figured out with the app asap I'll be moving onto something different

Was very pleased with until I got a problem with synchronization with my smart phone .There is no way you can email Fitbit or chat room unless you give them some payment details such as credit card or PayPal. Which I am not prepared to do. When you buy goods they should work it's only five months old.Mow you cannot synchronization with smart phone. Have learnt the lesson never buy from Fitbit again. The service is non existent

The app hasn't synced since 11th December. Completed all possible troubleshooting steps and contacted the support. They informed me that there is a known syncing issue affecting Google Pixel devices. Since the device itself only holds 30 days worth of data, and I cannot sync it, I feel very dissapointed by this as some of my data will be inevitably lost...

Nor very happy right now. On the 29th of January my fitbit stopped syncing! Ive tried everyrhing that i can think of to get it to sync back up, turned device off/on, uninstall/install app, now i factory reset it and it will not turn back on (and yes it is fully charged) i didnt have any problem until i updated the app! So how do i fix it?!!!!

Update: almost 4 months since my last successful sync. Honestly, I'm probably not going to buy another one again - 5 years with fitbits ended. Original: I can't sync my fitbit. I never minded manually pressing the sync, but since this last update even that doesn't work. I've had a charge 2 hr for a while now with no issues, and my Pixel 3a has had no issues until now. I also don't know how but it's draining my charge 2 battery very quickly now, even though it's not syncing. Super frustrating.

I've switched to a fitbit sense and my experience is horrible. The cause appears to be the fact that I sync children's devices with my phone. I lose all of the sense features and frequently the ability to sync on both my device and my kids devices as a result of the stupid load/unload sequence this app does every time you try to work with your kids devices. The app is officially horrible. This is unacceptable and has rendered an expensive device no more useful than their cheapest devices.

Got a Fitbit a couple years ago and right after I bought it they did a software update which removed my phone from the supported list. Not only that, many of the features on the watch don't track accurately. You never used to get enough credit for stairs and now there's so much it's unbelievable. And to top it all off when we got to 2021 the first thing that popped up in my app was an ad to buy a new watch, and guess what my versa won't sync anymore without some crazy voodoo. WWJD

Well it appears that I still have a synching problem, it still won't. I've tried all the fixes and nothing works. The more updates it does, the harder it is to synch. Used to automatically very well but but no more. Disappointed. Revised 27 Dec 2020. Always had a synching issue between Inspire HR and Huawei P20 Lite but since recent Fitbit update it won't synch at all. Fitbit do something!!!

Updating my prior review: I am very experienced at using HR monitors and other fitness electronics such as cycling power meters. I have owned a couple Garmins, 4iii, Powertap. They all work virtually seemlessly. My daughter bought me a VERSA 2 for XMAS and it is the worst thing I have ever used. I spent a full 4 days just trying to get the unit syncing. Now it rarely intermittently syncs. Save yourself a lot of frustration and by a Garmin or 4iii product. This is unacceptably horrible.

Since the Fitbit app updated on my phone on Dec 9th there have been several issues. Several tiles including steps, sleep and heart rate have disappeared from my dashboard. Also it is impossible to pair my Charge 3 and Samsung s6. Before this update there were NO issues. Interesting to note that the update advocates signing up to Premium. Is this a deliberate ploy Fitbit?? It certainly seems like it. I've tried to message you again but to no avail. You don't want to know.

Unable to sync Charge HR after app update. Seems like most people having the same issues have older devices too. My phone finds the device just fine, which means that my Bluetooth is working. Just won't actually sync.. Fitbit knows they have too many products. They want you to buy the new one. They're pulling an Apple move with planned obsolescence. Theyre not replying to anyone with these issues, but other issues get attention. I dont want 30% off your next product. I want MY product to work.

Fitbit Charge 2 has stopped syncing from my phone app since November 2020. It's able to sync from laptop app but refuses to sync from phone. I tried all possible solutions but all in vain. It really is annoying now and seems like an universal problem for many others. And I don't believe it's a phone issue as all the other devices and apps work absolutely fine.

Not working again? What a surprise... It seems like ever other day there is something wrong with the app or the device or just the link between them... now the app wont open. The other day my device wouldn't charge. I got that fixed but now the app wont work... had fitbits for years... always have the same problems! Why cant they just fix the problem!?! I currently have a charge 4.

Do not buy the Fitbit Sense, it's an appalling product. It continually disconnects from Bluetooth (not that you'd notice as it's very difficult to get the screen to actually wake up). But you might find you don't even need the screen on as it's largely useless as a smart watch. The GPS is way off, but given it thinks my BPM is 30, I guess I don't need to do much excercise anyway. Also to note, Fitbit Sense will not work with Assistant, YouTube Music, Google Pay, or any other Google app. At all.

Bye Fitbit. I've moved to Garmin. Like many other Fitbit users, I've had synching issues and pairing issues with my mobiles. This didn't used to happen but it has been a constant problem for more than 18 months. Telling us all to uninstall and reinstall constantly is rubbish. Other companies don't have these issues to this extent.I don't understand why you can't fix this problem. My watch has been playing up for a few months. I decided.to go with Garmin and have had no issues. Their app is great

This app hasn't worked on my Samsung since Dec 2018. Still not working June 2020. Still not working properly Jan 2021. When trying to set up a challenge is displays No recent activity for all my friends. I know there are some that do use it. Would be nice for it to be fixed and work as it should on my Samsung S7.

Why did I bother to upgrade my FitBit? I started 4 years ago with a Charge 2, which worked flawlessly even after a phone upgrade. I purchased a Versa 3 on 12/13. At first, it had no issues with sync. As of right now it has refused to sync for 2 whole days even after going through all of the troubleshooting. I did not spend this much money on a fitness tracker for it not to work, and I do not have time to waste messing around with it trying to get it to sync. This is beyond frustrating. I'm done.

Horrible experience if you want to cancel a premium service. Google play referred me to the developer, developer's email was invalid. Contacted Fitbit support, unable to help, told me on my face that if Google cannot offer me a refund, then I won't get a refund. When asked to speak to a supervisor, I was told all of them are busy and that I will be contacted by email ASAP but the response would be the same. Just pathetic service!!

This is so frustrating. My charge 2 has worked for so long and lately it has not been syncing. I have tried everything. Uninstalled and reinstalled the app countless times I have tried everything. I get to the set up where it gives me the 4 digit number I enter that in and then it says make sure your tracker is charged and on which it is and has been reset multiple times. There are no other devices near me and my Bluetooth has been turned on and off multiple times.

Having the same problems as everyone else - my clock was wrong, and I could not reset the fitbit or resync with my cell app. Device set up kept failing too. I erased the fitbit from cell/account. Plugged USB into laptop, download desktop fitbit app, and resynced that way. Took 3 min. Signed back into account on cell; it updated and synced, but my Charge still won't sync with the cell app. I have to sync with laptop, which is a total pain.

I've never been more frustrated. I got my device in July. My device works fine, Bluetooth pairs fine, but the app won't sync and save my data. Because the app is broken, my device is essentially useless at this point. I can't even get notifications. I've been having issues since October, but since December 9, when the new update happened, it says my Fitbit is dead all the time and never syncs.

Unreliable and defective. I've had several different models of fitbit since 2015 and I love them. However, more recently they've been over priced and glorified digital watches. The app has yet to save my data despite syncing every day. It appears on the day and then disappears the following. It's incredibly frustrating, especially when you want to have physical data to look back on during your fitness journey. At the moment I've lost confidence and I'm close to selling to buy a Garmin

So I love this app. Don't get me wrong. I've used it flawlessly with a few fitbit devices over 3 years. But since Oct 25th it will not correctly sync to my device. I have talked to IT a few times and done all the troubleshooting with no luck. All I was offered was 30% off a new device. Seeing as this is a clearly very common problem all occurring around the same time for thousands of people according to other reviews, I can't help but be suspicious. I wish I could see my data again.

Nothing is syncing at all, it is not counting my steps. My active hours is off. All these updates is really screwed up lately.. really not worth the fitbit or the app any more. So disappointing.. I now have to un sync and re sync my fitbit. So, thanks for making me want to switch to Garmin. Never again. Today I went for a run and it would not even count my steps. DONE.

Refuses to sync and pair. I used to love my fitbit by since Around Oct 30th it stopped synching with my charge 2. My watch seemed to me working fine but it would not sink. I unistalled the app and started the whole thing again and now it refuses to pair with my watch. So it all becomes useless since I can't see all the data it is collecting. Have they pushed update with a huge bug or what??? 01/15/21 Two updates later and my Charge 2 still refuses to pai with my new Google Pixel 3 phone.

I enjoy logging my calories through this app. However, as of recently, I can't change the unit of measurement for the foods that I log. I attempted to chat with and call customer service but was prematurely disconnected both times. I would rate this app five stars if I could count on reliable customer service - without jumping through several hoops. UPDATE: I finally spoke to a customer service rep on the phone. I was told users can no longer change the unit of measurement through the app.

The app sucks, if I could give it 0 stars I would. I have the watch for less than week and since yesterday it won't sync with my phone and if I try to update it always fails. Please fix the problem, I saw many complains about this in the reviews. Such a petty, very pretty watch, but if you're not going to fix the sync problem I have no other option than to just return them.

My wife and I have been Fitbit customers for over 5 years and have been very happy with the product. However, I am so saddened on what is happening now. Neither of our Fitbit watches are syncing to our mobile devices. Like many of the customers that are complaining while rating this app and product. I am tired of uninstalling and reinstalling for nothing. I really hope Fitbit will take the steps to fix it as soon as possible. They will be losing many old and new customers. ðŸ˜©

Fitbit failed to sync in late September. I thought it was because I had not synced it in a long time. Fitbit should try to fix this bug. I try to delete it and reinstall and download but it did not work. Fitbit failed to tell us in an update that their sever had crash. I had to read reveiws to find out that others are having the same problem as me. I think Fitbit should have reported something before lots of people went to alot of trouble just to connect a watch. Fitbit has failed me.

This app is an absolute nightmare! Ever since I upgraded to the Galaxy S10, my watch will not sync with the Fitbit app. I've contacted Fibit over the phone multipal times. They've instructed me on resetting the watch, and repairing my Versa 2 with my Galaxy S10 but nothing has come from it. I don't recieve text, emails, social media notifications, or call notifications. Word of Advice Fitbit, if it's not broken, don't fix it! Because now everything is broken!

I'm having problems receiving emails or texts. I've tried everything, even contacting customer service several times. Another thing I can't do is add a profile picture to my account. Very disappointed, it was a Christmas gift I really wanted and it is not working properly!!! So frustrating. Please can o get a actual help with this?????

Worked fine the day or two after I got it and set it up. Now I can't ever seen to get the watch and phone to be connected, stay connected or even sync. Both devices are up to date and get nothing. I will say when I first got it I loved it and didn't have these problems. I'm not sure why this is happening.

Good but some annoyances. I use it to connect with a wearable device and input calories. Minus one star because I wish the add food button took you straight to search and brought up the keyboard in one tap. Minus two stars for how many popups there are. It seems every other time I open the app, there are popups to buy some device or join some event. I've already paid for a device and am giving them tons of private information. Enough with the ads, just let me use the app.

I like the watch but the app/syncing are terrible. Anytime my Fitbit dies, I have to do one or more of the following to get the fitbit to sync: uninstall/reinstall the app, turn off/on my phone, reset my blaze, disconnect/reconnect bluetooth, etc. I was thinking maybe it was because my blaze is a few years old but looking over the most recent reviews, it seems to be an issue regardless of fitbit type. I'm over it and have been shopping for other fitness watches. It won't be another fitbit.

I've had the new Sense for 3 days and have already had to reconnect the bluetooth twice because it wouldn't sync. I thought it was likely a problem with the watch, but after reading the reviews here, I realize there is more likely a problem with the app. Hopefully it is fixed soon or I may need to get a different tracker. Very disappointing.

Everytime I try to connect my charge 4 to my phone i get an error saying "an app is needed to use this device." I have tried to Uninstall then reinstall the fitbit app and that didn't fix the problem. I have also tried connecting and reconnecting my charge 4 to the app and still nothing. Had the same issue with my charge 3, been like that for the last few months.

I bought the Fitbit app to get messages especially text whilst I'm working as I don't have access to my phone all the time, but the app never lets me know when text messages come in. I have to check them and when I try to view the message it never let's me. The app is not working well and does not do what I wanted to do. It's a shame because years ago I had a Fitbit and the app was really good but my new one is absolute rubbish.

Not very informative. It doesn't seem to be telling how to really set it up and how to use it. I'm going to try harder today and see how it goes. It doesn't show me easily how to start and stop an exercise or work out routine. I just wanted to stop it and it kept starting a new exercise. Disappointed at this point. Would like clearer more informative instructions on set up and how to work it and what it can do ðŸ˜Ÿ

It was working great i have to keep track of my heart rate. I pressed on my watch clear data and now it will not work at all. It keeps telling me to update the app or download it. It is already downloaded and has been since i got it on December 4th. Ive tried evetything. It just wont work anymore. Ive only had it for 1 month.

A few months ago I would have thought this is one of the best fitness apps but then I discovered you can't have more than 1 device that uses their "app gallery". If you have a charge 3, charge 4 and a sense then you have to remove each one to use another device....and when you reconnect one of these devices you have to go through the whole set up every time....and it wipes your pay, Google Assistant and knocks steps back to 9000 steps on the app.....what were you thinking fitbit....please fix

STILL HAVING ISSUES? (Jan 2021) keeps stopping syncing with my phone... V annoying. Have to uninstall and re install to get it to work again.. Seems a familiar bug.. Anything being done to rectify???? Definitely would not pay extra for the premium if the basic does not work. Thank god they are joining forces with Google maybe they they fix this.

Disappointed! I am a user, and I've also brought my kids into the fold with inspire2 trackers and we have a group that includes other family members. In my mind, there is 2 important aspects to fitness trackers: Accuracy, and user integration in the UI. Accuracy is great, but the ability to integrate family members is horrible. Everything is so non configurable and just difficult. Creating leaderboards and stats introspective is lacking. Should have small random groups based on your rank

I swear this company makes their products stop working on purpose to drive up sales. First, the heartrate tracking stopped working out of the blue. It was set to "auto" but auto behaved like off--for no reason. So I figured out how to turn it on all the time. Then, it refuses to sync randomly. And when I jump through hoops to try to make it work, it might work on it's own or might not work after steps. Just doesn't work sometimes for no rhyme or reason. This makes it an overpriced watch.

The app would be great if there was some way to pause the step counter without having take off the watch. The oversensitive sensors make it easy to clock in 53 steps as I'm only brushing my teeth. The app then uses that data to boost my calorie output, giving a false portrait of my real metabolic rate Also, there needs to be an easier way to add calories on previous days for which nothing was entered. There used to be a way in previous versions but I couldn't make it work with the current one.

This app will never sync with my fitbit. I have tried many trouble shooting techniques as per the recommendation of the fitbit app and website. I have unpaired and restarted my Fitbit, reinstalled the app, contacted support with no luck of the problem being solved. When the app does work, it is fantastic and I did enjoy it. But with the frequency of problems and amount of time I have had to spend on troubleshooting, overall, I am disappointed.

It's great when it works properly, there's a common problem where you need uninstall and then reinstall the app sometimes every other day to get notifications via your watch. There is a message that says 'notifications not working need to restart phone' but this does nothing. This is not an issue with my phone as multiple users have this issue. Not a massive problem to fix but a huge inconvenience for users.

Only app that I had to reinstall after upgrading from Samsung note 8 to 20. Stopped synchronising with watch. Generally daily updating is a problem: sleep data + pulse. inconsistent updating: dashboard is updated but not the specific or the other way around. Unfortunately Fitbit has now been taken over by Google. I seem to remember the health information Google sneaked out of NHS (UK health services) without patients consent. please correct me if I'm wrong.

I love my Fitbit an I still do just not as much now. Ever since I got a new phone I've realized I never receive notifications anymore, I didn't really think much of it until recently. So I searched Google to figure out why. So my phone everytime I would try to connect my watch to it through bluetooth it would say must have app which I do. Come to find out my new Samsung 20+ isn't compatible with my Fitbit. Alot of newer phones even Apple dont connect to Bluetooth anymore. Very pissed about this!

I mainly use this to track my sleep, and I've got about 2 weeks of data, but for some reason only ONE night, there's no details input in the charts. I searched Google and made sure I was doing everything right to get accurate readings, and still can't manage to collect anymore derailed data. Kind of disappointing

Was great but last 6 months it does not synch itself regularly and issues with other apps. I have Charge 2. I am tired of buying new items because they cannot be updated when otherwise functioning well. Its not good for the planet to keep tossing out items which use non renewable metals and keep producing more plastic. Fitbit needs to be a more responsible business.

I have used my device for about a year now and all of a sudden it is no longer connecting to Bluetooth and that led to not keeping up with normal time... it has also started causing red patches (burns) where the battery connects to it. I am getting very emotional because I use this mainly to track my sleeping patterns and my steps which I can no longer do because it isn't connecting to my phone... I'm at a loss for what to do. I searched up what to do. I factory reset the watch. Nothing.

I would give the app 3 stars if the developers would listen to users. Water quick add values are not modifiable, logged default exercises aren't editable (you can't add "jump rope"), and you can't log your own meditation settings. All these are desired by users but fitbit isn't adding them. It also has limited connectability to other apps, so I can't integrate Headspace or Jump Jumpro to the app. It's just very closed and not as useful as it could be. As a developer myself, I'm disappointed

I've been using the app with the Fitbit Charge 4 for about 6 months, and have had consistent problems with it. I've never gotten consistent sleep scores, despite exhausting all the Fitbit support troubleshooting. They basically told me that they don't know what's wrong, when it will be fixed, or what I can do about it. And, they won't extent my premium trial even though the app/device haven't been working properly. Premium seems worthless anyway. Very frustrating.

I am on my fourth fitbit. I have had this one for a week and I am already having trouble syncing my tracker with the app. Disappointing that I spent so much on something that won't work reliably, but I should have known since the first one I bought (and had replaced twice during the warranty period) was junk

This app would be amazing, but it never syncs to my fitbit device. It perpetually says that there is no internet connection, even when literally every other app connects to the internet just fine. It worked for a couple of days when I first got it this summer, but it hasn't been able to sync (except sporadically) for five months now. The December 7th update did not fix the problem. I will happily rewrite this review to be far more positive if the problem ever gets fixed.

Used to work great however lately it's not syncing properly. It sets my weight goals and I can't change them,.so I had to remove.it from my settings. Steps are not correct. I have been using charge 2 for several years. But the tracking have some problem recently as when I started running withthe gps, it doesn't get the positioning and the distance data. The rest of the parameters are working fine except for the distance data. Please look into this issue. Thanks.

It doesn't connect in your services suck. And on top of that every time when I try to secret knives with it and all that stuff it never actually words and saying it doesn't have full synchronization and the Bluetooth is not always acceptable I don't know what you guys running here but it's as shady company. And I hear a lot of excuses that O its the cove it I can't do much. That's just bull.

Used to be good - but not since the last update. You shouldn't have to reinstall the app and reset your fitbit device every day in order for it to sync and receive notifications. Restarting your phone does not solve the notification issue. The app needs to be updated to correct the issues. Fitbit also loses time when there are sync issues

App does not allow the same variables to be changed as the desktop version. For example, I am not interested in distance but cannot remove it from my Fibit Charge 3, using the app. In addition, I DO NOT want to see the agenda, but the app does not allow me to remove it from the Fitbit. Too much bloat has been added to the device and the app offers no way of customizing for my personal needs.

I bought my first Fitbit at the end of 2017. I bought a Fitbit Alta HR. It worked well with the app. I got a Versa 2 as a gift in July 2020. So in essence I got upgraded. It was ok for the first 2 months. Then I had problems with the battery. The battery wouldn't last any more than 2 days. It keeps dying without any alert from the app. Frustrated, I had to return it and I got another one from the company. Now it has been about almost 1+++ month since I got it back and it wouldnt sync and update

Great in theory if it actually did what I was supposed to do. My charge 3 stop showing notifications soon after I got it. Fitbit blamed it on cell phone incompatibility.. okay. The menstrual predictions are highly inaccurate...fwd to now. I can no longer sync my watch to the app. It shows me my current stats but everything disappears at the end of the day. Tried everything from clearing cache to updating app to restarts and bluetooth reconnections. W/o app, it's just a overpriced watch

Ok, so I've had my fitbit since March 2020.... it's fairly good most of the time. Cons: 1. takes me over an hour sometimes to connect and sync to my Samsung; 2. Registers peaks in heart rate caused by stress, as working out in fat burn zone. WRONG! PLS FIX. Con 3. Thinks that movement of hands is steps taken, WRONG. FIX THIS TOO. Pro: I haven't lost time on my fitbit, like I do with regular watches.

I've had a few fitbit watches over the years. Only recently have had problems like crazy especially with syncing. If its an issue with the fitbit then replace them not excuses they aren't compatible with newer cell phones, we paid good money for a working product & if they are under warranty replace no questions!!

Been trying to get an issue fixed where it keeps crashing when I try to upload a photo to the community but despite over a dozen support tickets, no one has helped me and the issue still isn't fixed. Also, the stats are frequently wrong, the move reminders aren't going off even half of the time since the update, and all the good helpful vids are premium. I see no reason to pay $80 a year for something that I can't even sample. They should offer one month free so ppl can see if they like it.

I received a new versa for Christmas and the app worked well for about a week or two. After updating it I now struggle to receive notifications! The notification page on my app keeps going blank and when it does show me any information it states I need to shut my phone down to receive notifications-which never happens. Not impressed at all.

First wireless I saw was a Remote Control TV.. It was mind blowing and flawless. Even Early mobiles used it to transfer contacts and basic files. When BT cam I was confused as it needed no alignment, it would break down between transfers and sometimes not searchable. Then came WiFi and then NFC and today nobody even taks of IR... Several Decades of Transformation and technological advancement on so many options, FitBit can't even master the task of Syncing devices over BT. Big disappointment and almost shameful for FITBIT to call themselves a technology company! It keeps missing data often!

Have used a Fitbit for years but like other reviewers I've suddenly had issues with the App. Can't sync my watch to the app. Have un-paired and re-paired my watch several times on bluetooth and uninstalled and reinstalled the app several times. Not happy. If this bug can't be fixed I will look elsewhere for a different fitness tracker.

Previously, I had problems synching my fitbit to my phone; but it seems this has been rectified in one of the app updates. I'm giving it 3 stars, because the messaging in the app is a joke. Bluetooth connection sucks for syncing. How old is this company that it still can't get basic sync to work properly? Fix sync bug! Yesterday!

I thought it was just me having a problem syncing to the app!! Having read the reviews there must be a problem that Fitbit seriously needs to address. Not only is my Fitbit not syncing, now my Bluetooth is not picking up my Charge 4. I've had a Charge 2 for 4 years and everything was perfect until the last year and I thought it was time to upgrade. I've had my Charge 4 for less than a month (Christmas) and the app is not syncing!! What's going on Fitbit???

I bought the Versa2 back in June & I regret it! Can't change clock faces, use music, get notifications. It's an expensive wristwatch. I've had & used Fitbit and your devices since you first arrived on the market. Loved my Blaze but it was needing daily charging. So I tried an upgrade. Either your app has gone to shite or your products have. I've factory reset, troubleshot, & done everything I could to get this device to work with the app & I regret not buying the 2 year warranty to return it.

I just got my Versa 2 for Christmas. Hubby set it up and it worked fine until I updated the tracker info as of yesterday 12/28. So for a whole 3 days it worked fine..Now I can't get any notifications sent to my watch. It keeps saying it needs a phone restart for my notifications to work with my watch, well I've restarted/turned off my phone several times and it just doesn't help.

My real complaint here is that this app tries really hard to send to send data to Facebook. Why. I block it so it doesn't go from my phone to them, but first I shouldn't have to. Second, I doubt many users really know outside a few ppl who look. This type of personal data has no business going to FB. I would uninstall the app if I didn't block traffic from my phone to FB. I don't have FB on my phone and don't consent to my personal data being sent to them for my "shadow" profile

I have used various models of Fitbits for the past 4 years and have remained brand loyal. Not anymore. I have to mess with the app and device any time I want it to sync, even though it is set to do it automatically. I have to turn off my Bluetooth, re-pair the watch and the phone and hope that works. Sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't. Now my Fitbit Aria scale is not syncing. Time to look at other options. Life is too short to waste so much time trying to get a product to work.

App itself would be reasonable and has nice features. However continuous drama syncing (or rather, not) makes it all a very inconsistent and unpleasant experience. My partner has a tomtom spark which uses the phone to USB cable to sync and this is much more stable. Jenever had any issues. My Charge 3 band got tears and broke within a year also. Warranty claim accepted online, but idle and no more updates, and no way to contact Fitbit, so been waiting for my replacement for nearly 6 months now.

Wow Fitbit, you guys have a problem that you seem to refuse to admit. Many reviewers say they lost sync a few months ago including me qand hubby on Sept 20, 2020 (Samsung and Apple). Looks like all your customer support can say is that it's the phone problem. Then you need to fix it so it works with all phones again. Very disappointing you won't admit there is a problem. Maybe tell people to have the app open (dumb!) when they do stuff. That's what we were told with our new scale.

Good when it works, but often won't sync with my device (by often I mean 2 or more times a day, every day). Just got a brand new Charge 4 and it hasn't improved this issue. They have added loads of features to the app (that no one asked for!) but they haven't got the basics right.

Used to be okay, now doesn't work. It now tells me that the service isn't running and to reboot the phone. I resolved the issue myself by reinstalling the app, but less than a day later, it breaks again. Makes the watch pretty useless and I find that I've stopped using it now. Shame because I like the watch but without the app it's not much use

Had Charge 2 for 3.5 years. Worked perfectly with previous 2 phones. Changed phone to Pixel 3XL. Worked for a while then as of 14 Dec no syncing. Followed all help and advice. Uninstalled, reinstalled, hard reset, phone on and off, bluetooth on and off. Nothing fixes it. Really cheesed off now. Noticed last bug fix 9 Dec. Wonder if something happened within that? Some error issue introduced?

Mixed feelings. Nice sleep data. However, app is full of bugs when it comes to recording exercises. Heart rate data is clearly recorded and transmitted to the app, but when you look at the exercise you recorded, it says not enough heart rate data,. This is a key feature that simply just isn't working

I have a Charge 2 synced to this app. All was well until v. recently. The app mostly syncs with the Charge 2 but I've lost call & text notifications on the watch. It seems to be a Bluetooth syncing problem. I don't know why it's suddenly become a problem but it was a must have feature. I've tried restarting/unpairing/repairing/logging out & everything else in between without success. I suspect an incompatibility with Android 11 but I've had that for a while now. Hopefully an update will fix it.

I was really happy with my Charge3 and how the app responded to it. Its performance has been throttled recently, takes several minutes to sync when five months ago it took seconds. I know there are newer models available but I should be able to continue using this one as it works for me. I do believe Apple got into quite a bit of trouble for throttling older devices. Its not going to convince me to buy a newer fitbit, its going to convince me to find a new product.

Getting very annoyed with this app and device not syncing every few weeks. It just refuses to sync and I have to unpair and set up the whole device again, losing all my data every time. This is unacceptable. I rely on this device to maintain my Vitality status, but if the data doesn't sync, it doesn't work.

Seems like I'm joining a "Fitbit with issues" club. I own a 2 y/o Charge 3 and loved it from day one. I don't profess to be super fit but after a recent update (circa early December) the Cardio Fitness went from v. vood/good to just under average overnight. I figured it was due to a refinement of product, perhaps enhanced VO2 Max but since then, no matter how many walks, runs, jogs with GPS enabled, it just won't budge from 39 - either way. Newly demoted Mr. Always Average wants to know why??

Well, at least I am not going crazy alone. My husband bought me the Versa 3 and I wanted to install a new clock face...and my fitbit is not connecting to my phone/app. It was earlier today..but not now. I can see now that this is a big issue going on with others. Hopefully these reviews are being read by people who can address and fix the problems. I would like to be able to use my new gift and have all the features work.

Over all the app can track a lot of health stats and allows you to select what you want to track. However, if you don't have internet you don't see anything, not even your own previous data. The app does not function without internet. Unfortunately that fact makes it useless to me since I don't have internet about 85% of the time. Fitbit, please let me use your app when I'm offline!

I actually loved my app and how it connects to my phone. I bought a Samsung S20 and it no longer works. My fitbit is not compatible with my phone. I don't understand how it isn't compatible with a very popular phone and received no explanation when contacting support. They acted like I should have bought a phone compatible with my fitbit !

Had charge 2,upgraded to versa lite.worked perfectly well for at least 2 mths synced every day throughout the day..no issues.Then all of a sudden it was having trouble syncing and the watch started losing time.Uninstall app,reset watch,.reinstalled app..no difference.contacted fitbit customer services-told my galaxy 10 lite does not support the fitbit app.strange cos it worked perfectly well for the first few months..gone back to charge 2..all fine with app ???

Worked super for about 10 days. Loved the information and being able to read it out more conveniently than on the Fitbit itself. BUT app is no longer syncing with device even though device is brand-new. I'll go through troubleshooting, but I'm miffed it stopped working within a fortnight. Bad programming

I love the Fitbit device, but I wish the app worked better. The tracker is incredibly buggy and has trouble syncing. I constantly behave to reset my device, the app, or my fitbit for it to sync. Sometimes I have to delete and reinstall the app. Fitbit really needs to work on it's software.

Seriously didn't have this app long enough to judge about walking/daily cardio/steps, but like the way their menstruation cycle is set up is simply ridiculous. I can't move my cycle a couple days forward cuz we haven't past those days yet, which is ridiculous af. How am I not able to set a specific date as my start of period? I can only set it if it's past already. Is weird af.

Does not sync very well with myfitnesspal. I have had Fitbit devices for years, but I've had myfitnesspal longer. I really want them to work together, but I would settle for being able to create meals in the Fitbit app. One or the other, please.

Poor. Help has poor, unclear instructions. Basics on inspire track inconsistently, ie heart rate, sleep, just stopped tracking. Unable to fix it. Such a disappointing and frustrating product. I expected this to be a reliable and easy to use piece of technology with excellent help support. I will dissuade anyone from purchase!

I was very excited to get the versa 3, however I can barely get the app to sync with device. I have unistalled over 4 times with no luck, super frustrating when I'm trying to track my activity over a week. My phone is Galaxy 9 and I'm not sure if this is some of the problem.

I've been using a Fitbit for close to 10 years and I used to have no problems with the app but now it doesn't sync properly all the time. Right now my heart rate doesn't update daily like it's supposed to. It hasn't updated since 11/18/2020 when I updated the app after I contacted support. Fitbit, you need to get it together. This is incredibly frustrating.

Brought Ace 2. Not suitable for a family situation where you have a few kids with these watches. Limited functionality. Unable to set alarms with descriptions for starting/ finishing activities ie. Make bed, brush teeth, etc. Would be nice to have a dashboard with all children and compare sleeping habits, exercise, etc. I have to login all the time to see the different children info. You also have to pay heaps for additional functionality. Thought it would be a lot better based on the reviews.

After successfully using the app for 4 yrs on two different devices for some reason it will not pair or sync with my Inspire HR. Very disappointed as all i have now is a fancy watch. I have attempted this on 4 diff devices which worked previously, i even uninstalled the app, unpaired it with no luck. ðŸ˜– god forbid I nay have to buy Google

One of the main reasons I use a fitbit is to track my heart rate, so it'd be nice if there was a better way to look at readings. It only logs it every ten minutes, so it misses spikes, and the only way to see what your rate was at a specific time is to try to hit the exact right spot in the graph. It'd be great if it captured HR more frequently and displayed them in a list as well as a graph.

Just seems to get worse and worse. Problems sync'ing despite my phone happily playing music on my BT headphones. Not showing data on the dashboard. Slow to update the week's exercise entries. Patronising wellness messages that keep coming back again and again. Endless promotion of premium services.

I would have rated this app higher but every time I use the app it freezes. Most times it freezes for almost 2 minutes & it's just not a one-time occurrence. It happens all of the time. Please fix this issue because it very annoying and irritating. I enjoy your app because it helps me talk to people who are on the same fitness journey as I am. I also like the fitness goals that your site offers. If you would fix that problem, I would definitely give you a higher rating!!

The notification service dies everytime the phone restarts. Ironically, the app shows an error saying a phone restart is needed to re-enable notifications (it doesn't help). You have to reinstall the app in order to receive notifications again. This needs to be fixed.

Have had a Fitbit for 5 years but since Oct charge 3 doesn't sync and also don't receive notifications. Contacted customer services tried to resolve issue and blamed my phone. Had same phone for last 3 years with no issues. Eventually they agreed to send me replacement but unfortunately still having same problems. Give up!!!

My Fitbit is not that old, will not keep a charge for even 24 hours, I can't swipe the screen, it freezes up so I can't turn the alarm off in the morning. It no longer alerts me of text messages. This is my fourth one. Very disappointed with it.

I use to love this app. I can't sync anymore! I've tried everything. It will not register or connect via bluetooth. Ever since I updated the app on Dec 9th, I've been having issues. Please help. I've only had my Versa 2 for 8 months.

Used to love this watch and app but recently its awful, Constantly playing with wifi, bluetooth, reloading the app on my phone or deleting everything entirely and reloading as the device stops syncing. Finally get it to sync, works for a few hours and then have to start from scratch again.

Frustrating. Can take more than half hour to sync. Will claim that Fitbit can't be found, even though every time the Fitbit is right next to the phone and working. Everything has been updated, but I haven't been able sync the device with this app for 6 days. Edit: Nov 2020. Takes at least an hour to sync. Or more.

Fitbit used to be my tracker of choice but the last one barely lasted a month before it kept steaming up whenever it was exposed to any sort of water (not swimming). Now this one won't sync and I have to keep pairing it manually every few days which kinda defeats the purpose.

I've only had the Iconic for less than a week, it has now stopped getting notifications from my phone. Thank you Update - 08.12.2020 App won't load. Have to uninstall and reinstall. Maps take forever to load.

I USED to love Fitbit!!! After one year I'm told my phone is no longer compatible. My GPS stopped working on the fitbit app., my husband and I walk the same distance, yet mine is consistently about a half mile less. Frustrating!!! When the Versa2 was purchased as an updated version to use with the fitbit app and a compatible weight loss/healthy living program it was the most amazing app!!!! Now, it isn't:( the updates don't necessarily mean better!

Nice to see a measure of my vitals that seems to be pretty reliable. This looks like it uses the same tech that O2 sensors use. I hope Fitbit figures out how to capture Oxygen levels also. 1/11/2021 I was considering buying the new fitbit with O2 sensors (pricey). However, I keep having sync problems with my charge 3 and I notice a huge audience in the forum's having same problem. I'm having to remove fitbit app and reload and restart. I will not be upgrading, fitbit is just not reliable enough.

Directions: "TO START, DOWNLOAD THE FITBIT APP." Not a good 1st impression. The charger covers it's only button & is - IMO - cumbersome & awkwardly located, with cord come straight out of back. When charging you need to hold on to it good, as it can do nothing but curl up and lay on it's side. BT kept saying you need app/account, which I reluctantly set up. By then my S9 wouldn't even recognize it. WiFi...? TWO stars b/c I told the guy I needed a SMARTwatch, & SOME undoubted operator errror.

I've had my fitbit for 3 years, I had trouble setting it up due trouble with the Bluetooth, throughout the 3 years I've had trouble syncing the watch, it won't sync in the background (despite me regularly checking the permissions) and often won't sync when I do it in app. My sister has had two, but after experiencing the same issues has switched to Garmin. The app itself is very good, but not worth it if it doesn't sync to the watch. Looking to get a new watch and won't be getting another fitbit

The two most important things about this device for me is to track my sleep and the approximate heart rate during workouts to understand how much further I can go. The heart rate monitor on my ionic is absolute trash. Yesterday was a rest day and I only left the house to get groceries and it continued to have my heart rate for most of the day above 100. The app is great for its summaries, daily and weekly. However before I got the Fitbit watch I found the app on my phone didn't record steps accurately, especially those indoors. This is why I bought the Fitbit watch which I'm very pleased with. The only inaccuracies I find are in recording sleep as it counts hours when I am wide awake but lying still in bed as light sleep.

I really like the app insight on sleeping patterns, activity, etc. I would have liked to see more scientific evidence integrated into it, more flexibility into types of challenges and interoperability with other health tracking devices (apple watch?), and give options to include other wellbeing goals (rather than only activity) amd ways to keep track of those. There might be a bug in the app (i downloaded 25th dec 2020) as I can't add friends to my network, which is a big pitfall.
