I promise I'll vote 5 stars when Fitbit gets their act together and restores functionality I love and miss.

Not accurate in my case! I have pure autonomic failure. Mu heart rate and BP jump around. I purchased the premium to track my sleeping hr. It says i am awake when i am sleeping and vice versa. Was not good for anything other than checking heartrate rise and fall and cardio minutes ect. Furthermore, I still have not seen a single way to cancel this on my android phone after trying for 3 months at $10.49/mo.

I had this since January (versa) first one I've ever had , yeah did what it said to install and worked for one day , then notifications stopped working and telling me to restart my phone to enable them ! Done this several times to no luck so now I have a glorified watch that doesn't do what it's supposed to due to an app issue. Please Fitbit sort this issue out !!

Has stopped connecting. Make the connection more stable and more frequent please please solve the issues...bad to worse with this latest update for the Ionic!! Come on Fitbit sort it out!! There are many many people having difficulties around connection and syncing. Update 6th Jan. Now connection issues predominately sorted with Ionic, the app seems to be hit and miss with a connection across different devices (not at the same time). Does the job, but still frustrated me on connection time

Got this to help with sleep but get only the basic. Tried everyting and then got scores sporadically. Two weeks now with nothing. Even tried premium which won't keep if cannot get sleep tracked. Will switch to Garmin. It worked until watch died out. Got this Inspire HR from health insurer so giving it a try. May need to suggest they go with different company. Fitbit proving not as good as used to be. Can you help me Fitbit or am I in a sea of forgotten customers? (UPDATE): Changed to the Charge 4 and even with premium I get NO SLEEP INSIGHTS. Waste of $80!! Have until January 30th to return to Best Buy. Seriously thinking of doing this and getting another, more reliable, brand that actually has sleep insights which are tracked.

When first using the app, all data synced on the first try. Now it takes multiple attempts to get it and most of the time also requires quitting and restarting the app for it to actually fully display all the data. The app also forces data to view about health tips that the user cannot turn off. The data gets repetitive that it no longer provides any value. Fitbit definitely wants the user to pay for premium service as well and won't let the user disable these ads either.

I use the app a lot and it's very useful for tracking my food and water intake. But it's really frustrating when I try to sync my Fitbit. More often than not, I'll have to try syncing it more than once, because I'll get an error message. Maybe it's because my Fitbit is a little older (I have a Blaze Classic), but I seem to recall always having trouble syncing it, even when it was new.

Have had a FitBit for about 15 months. I started with a Charge 3, went through 3 of them, each worked a while, then died, but they replaced under warranty. Now have an Ionic, it's been great, but a couple weeks ago stopped receiving notifications and stopped displaying hourly steps. Synched to Samsung Galaxy S9. Updating app today to see if that helps. So far, months later I still can't receive texts on my Ionic. Tried everything I have read. Pretty disappointed.

Provide a good basic coverage of activities etc. At times, for a non techno person person, can be little difficult to navigate. Have yet to discover, if in deed it's possible, how to access the results of other physical activities such as cycling and actually running other than through Stava and swimming which doesn't transfer to Strava at all.

When the app is working this app is great, I've just never been able to put Spotify on my versa 2 no matter how many times i log in an out on Spotify. And sometimes it'll stay synced for a long time and then it suddenly stops working and I dont get any of my notifications. So I have to delete everything and re set it like its a new device just so that im able to receive my notifications and have it synced to my phone again. Love the watch, just don't like the app that much.

So the app is ok.. it use to work really good until recently, now I have stuff missing..example when I click on my photo so I can see my profile and update my photo it's just blank.. also when I click on the fitbit section I use to be able to sync my device there and Now that's blank as well.. I have tried everything I could think of to fix this .. but No luck..

Access Denied! Unable to crop image! - on Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra Also what others seem to have experienced, it seems this only tracks my steps and everything else is just manual input? Calorie burning seems estimated and not something my body has actually burned, in my opinion that is. I wish the Spotify app on the fitbit could play the music on my Bluetooth headset, but it seems to only prompt my smart home devices to do so.

Worked great when I first got it. But now I won't receive message alerts ect on my watch... Go to the app, says it needs a phone reset. Do that still nothing. Only seems to work when I delete the app and reinstall it. But it will only work for a day then goes back to saying needs a phone reset. I also have the versa 2.

Widget doesn't sync steps accurately anymore (since about Aug 2020). Sleep information isn't really accurate, or that valuable because it doesn't tell you how to improve any of your results, and you can have the absolute worst sleep and still score above 80. I'm disappointed that the leader in this space hasn't nailed it down yet for the things most people are buying them to track. Had premium for half a year and didn't include anything better. Considering an Oura Ring instead.

Really not worth getting premium. Not enough challenges to do with friends except for workweek hustle.. and that can be done for free They should have made the challenges for friends free. Why pay for the Fitbit and then charge to do the challenges.. I do like that I can challenge friends but come out with more challenges and those virtual ones as well where you climb mountains. But do it for other cities and trails Overall it is good.

I have the Inspire HR and recently received the Inspire 2. The app is not allowing me to add a 2nd device. I originally had 2 devices on the app. Why am I not able to do so now? Please fix it. Also...it was working well until recently. Whatever you did, you screwed up because it won't sync unless you physically sync it yourself. This glitch has been going on for a few months. For these two reasons I've had to reduce my approval of this app.

Love the way I can keep track of fitness and heart health. Unfortunately, the face is deteriorating after only one and a half years, pale lines have appeared around the edges, which, according to customer reviews means the fitbit is breaking. A very expensive bit of kit, if it needs replacing this often.

YOU NEED TO FIX THIS APP. Every day I missing one hour active on the app with my fitbit says I didn't miss it I don't understand what's going on. I restart, refresh, etc. I don't understand what going on. I would rate it a 2 but I cant edit my stars. I'm extremely mad especially since fitbit is a major corporation.

I enjoy my new fitbit but have had a few issues. 1. Can't add or accept friends, in the app or browser, by username or email. 2. App crashes when I try to share a picture with the community on the app. 3. I can't vote on feature selections on the browser. I have tried contacting support but nothing fixes the issues.

I'm over the fitbit disconnecting with my phone. I try to sync it but there is always difficulties. I've troubleshooted many times by deleting the fitbit and app and trying to set it up again. It works for a day or 2 then it cannot find it. Drives me insane. I think what is the point in having one when there is no record of my steps etc as it won't connect. Never had a problem when I had an iPhone but for the last 2 years with a Samsung galaxy nothing but issues.

For my specific usage, I feel that this app/product is as amazing as it is bad. Several features are super cool and if you get nerdy about data like I do, then there is much to glean from the app. However, there are some areas for improvement. 1) it's not very good at working 100% of the way through bike rides. Feels like I need to have the app open and screen unlocked? 2) I'd like all the add-ons included in the watch price. 3) Dark patterns Big buttons to purchase add-ons, with tiny x to exit

More and more I think fitbit slows their products in the hopes you'll buy a new product too replace the one that didn't work as well as it used to. I got the versa 2 as a gift from my bf 2 years ago and suddenly it doesn't function as well as it used to and their customer service is a joke anymore sometimes. Smh..

Ive had this alta for 3 years and it has worked perfectly until now. It will not retain a charge. At 75% it just dies and no amount of screen tapping will turn it on. I have tried resetting it and i have left it on the charger for 12 hours and it still just quits once it gets to 75%. I cant use it to track anything anymore. Either i leave it to charge at night and lose out on sleep tracking, or i have it charge all day and lose out on step tracking and exercise tracking. Really disappointed.

The app is overall really nice and a great way to track your steps, water and food. It even tracks the female cycle which I thought was cool. There are more features that you can use but I don't really use them. I don't like that recently there is a glitch and it doesn't report the data I've exercised. I hope they fix that soon.

I find the contrast of the screen not strong enough. Even on overcast day it's impossible to easily read. At normal setting. It doesn't always show clock when I want to check the time, screen stays blank. When swimming it sometimes just changes to a different screen. I like it only has to be charged once a week. And that I receive an email every week to report my progress

Disappointing to pay $500 for a Fitbit Sense only to find that in order to access the health services I bought it for I am expected to pay to get them. Bluetooth is on all the time on my phone but syncing my phone, Huawei P30, with my watch is as slow as a wet week despite them being about 10cms apart. My freeby Huawei watch was much easier to set up with many free different watch faces to choose from. Very disappointed.

Since the upgrade and adding the Ace for my child I was never able to get my Charge 3 to stay synced. I finally gave up on that watch and got a Blaze. It works much better. 12/10/19 Since the recent update my app keeps closing down having to be reopened when I first access it. 1/12/21I got the Sense e d of December so far so good.

Initially, this app was wonderfull to use. Setup was easy, changing settings was easy, but now after a few days this app has been terrible. Notifications stopped working, the battery always says it's full even if i restart both devices, and it doesn't even send a password reset email! Terrible.

I've only had my Fitbit since Christmas and have had to reinstall the app every time it needs charging (so every 4 days) because it errors and can't sync any notifications (calls, texts, emails). It was annoying the first time as the error on the app says to restart your phone.. and that didn't work. Once I figured out the issue was the app, it's just frustrating and a pain. Aside from that everything else seems to work

Note to the fitbit devs: "bedtime reminder" doesnt work on ALL fitbit devices...well it doesn:t seem to be working on the Charge 3 (my brothers) or charge 4 (mine) someone needs to fix that pronto! Im pretty sure every one else would agree if im not mistaken. I know im getting notifications on my phone for bed yime reminders. But not on my watch! ðŸ˜¤

Making part of the functionality of the device dependant on purchasing an extension to the app feels like a rip-off. It's like buying a car but not being able to use 4th gear unless you pay extra. If I've bought a top-of-the-range model at top-of-the-range prices surely the full functionality of the device should be included.

App could be better, especially how you buy clock themes I bought one and I still haven't figure out how to get my pictures to load on it... which I'm sure will just take me a min extra to figure it out but somethings just could be cooler for a watch you can't get on Facebook with and paid near 300 bucks for. I LOVED my fitbit blaze and the versa 3 is not eh the blaze lol. I'm sure after a few months I'll love it but I am not fond of the style or the actual way it works....

Does not always vibrate to remind me to do 250 steps, which makes it difficult to achieve that particular goal each day. The sleep info is often way off with the timing and you are expected to pay for the full information. I don't feel inclined to pay extra when the basics are so unreliable.

The exercise, heartrate, and water tracking are great. But the petiod tracker is 100% useless. The only people who can use it are those with regular menstral cycles. Not at all helpful for anyone who is trying to track irregular cycles, or anyone who is premenopausal. Dear FitBit - not all menstral cycles fall within your predetermined minimum or maximum lengths

I had some issues with my Sense not syncing at first but when I got them figured out(I'm not sure how I did it tho), I'm loving this thing! I wish there was a way to log blood pressure and blood sugar manually, like I do my temperature...would sure make Dr. appointments go smoother. Maybe that's something for the developers to think about.

I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars. Once in the flow of it it is fine, but set up isn't the most intuitive user design. I had to Google a few forums to find missing steps. Calorie logging could also be better. So far I havent had any bar codes work (do they have UK bar codes??) I'd really love to request a way to save your common meals / recipes so calorie logging is just a few taps instead of logging every ingredient every time. (Take note from Nutracheck app's easy calorie count design).

Beautiful design, mediocre buggy programming! I've used this daily for 2 years and (as an ex-professional lead programmer) I can see issue after issue caused by code errors. So I've kept everything simple for it, and it functions adequately. The interface design is excellent.

Monitors everything but menstrual cycle accurately. It won't save changes to a cycle, or if it does, it won't delete the previous one, so they overlap, but makes it look like 2. I can't add additional cycles manually, it ignores that too. I recognize this is not the sole feature of this app, but when it did work, it was fairly accurate, and predictions would change according to past results. The cycle could be easily changed, and it would update in real time to try and be more accurate.

Won't stay synced to my Samsung S20 FE 5G, very upset I've tried everything even reset everything twice and it will not only stay synced with my data where I have to go into the app to update my HR etc but it also won't start synced to the Bluetooth of my phone which I think is causing the sync lag between the phone and app. Fitbit needs to update it with Samsung product usage. Also upset it won't share data with my S Health but will with apple Health.

It will not sync with the tracker for hours. Most of the time it cannot find the tracker. It used to be much better. Since my last post, this app had done better for a little while. it still took a while to sync, but it had not taken hours. Now it is doing worse, it is the same problem again. Most of the issues occur because it cannot find the tracker.

The syncing issue is frustrating to say the least. Even more so because it seems like this has been a Fitbit issue for a long time across many devices. Every few days I need to restart my phone to restore sync. Every 2-4 weeks I have to delete my device from my account and redo setup to restore sync. It's unclear if this is an app issue or something with the device itself. It's very clear this is a widespread issue that I've yet to see Fitbit acknowledge on the help forums.

I appreciate the fact that the app can help with movement, water, and food reminders but the fact that it requires full GPS and location services makes me wildly uncomfortable. I also had to delete and reinstall the app for my fitbit to sync after a few days of it refusing to sync.

Good app, doesn't really work though.. I consistently have issues where it doesnt say i hit my mileage goal on the at a glance but in the graph it does. It also will NOT let me remove my old broken fitbit. My user account page is refusing to ever open as well. Other than these issues, pretty decent

Good features - when they work. For example, heart rate is recorded if you just go for a walk or run, but if you tell it you're going for a walk or run it's not - but it is if you tell it you're doing intervals. Many small issues like this, which they were slow to respond to earlier, but since acquisition by Google nothing is done at all. For my purposes it does alright, but I certainly veonybbe upgrading to the new $500 watch.

The app was great 2 years ago when I first got my Versa. Now I have to sync my watch multiple times to see what my stats are. There are other bluetooth connectivity issues that have come along the way as well. Very frustrating.

Im new to Fitbit and I quite like the app when it works as it should. I'm constantly having issues with my new versa 3 syncing and when I click into notifications it always says I need to restart my phone, and when I do it just says the same. I've only just got this at Christmas and like I said I'm new to it so thought it was just me, but reading the reviews this is clearly not a single occurance..Got round the restart issue I've found clearing the app data fixes this but I should not have to

This app needs to be able to control brightness setting on tracker. Every time I update the app, my tracker goes to dim. (So dim I can't see it except in complete darkness.) My eye sight is not the greatest so I can't scroll through the micro print menu to find the settings to adjust it.

Just bought a Fitbit Sense which I was excited about. So come to Google Play to download the app as I was told by the instructions, and apparently I can't download to my computer because it already has the app associated to my Cell phone, and LG K20V. No worries I think. I go ahead and redownload it to my phone, and after logging in it still had my information from a few years back when I had the Blaze. So I follow the remaining instructions to sync to device and it doesn't work. I go through all the recommendations like turn off/on Bluetooth, rebooting phone, etc. and it is still the same. Go to the Fitbit site, and maybe there is a compatibility issue which makes me go huh? Syncing a device should not be this difficult. Also stressing the fact Fitbit gives barebones instructions on how to even use the watch. So there's that also. Update: Just work with support via chat, and they were helpful in getting my Fitbit to now sync up. So I changed my rating from 1 star to 3.

I love the app, but as another reviewer commented, I've had to unpair my Versa 2 and start over multiple times to get it to sync. It is very frustrating. This time, I can't even get it to re-connect after it finds my watch. I've restarted both devices, restarted bluetooth, everything listed in the troubleshooting list. I'm sad. I really appreciated the accountability.

Been using Fitbit for years and it's been great. The past few years the app seems to get worse with each update. It's frequently buggy and syncing has been more difficult than it should be or used to be. Too many times of having to uninstall/reinstall, reset my fb, force stop the app, etc. as of late. Also, weird inconsistency- in challenges- there's a character limit on posts using android, but doesn't seem to be the case with ipad.

I do like the app, but have a few niggles... Why is there no dark mode when this is common place among many UIs now? Also, I can rearrange my apps on my Sense, but not via the app... but being able to do this via the app would be more useful (and much quicker!) As one of many diabetics in the world, fitbit clocks which allow glucose data to be shown from cgm data would be so appreciated!

I have had a few fitbit devices over the last 4yrs but the last 7mths I have been having issues with it not syncing up to my phone, and not receiving the notifications on the watch like text messages or calls, and I don't understand why, I have loved my fitbit but getting annoyed with it now not syncing

I would have given 5 stars, but the sync function is unreliable. It usually works; but it frequently stops working for a day, several days, or over a week at a time. AFAIK, the problem originates with the Fitbit servers, rather than the app itself, but it is all part of one system, and the unreliable synchronization function needs fixing.

I wouldn't bother with Premium. The features you get are not worth the price. I also find it wierd you can't quickly link to all your favourites from the home page, rather have to go into each section (i.e. Mindfulness) and then find your favs in that section, it's a wierd flow. It's super annoying that calories won't update to kj on the watch itself when everything else will sync to metric. Very much aimed at a US market in that way. There is a world outside of silly imperial!

Spotify, pandora, or deezer. You MUST have OR agree to a premium account to use with your Fitbit. I use Amazon music; cheaper & more music choices to hear before you have to upgrade, like with Spotify. And don't be fooled, like I was, that just because the sense/fitbit can connect to and use Alexa 'commands', Amazon music is NOT available for this app. And there went half of the reason I chose fitbit over other wearables. So far, I'm unhappy with my purchase for this & many other reasons.

Setting up the fitbit is not a straight forward effort. The watch takes hours to download the needed software resulting in making the user think they have done something incorrectly. There is no update to tell you how much longer it will take to complete.

Worked perfect until a week ago, then it stopped syncing and the hour started running behind which made me late for multiple meetings. I have always relied on my versa and it has never failed me. But I don't know what happened last week that caused this issue. I read through previous reviews & the FAQ's in the app, I've tried everything and it still won't sync or update the time as before. I haven't changed phones, I haven't dropped it, I don't know what is wrong with it. Stressful!

This used to be great but since last update it has become very unreliable. It now takes quite a while to sync and sometimes doesn't sync for the whole day. As I write it has crashed and won't open at all. I have put a fitbit upgrade on my Christmas list but am thinking of swapping to another brand as it's so annoying.

I just did the update and now my Fitbit Versa will not sync. I have spent over an hour and a half trying to get it to sync. Turn off Bluetooth turn it back on turn off location turn it back on, uninstall the app reinstall. I give up. This is the second Fitbit I have owned.

Sleep tracking is fairly accurate. Although, the step/calorie counter are a little to generous. All in all, its a decent measure of daily metrics which provides awareness and helps to encourage a healthier life style. I do find the watch gives me a rash on my wrirst if I wear it to much which is disappointing.

Overall works well. The only complaint is regarding heart rate and calorie count during outdoor biking. The are both too low. I have compared it with two other apps and devices and for bit versa and this app are significantly lower on there recording. The other two apps and devices are very close to each other

When it's working, it's fab. Unfortunately, it keeps stopping syncing with my versa 3 and then you have to jump through hoops to get it working again. Frankly, don't bother downloading until this issue is fixed. According to online forums, this is a well known problem but Fitbit don't seem interested in resolving this. Really poor Fitbit, get your house in order.

Not having the best experience with Fitbit. My charge 3 won't sync. Been through the customer service Chat more than once. But when it doesn't sync, the watch doesn't show the right time. 2021, and technology can't make a digital watch work.

Fitbit Versa 2 keeps telling me to update my tracker even after I've updated and restarted my phone. This has been going on for several months now. Plus, still not so happy about how quickly the battery drains even after turning off notifications, keeping it on sleep mode 24/7, etc. Versa 1 battery lasted a lot longer even with notifications turned on. However, I do love the food logging feature on the app.

Love the app but I still can't access Google Assistant. It's supposed to be available in the UK but it says it isn't. Tried the fix just to set regions to US. But then it tells me that it doesn't support my language even though I also set that to English (us) on my Google account and deleted all my cached data (I do that regularly anyway). Fitbit haven't even released that there's a problem or when it will be fixed which is a pain.

With fitbit smart watches like Sence hitting the $300 dollar mark I expect the top of the line fitness app that goes with it to at least have a place you can manually enter and track your blood pressure even if the device you use doesn't support automatic detection. It would be great if you could automatically record your weight from the Fitbit branded scale without first having to open the Fitbit app on your phone.

I was very excited when I purchased this a few days ago. At first all seemed well, but then I immediately ran into issues. Spotify, the weather app, notifications and settings also do not work. The device will not pair with my phone at all. Will likely be returning this to get my $ back.

Its good for having everything in one place but the food log is severely lacking compared to apps like myfitnesspal. Would be nice to be able to access more recently logged items or add multiple items at once. Love the reminders, linked articles, & fitness exercises for paid users but hate having to use a separate app for exercise, being forced to download each video. My favorite part is gps tracking for jogging & auto recognized activity. App works well with the tracker but needs an upgrade.

Still like owning my fitbit for tracking, absolutely do not like the customer service!!! My new phone and my charge 2 do not sync without me telling it to many times. Fitbit has offered NO help and says it's my phone being the only phone type that has this issue. It's a new phone, it's not google it's Fitbit. Sadly I really don't enjoy my fitbit anymore.

I don't think it counts steps accurately. I can just swing my hand and it counts or when I don't swing my hand but I am actually walking and making steps it doesn't count steps. Plus, I wonder if it measures my heart rate accurately. I'll be sitting and it shows my heart rate is 151 and I feel nothing. I don't think it's right!

Would be a much better experience for users if they would actually allow two watches to be synced to one account. I have two fitbits and like to wear one for some occasions and the other at different times. Now I have to choose between the two which is disappointing and really not great for their business model and their sales!!!

Overall this app has worked pretty well, but it doesn't sync data from my fitbit to the app as quickly as it used to. 6 months ago the period tracker also stopped saving any symptom details. I can click the save button but nothing happens. There doesn't seem to be any support for issues like this- I couldn't find fixes anywhere.

I'm so sick of trying to figure this thing out. I cant update the time. It wont sync at all. The notifications are all over the place with things I havent programmed for it to remind me of. I see others are having difficulty as well. Maybe an update is needed. ðŸ¤·ðŸ½â€â™€ï¸

I haven't been able to open the app since Wednesday. Every time I try, it crashes. I've turned the Bluetooth on and off, uninstalled and reinstalled the app, and nothing. EDIT: Once I upgraded my phone, I didn't have any problems syncing (until recently, when my fitbit's bluetooth connectivity failed), so I've upgraded my tracker too! We'll see how it goes!

Things had been working great between the app & my Charge 4. But when they did an update & added the sun & moon graphics (which are childish & unnecessary) to the sleep info, I now have all kinds of issues getting my app to sync. It never syncs on it's own at all. Daily, I have to turn off bluetooth & turn it back on, or completely restart my phone then manually sync.It can takes 4-5 attempts. (And consider removing the sun and moon.Serves no purpose & really "junks up" the sleep info screen)

Overall and especially if you're just starting on your fitness journey this app works OK. I find the female health feature is very good. The sleep tracking feature also works well. Things that don't work so well; you can't accurately input your weight to a decimal point, it will only allow you to do it to the nearest pound which isn't that great. The GPS drops out frequently if going for a run and so doesn't record distance. Calorie recording is a faff and there aren't many foods in the records.

Nice app, when it works. Most of the time recently it tells me there is no internet connection (lies) and when I search online for an answer, I'm given a long, complex troubleshooting procedure. Why not just fix the issue? No other bluetooth device I own has his issue. P.S. whenever it does work, I had just left it alone for half a day and tried again, so the troubleshooting procedure wasn't what fixed it.
Great app when it works, always seem to have issue with notifications. Keep getting message to restart phone. Still doesn't seem to fix the issue.
A "dark theme" option would be hit appreciate
It works pretty well. I don't like that you need to share your location to update. And I am thinking of dumping it now that Google has bought them. My privacy is important and I don't trust Google.

Used to be great...now not so much. I had the charge 2 for three years, loved this app and the device. Upgraded to the versa 2 which is so colorful and fun. But the app crashes at least twice a week since December 2020, the versa un syncs, the alexa only works about 25% of the time. I'm feeling regrets over this. Google can you please fix this app or everyone is going to jump ship from fitbit.
Ever since I have gotten a new phone I have had to delete and reinstall in st least 4x. It currently is pending download now. I don't know if it is the phone or the Fitbit.
Spotty, but good when it works.
Takes longer then I thought to set up
Could be a lot better. There is no comparison to what other people have achieved. I used to have a fitbit strap and found comparisons to other people really usefull to set standards etc
Good thank you.
Took premium trial. Decided I didnt want it but now I cannot get it cancelled.
It ok. Just ok.

I have been a fitbit user for over 6 years. I got a Versa 2 a few weeks ago, this is the first watch that has had trouble syncing, I occasionally get messages or phone calls sent to my watch when it is set up for me to receive them. I keep holding out hope that it will get better but I'm not sure. I may have to look into other options which is so sad and a waste of time and money.
I have to uninstall the app for the notification appear
It doesn't allow me to enter blood pressure measurements, so I bought a different watch.
The fitbit app is good just wish the premium was a little less because doing the trial it did offer enough for the price.
Worked great apart from no way to input blood pressure. Now spotify no longer connects. Waiting for the next update to see if that fixes it again.
Takes a while to catch up to activities

Overall good experience. But the app is glitchy, particularly with the sleep mode. I use it every night and in morning, when I try to see the summary, I get an unending spinning wheel for hours. When I use the back button to stop it, it tells me, every day, that there was an error and my sleep wasn't recorded. But then I see it *was* recorded, but those numbers dont match what was on the initial display, so it's not helping at all. Except for that, though, the app is useful and effective.
I feel that it can do more but it will cost a monthly fee. That is not worth it.
The app keeps crashing and will not open i have had to uninstall and reinstall to get it to work it is a real pain ðŸ˜«
Pretty poor as apps go, especially premium types. slow to update, often wrong. Oh and the layout is a mess.
Goid would be better if didnt have to pay for premium
Always have problems syncing
Always have problems with syncing and sometimes it will not record my walks and runs.

Mixed reviews on this app. I've had to refresh the app quite a bit in the last few weeks as it has skewed my distance. This morning it told me I had done 9 km by 7 am, which was amazing considering I had barely walked farther than my back alley with the dog. **update my fitbit has died. But my app still thinks I'm wearing it and tracks anywhere from 350 to 800 steps a day, despite not wearing it and it not being connected. Its like a phantom fitbit. Ooooo..

Just bought a Fitbit Sense which I was excited about. So I follow the remaining instructions to sync to device and it doesn't work. I go through all the recommendations like turn off/on Bluetooth, rebooting phone, etc. and it is still the same. I like the app and have been using it for years but it won't change measurement types (e.g. grams to servings or ounces) so I have to switch between the app and log into Fitbit on my laptop to do this. Customer service stinks, they answer the one question and drop the call. Don't give you a chance to ask another question.

Generally like, unfortunately petting my dog counts as steps, the menstrual tracker is broken & following directions to fix did not work, watch band with specific holes has it as either too tight or too loose.

Ok, but really needs a dark mode.
Maybe ok. I'm using my wife's older Fitbit because it broke and we bought her a new one, but it's not really broken. I'd be much more excited about it if it was made by Casio as a "square."

Not accurate in my case! I have pure autonomic failure. Mu heart rate and BP jump around. I purchased the premium to track my sleeping hr. It says i am awake when i am sleeping and vice versa. Was not good for anything other than checking heartrate rise and fall and cardio minutes ect. Furthermore, I still have not seen a single way to cancel this on my android phone after trying for 3 months at $10.49/mo.

It basically does the job, but not accurately. The user interface is messy, ugly, and hard to use. Update on 11/20/19: it's getting even worse. Sometime it simply does not work. A big bloatware. I am lowering it from 3 star to one. Update on 11/25/19: after updating the software, it works again, but I have to drag from the screen down for a couple of times to sync. 3 star again. Update on 1/15/21: Not sure why Google wanted to buy it. Hardware and software, neither one is good.
Really good app but it's not syncing with my phone lately and I've tried literally everything. Thinking of going back to my galaxy watch...

Sleep evaluatipn is all screwed up. Calculating distances is not right either. Time is fine. Fun tto see calories, steps. Pulse ok i think.

Now that Fitbit has been acquired by Google, all makes sense to me and explains why we are not able to sync anymore or it is random, when you are lucky. I'm pretty sure everything will be sorted soon, by Google.
Everything is need for paying

Is generally good. No noise, and no blame for being lazy - thank you for that. Buy can you please remove the damn notifications that appear everytime i open the app? Even the first screenshot here on Google play has one... Why, just why!?
Some things are harder to figure out how to use.

I have an inspire HR. It has worked great for the last couple years as it tells me by heart rate, sleeping patterns etc. I haven't had any problems with it, and have used it daily for recording my activities. However recently (Jan 5 2021), the Fitbit won't stay connected to my phone via Bluetooth for the GPS (OnePlus 5t) while I do exercise. It also struggles to sync with my phone on occasion. I've tried resetting the inspire HR, and reinstalling the Fitbit app among other things to no avail

They need to add more exercise activities to choose from. There's no generic cardio workout to choose from on my Inspire HR. If you do anything other than running, biking, walking or swimming you have no way to track it/log it.
Google has closed it's aquisition with fitbit, probably why it's not syncing anymore? Never had any problems till the last update.
Its okay. Like I can track my steps, water and sleep. But its hard to find all my apps. Like turn on this messaging app or even as simple as me wanting to change my clock face. Its annoying.
Worked fine till recently. Now fitbit won't sync no matter what I do. Reset, turn phone off etc

No dark mode

"Notification service is not running. A phone restart is required to re-enable notifications on your tracker" (Versa 3). Restarting the phone does not resolve this - it seems you need to clear data/storage for the app every few days? Mostly user-friendly app. After I go for a run, I can only see the number of minutes I was running for, not the full time (e.g. 23:47). This is only visible in Strava. If these were resolved, it would be much better.
It's hard to use but great app!!

Disappointing to pay $500 for a Fitbit Sense only to find that in order to access the health services I bought it for I am expected to pay to get them. Bluetooth is on all the time on my phone but syncing my phone, Huawei P30, with my watch is as slow as a wet week despite them being about 10cms apart. My freeby Huawei watch was much easier to set up with many free different watch faces to choose from. Very disappointed.

Great app but Premium subscription way too expensive. Needs sub options so I can pay for what I want and ignore what I don't. As it stands they won't get a cent out of me. Now they are owned by Google it must be time to think out of the box and make subscriptions a lot more attractive. Their previous reply simply confirmed it was a bot that didn't understand the proposition.

Little disapointed... I have used fitbit for years now and like a lot of info it gives me. Recently got into exercise in a more focused way. I am trying to find out whay my personal best time for a mile run was and thought it would be simple, but .... I couldn't. It logs everything but the only way I have found so far see my work out is one at time in scrolling down and manually looking. Maybe I am not looking in the right place. Personal best stats. Where are they? I wanna track progress.

Integrates very nicely with my health and fitness management. I like the sleep-management (this is the app with the best in class sleep management information), exercise, and diet and weight tracking. The only shortcoming is that there is not a place to log my blood preasure. Otherwise, excellent app - I will not be moving away anytime soon.

I don't understand why there isn't dark mode. Dark mode would be incredibly useful for a variety of reasons. Some people jog at night and it's glaringly bright. Then when your eyes move back to where you're running, your eyes have to readjust. There are also functions in the app that are specific to night time (bedtime meditation) which make looking at the screen physically uncomfortable. Almost every other app has a dark mode option, let's get with the times, Fitbit developers.

I find it a bit tricky to navigate between the tracker, the stats, and premium, everything just seems a bit overcomplicqted and not consistent even in design, also still haven't found the SpO2 data which supposed to be in the 'Health measures' stats, I can't seem to find any section called like that either. Apart from this I enjoy using the tracker and hopefully will get a better understanding over the app as well with time.

The app on my phone is great. Keeps track of my activities and sleep. However. I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because, ever since the last software update thru the app, my fitbit has lost its swipe functionality several times requiring me to restart it. Although I have found using the manual button works just fine and phone swipe with no issues.

Update: watch synchs with phone now but no longer alerts for calls and messages. Since update I have not been able to sync phone and watch. This has been a great app.until now. I have worn a fitbit for 4 years. My versa now acts like it has lost its mind. Since the app is required for set up and keeping history, my versa is useless except for counting steps. It will still do that. It won't sync with phone or tablet or daughters phone. Fitbit is a great product.

It stopped working since yesterday I just thought it was a glitch but no it wasn't I didn't get any notifications from my apps, then after that it said "fitbit unavailable to work right now" so I went on the app store to see if there was a update, there wasn't after that I checked to see if it working now but it just didn't let me in for almost 10 minutes 10 LONG MINUTES i don't know whats wrong but please just fix it. Oh and I can't sync it anymore soo I don't know what I'm going to do anymore.

It's ok, but even though the past few versions have started to account for anaerobic workouts in terms of " "steps" it isn't entirely accurate. Furthermore, it doesn't account for the total number of mins active. A 45-50 mins intense weight training session clocks up only 15-20 mins in "minutes active" (which quite possibly also includes the walk to/from the gym). Also, it doesn't marks this towards the 4 days/week goal in the "Track your exercise" section.

I am so frustrated with this, I was annoyed when I stopped getting notifications on my FitBit from my Android phone but now the app on my phone can't even detect my FitBit this is completely unacceptable and to think I was going to start paying for FitBit premium. I have updated my rating, there were updates made and now everything is working well. I am now a premium member as well. Just wish I had all of the premium options without needing to buy a newer version and more expensive watch.

This app motivates me so much through being able to see my progress and compete with my family and friends. The reason I only gave 4 stars is that it is such a pain to reconnect. I cannot use my bluetooth earbuds because it took forget my device and starting new after I used my earbuds. I recently got a new phone and It was a pain to get it set up and i basically had to make it forget my Fitbit then reconnect as a new device before i could start using it again. Even now the syncing isnt constant

I like this app for the things it does but not necessarily for the way it does them. Entering data is mainly easy but on my One Plus 6T it stutters sometimes when you are changing data and keeps reverting to the original version (e.g. changing the amount of a food you ate.) The support team are excellent and very speedy in responding. UPDATE DEC20: Still no improvement, still lots of lag on the phone app. Also, the different versions of this app (Android mobile, Android Chromebook, Windows desktop) are very different with quite different functionality (e.g. you can only "favourite" a food in the Windows desktop version. Crazy. And they are not called favourites in the mobile version, where they are called "my foods." Lazy design.) Having said that, this is still the best app around at coordinating all your food, sleep and fitness information. I just wish someone would sort out all the bugs and design inconsistencies. Maybe Google will sort it out.

Only issue I'm having is an error with the sleep log. After pressing the "View Details" button, the circle never stops spinning. When I exit that screen, error message occurs, "Unable to record on server" or something like that. The full sleep time isn't being recorded. Seems to always be missing about 45 mins to 1 hour.

The App has been working for me for the last 4 years but since mid Dec 2020 I am not able to view the graph of my heart rate. I am also not able to view the details of my Ionic Fitbit device. I suspect that the December 2020 update to the App was the issue and should be addressed. Solution: I have cleared data from the app under settings > storage> cleare data and logged in a fresh and now everything is working.

Really enjoy the sleep tracking. See your sleep in a whole new light. Also just having it is passively making me more mindful of getting to bed earlier, Or go for a walk after sitting down for prolonged periods of time. Fitbit still has plenty of room to grow. Looking forward to future models

Syncing issues. Got a fitbit sense, and the onboarding experience was pretty disjointed. Also, can't seems to sync after the initial setup and the Sense doesn't seem to track sleep either. All the steps to sync it are to turn off/turn on Bluetooth/app/phone/device, none of which works. Oh and you contact customer service via Twitter... Yeaaaaah.... Edit: factory reset and syncs working... Sleep tracking working too.

Great app overall. Wish food tracking had a few more features. If they could add a section for meals that would help. A lot of people eat the same thing for breakfast or lunch everyday and it would be great to be able to enter those calories as a recent meal instead of individual recent foods.

I have a basic Flex 2. Often, is takes up to 5 min to sync. I know someone else with the same experience, so I know it isn't just me. Also, it doesn't keep track of how many stairs I climb. Other than those, it is great. Very easy to navigate. I happen to like basic and easy when it comes to tech.

This is my third fitbit. I don't subscribe to the premium option but I get all the info I need. I'm not always sure that it detects my heart rate accurately. I think it might actually be higher than what the fitbit says. I like I can customize the app and the clock face has more options. I would buy another fitbit.

Sometimes the app doesn't always record my amount of sleep correctly. Even though the Charge 3 and my phone connects using Bluetooth, I have to connect via internet first before they can connect. Not sure if there is an option to change that or not. Those are the only things that disappoint me. I love that it will provide my heart rate, time, and steps in real time. I use the timer often when baking. I like the weather information too. Yes I do recommend this product

I've been using this app and my charge 3 for roughly two years now, and honestly, I have enjoyed both immensely despite the odd glitch. With my old p20 pro, syncing could be a bit of a headache (but a lot of things were wrong with that phone). Transferring over to my tablet was surprisingly easy, though I lost the ability to customize watch faces. And transferring to my new Velvet, again was very easy. I still can't change watch faces on my charge 3, but everything else works as it should.

New to fitbit but I've have had Samsung smart watches in the past. So far I found the app a little confusing to navigate around. A little trouble syncing my new Inspire HR with my Samsung S20 after an hour of trying, it finally synced. The most annoying aspect is you have to turn location on to sync every single time. Every now and then the app crashes when going to community tab. I wish fitbit would put a simple touch button for water intake tracking!

Good app. I know that the Fitbit device does not do or have blood pressure monitoring which I can live with, but I don't understand why there is no feature where you can just simply log your blood pressure, just like how you can do so with your weight. ðŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸ Unless I've missed something, please add this, and that last star will light up on the rating. Thanks.

Slow to connect. awkward to navigate some screens. Edits of data are a little confusing. Some reported data doesn't make sense to me. Update Dec 2020. Things are better now. Loading of data from Fitbit is a little faster. Maybe I got use to how to edit data but I can adjust items easier. Giving them another star.

I have a basic version of the app it tells how many steps you've done, many minutes exercise and over night how many times you woken or being Restless. I am happy with it It keeps me on track without stressing me out. My sister has fancer version: she gets information that gives her a percentage rating on her sleep performed according to her age group. Give me the basics and a peaceful night sleep without being measured and compared to the performance of others on a range of data.

Don't use it too it's full potential but I enjoy tracking my steps. The sleep section is not very accurate, I'm definitely asleep long before it says. I love the group option! Joined a group with family and proud to say I beat my kids daily with steps and the chat gives me the ability to nag them about not doing enough steps .

Keeps me on track, however, I don't always believe some of the sleep results. Inspire HR has helped me get on board to a healthier lifestyle by prompting me to be more active - almost like a game to keep me going. It is compact and waterproof. In the first few months of using the watch I lost the ability to scroll through screens at times. Easy fix by connecting to charger until you see the happy face. This issue hasn't happened in months. I've not had any issues since.

I've used this app with Flex and Inspire, and it's worked relatively well. I use my tracker mainly as an alarm clock and the app has trouble deleting alarms occasionally. They stay visible, but unaccessible. I wouldn't mind that, but the app counts those undeleted alarms into the max, limiting the number of alarms that can be programmed in. Support said the only way to delete them is to unistall the app, which isn't exactly convenient.

It's nice to track your movements throughout the day. But it always has problems sinking with the fitbit. Every night I have to check it and sometimes it's right but most of the time it connected earlier in the morning but wants permission to connect at night. Usually around midnight. Sometimes I forget and it resets its self for the next day.

promising, but easy access to a user guide leads to frustration. in time, i expect to be very happy. Today, getting it to track my bike ride, not my walk did not work. Nor did the GPS perform as I planned. My 18 km bike ride turned into 2250 steps and GPS didnt report any results. I have a learning curve ahead. Six months later, I'm happy with my Fitbit. I like the feedback and encouragement I get every day.

The app is fine except when it comes to premium. The price of premium is quite high. The ads show xxx amount of apps you can get on Fitbit but that is not the case for the regular app. To get apps needed, one must pay for premium or not have the apps shown in the ads.

Great for monitoring my sleep and making sure am active (when I can!). Like the watch as well which I can style to my liking. Plus it glows in the dark. Can take a bit of getting used to when sleeping as it's slightly raised, I also loosen the strap so it's not too tight on my wrist. It doesn't "sweat" either during the day, maybe due to the material it's made from. Just beware not to apply moisturisers to the strap! Thus caused mine to slip out of the clasp and risk unclasping and falling off.

I love my Fitbit, but the app still has some issues, although to be fair, most get fixed relatively quickly. For example, when syncing my Charge 4, I can't immediately see my sleep data on the main screen until I go into the sleep section, view it there, then exit for it to show up. There are also times where the notifications I receive don't correspond to the notifications I've selected to receive. BUT I use it every day so maybe I see more issues than an average user.

As other reviewers have mentioned, it appears that one of the most recent app updates completely ruined the notification system. I've followed every single troubleshooting suggestion, to no avail. Their Twitter DM support provided a rapid response; but the problem still persists. (Aside from the issue at hand, I agree - syncing is just plain terrible.) [Charge 3 user here.]

I haven't used the food tracking in this app in a while since it was pretty basic and didn't even show the amount in g for your macros. I see that has changed. But as I go to log a food I noticed that the calories were off, but there is no where to update our send a notification for the error. So I guess I'll go back to MyFitnessPal for now until that's done.

Love this app.. I would love more features though: logging moods/emotions (would help see correlations between physical health, sleep, and mental health), being able to add notes on women's health logs(sometimes there's a LOT more to say), logging medicine(maybe w/ colors for privacy), and the ability to save externally or print data. Obviously those things have a few more privacy concerns but I love my Fitbit and it would be absolutely perfect if I could see more correlations in the same app!

Good app, pretty intuitive to use. I enjoy the community behind Fitbit which helps to keep me motivated, although Fitbit tries to upsell you with their premium service (which has many more groups, exercise classes, and challenges), it's still a great core experience without the premium subscription.

Please rephrase or clarify last rating question. I gave four stars because I sometimes have a difficult time getting Charge and Flex to sync and always have to restart phone upon waking for app to work. Also, i need to check if sugar carb count is separated out on dashboard yet for pre-diabetic help. The Fitbit App can be very helpful in losing weight if you do the work to log consumption and burn more calories than consumed and manage weight after reaching your desired range. Thanks Fitbit!

Enables an eighty plus year old, yo measure the level of fitness. The information , in my case is not totally personal to me, my decision. It has provided me with the motivation loose a stone in six months. Another stone to go! So I recommend this app, to anyone who is concerned, that being aged, does prevent one from being as flexible as it used to be. Eg.lacing up one shoes.clothes less tight.

I truly enjoy the app. I have the premium package that offers more utilization of features. This gives me a better overview of my body and progress to better myself daily. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is the rotation of programs in the system or increasing more options for areas. I've used the meditation and yoga areas alot but have completed all of them. I continue to still use the same ones but adding in additional programs would be nice.Plus I love the weekly programs for exercise!

I love the variety of features it offers and tracks. On the downside it can take a while to actually sync with our Fitbits (~3 min before I know whether my sons and I have slept long enough which makes it hard to fall back asleep) In the challenges, I wish you could see names to tell who's commenting since not all have profile pics. It also would help convo if we could post photos in the challenge.

I love the app. It is super easy to use and read. I do t have issues with syncing the device with my phone. The only issue I have is that my Fitbit battery runs low quickly. Otherwise, the app is great.

I have a charge 4 and it all works as expected. Syncs fine. Just wish I did not have to have both Bluetooth and location on to sync. Sometimes my weight loss on front dashboard is out of sync with the weight page but it aligns after a bit which is fine. It is good for tracking steps, distance , heart rate trends, weight (as I have a fit bit aria scale). What i wanted....

I love being able to follow my step count. I will walk to the shop rather than drive to ensure I reach my 10 000 steps per day.i also like to beat my pb on how many flights of stairs per week. It's great to see consistency and improvement. The only section i'm disappointed in is the food tracking. It really is aimed at packaged food production rather than basic fresh cooking of meat and veges. Other than that would highly recommend to all age groups (i'm 70 and love the challenge)

When it works the way it is supposed to, then all is well. But when there is a problem, it is very frustrating to try to figure it out. I had an issue recently with not getting notifications. I tried to troubleshoot myself with no luck. I finally called customer service and received excellent support. I followed all her instructions which fixed my problem.

Really fed up with my Charge 3 not syncing with my phone. It's got now that the time is hours behind on my watch screen and all the tips and instructions have been followed and failed. So I've deleted the app and reloaded it, but now it's not opening. UPDATE, very helpful fitbit advisor agreed that my watch is faulty and agreed a replacement. Thank you, wonderful customer service and support.

Fitbit versa 3 was working fine until 3.35 update. Now android app can't find fitbit to pair. Cannot sync. Tried unpairing it but phone doesn't show fitbit in paired devices. Tried searching for fitbit while it is on charging station but no joy. Was working perfectly the day before the update. Disapointed.

I love bring able to have a record of my workouts and the reminders to keep moving. It's fun to join friends in friendly competition. Thank you. Now if I could have recumbent bikes and stationary bikes as exercise options it would be even better.

So far my Fitbit experience has been very good. It motivates me to try a little harder to reach goals and I really like the messages of encouragement. Two issues that I have and which keep me from giving it 5 stars are: 1. It does not automatically chart exercise after a few minutes. I have to set it and if I've forgotten there is no record of having done any exercise. 2. Editing the Period Tracker so the dates are personalised is very difficult. I gave up and downloaded a separate app.

Fitbit has been a great addition to my weight loss journey! I love that I can see the statistics in real time! The app gets a little wonky though and I did find that I had trouble navigating through it when I first started using it. I'm still not using the app to its full potential but I get what I need out of it and it has been helpful!

I thoroughly enjoy the app; however, the I had to recently replace one Fitbit Ionic due to system failure (not sure what happened) but it might be contributed to 3rd party apps. Today is 12/05/2020, and I cannot seem to keep my Fitbit Ionic linked and connected to my Fitbit app. I have had to restart it multiple times just to get it to sync to the app.

I'm sure that the premium experience is better. However, for a free app you do get some fairly nice features. Would give 5 stars if a few more things were opened up to the non-subscription community. The watchs are not cheap I feel like there could be some better motivation & goals videos to remind you more with-out having a subscription. End of the day I have had no problems with the app or watch just feel some things you should by 1 time & not have to pay a subscription to get ALL features.

It's not bad. Sometimes it takes a while to update my heart rate or sleep. One major annoyance: I wish, if my period is predicted to start a couple of days ago - the app starts tracking my period on the day it's supposed to start, not on the day is actually starts. I have to go back every day to edit and delete the period. Why can't it just push the period forward instead of starting it without me saying it starts?

In the beginning it was amazing. It tracks your sleep, steps, calories, how much food you eat, how much water you drink, and even your period. But the food and water never worked and now my watch won't connect to Bluetooth. I have tried everything but it won't work, it said I must update the app, so I do, but it still says I need a app for connecting my watch to Bluetooth. It is so annoying and now the period tracker doesn't work, which I really need. Please fix it.

Overall i am happy with this app. I would like to be able to edit an activity (rather than delete and recreate) particularly for instances when i forget to stop recording an activity. I would also like the food tracker to have longer frequently used lists and be able to add more nutrition info on custom foods entered. I sometimes have issues with my fitbit connectivity from bluetooth and have to stop and restart bluetooth. If these were addressed i would give the app 5 stars.

Overall app is great except Notifications issue. There's error everyday saying that i need to restart my phone in order to enable the notification. After restart my phone multiple times, it still doesn't work. My temporary workaround everyday is to uninstall and reinstall Fitbit app in order to get notifications on my fitbit versa 3. This is really inconvenient, kindly investigate and fix it..

Overall, it's a good product. My biggest issue was getting the gps to work while biking or walking. Even going online didn't help much. I would do what the website said, go biking and then find out that it didn't work. It was talking with someone who had a different type of Fitbit that finally got me on track.

I'd like to be able to uninstall apps like Starbucks, Deezer, and Pandora. I'm glad Alexa is gone now. Wellness Report is never downloaded. It's been like this since November, at least. The only way I can see it is if I email it to myself. The advanced sleep analytics are also slow to update sometimes. I sometimes sync twice and it's still not updated, so I just have to wait till it decides to update by itself.

I love the app definitely helps me keep track of my daily activities and it motivates me to do more. Sync issues have been on and off so its frustrating when all you want to do is get going. It would get 5 stars if it was a seamless connection. I've used the fitbit app and brand for about 3 yrs now and have upgraded twice.

Good app. I think that some of the things could be more intuitive to find in the app. Editing excercise workout results could be simplified and easier to do! Need a way to block workouts when I'm riding the lawn tractor (defaults to bike ride)

The app is great, however there is still much to improve. The women's health section is small, I wish it could include more symptoms and moods. Editing your period start and end dates isn't as easy as in other apps. I would like to have reminders to take my contraceptive pills. I would also like for it to include more activities, I jump rope and it's not there, and when I do my jump rope exercises the watch usually mistakes them for walking/running. Still, great job developers!

The app itself is pretty good, syncs most of the time. Have random issues where the heart beat graph doesn't show up on the weekly list, but will be available if you click into the day. To remedy I've been clearing app cache, been happening on my old pixel 2 and my new 5

I like the weekly report. The app has worked well for me with two different Fitbit models, the most recent a Versa 2. I've only had a syncing issue twice and they were both minor and easily resolved by manually syncing the device.

Love the Fitbit app as it helps me keep track of lazy days or when I need to slow down. But idk what y'all did, my app is not accurate anymore. Not tracking mileage or active minutes. Can do challenges. They are stuck on starts in less than 1 hr. Even though they started 2 days prior. I hope it is fixed soon. Everytime there us a update, I have issues. I'm getting tired of having to re-add my fitbit.

When my Fitbit is working, I love it. I have had the Alta HR and now the Inspire HR when my Alta quit working. Update ... I finally got my firmware to update. So far so good. With the Fitbit charging, the first attempt still failed, then I did it again but did not let my phone screen sleep. I kept touching it to keep it on. I'm not sure that's what did it but it worked & that's the only thing I did differently. Fingers crossed ...

The app is great. I love how all my fitness activity is in one place and I can challenge my friends. Only dislike I have is fake profiles set up by scammers who send friend request to scam people. Just he careful on accepting friend request of those with little activity and no personal info on their profile.

Now that Google owns this place maybe they'll help out (or replace) the Fitbit app people, or better yet just roll the Fitbit functions into the Google Fit app. This app is actually doing better with my Inspire HR so I've increased my review to 4 stars. I know, as do many of us, that at any time Fitbit could drop one of their bug-riddled updates that screws around half the users. For now, it's sometimes a little hesitant to refresh or sync but eventually it does.

I love fitbit. This is my second watch. I also bought the fitbit scale. My fitbit life keeps me focused on my health & weight goals. Even, when I'm down to the last few hours in a day, I force myself to get my steps done. When I join challenges, I do even more!! I love how the fitbit scale syncs to the app. It's very motivating. Today I'm at 30lb weight loss. I know it's because of fitbit being incorporated into my life. By far the best purchase I've made in 2020.

Great tool to monitor daily activity and sleep. Waiting on additional health apps. Glad Google completed purchase of Fitbit. This will bring huge tech expertise and innovation. Once you start wearing a fitbit and monitoring your activity, it becomes essential.

This App has worked great with my Charge 4. Syncing only has difficulty if it can't connect which often is a phone issue. When that has happened I have found rebooting the phone clears the issue. Gps is automatic and records even when I forget to activate exercise mode. Very happy with the new capabilities for oxygen levels when sleeping and the mindfulness feature.

The app is pretty nice, it could have some user interface improvements, some things like changing the watch face required going in to different parts of the app, which isn't intuitive. The ECG exports don't always push to your device, if they can fix these, it gets 5*. Fitbit premium is also way too overpriced.

Great for tracking food, but should contain more features like noom to know how much carbs and calories should be consumed. Also, editing the Menstrual cycle is difficult and glitchy to do. Please make it easier to edit start and finish dates. Theres always issues with dragging it to the proper dates and having it update quickly.

This Fitbit app is really well designed and over the years keeps getting better. It's very intuitive. It can track a lot of different sports activities ... except for skiing. That's been the only minor negative I can think of. I really Fitbit would add a Skier Tracker. That would be so cool. Ski stats would be great! Although I've enabled bike mode while skiing and it provides some interesting days. You can see all the trails you've skied on the map when the days done. GPS tracking is good.

I like being able to track my water intake. I'm in stage 4 kidney failure so this is handy. The sleep tracker is kinda erratic. It sometimes has me sleeping when I'm reading, or watching TV. Which is annoying, because then I have to go in and delete these entries. Other than that I like the app.

Charge 3 from 2019. Great at what it does. Developers change data analysis with updates and sometimes withdraw handy features because the the Charge 3 is old tech now. Updates require a reboot to work - sometimes bits of the app goes missing.

I ABSOLUTELY love it, it would be nice though, in the female health tracker (period tracker) if you would add a pregnancy portion to it!.!.!.!.! Cause they kind of go hand in hand if you think about it, so to have the period tracker and not have pregnancy stuff with it, it will mess everything up for women who use it then end up getting pregnant.

I bought a Versa December 2018. It has it's moments but for the most part works well, then yesterday it started to consume battery like nobody's business. I usually get down to between 80% to 85% in any 24 hour period. Last weekend I went from Friday am to Monday am with no charging and there was still at least 25% left. This morning, after 24 hours the battery was at 17%. Today already it's down to 77% after 6 hours of wearing as normal (ie, doing nothing). Hopefully this doesn't last long.

Great when the app works but it often has issues syncing and connecting with my Fitbit device. Additionally, I like that they have expanded to include meditations for sleep but it doesn't run in the background unfortunately, nor does it automatically turn off. Based on this, I still use other apps for meditations.

Fitbit has been an amazing app with great funcinality. You can manually log items, use the app to update more specific items though i do wish that the app and watch spoke to each other more without having to manually sync the watch every half day/day.

Changed my lifestyle. Love it. Wish the oxygen levels were easier to access. Got the fitbit sense for Christmas. I was so excited & happy but the syncing has been impossible. FIX THE BUG! I Loved fitbit so much I became a stockholder but I am fed up right now.

Fitbit versa 1, 2, 3 and fitbit sense are now with health metrics. It is best to use a tablet not your phone with the fitbit app due the heavy amount of data. While their fitbit watches are impressive, it sucks that they are experiencing connectivity issues and syncing issues via bluetooth. The more improved their updates get the closer the accurate data is on the fitbit watches.
Easy to use, useful information readily to hand, so a good way to track fitness and maybe even general health. It acts as a sort of motivator to keep / get fitter.

Love love love this app. Keeping track of my steps really motivates me to do more . counting my calories is helping me watch my intake . specially with having a baby its awesome to help my weight maintained . keep it up â¤

Great App and great Watch for tracking exercising and sleep. Only wish the app would play friendly all the time with properly sending notifications and calls to the watch, half the time have to reset the app to start doing its job of forwarding notifications to my watch.
The app keeps forcing close when I click on anything. It opens fine. I think it's a problem with the latest update. Updated 1/15: app works great with no issues
Fun addition to help with overall health. Easy to set up on phone. Keeps you motivated to move more during the day. Wish the clock and date stayed on longer.

Over all a good app for tracking steps. When I 1st got my versa the app would track my walks/runs on a map. After one of the recent updates, it only tracks time and distance. The distance tracked now is much less for the same walk I was doing prior to the update so not sure what that's about.
App has improved a lot over time. The connection used to be spotty a year back but they have done lot of improvements to make it more reliable. GPS is still not reliable though.

good app but would like the food tracker to allow full entry of all nutritional info not just % of fat calories. also would be nice to create a dish by combining items. I hate that the location has to be on to sync!!!

The app statistics differ from the weekly summary email statistics, the step count between the two are usually quite a few thousand diffrent, other then that, its an awesome app, a great way to help manage your health

I have connectivity issues with Bluetooth. Fitbit is the only thing that I have that every couple months will lose connection. And then it is quite a challenge to reconnect. It is beginning to be frustrating when I don't have the data I want.

I have the fit4. I wish it counted stairs better or had the option to add how many stairs/steps. I go up a flight of steps every day, 16 steps to the top repeatedly but it only counts 10% of the time. It records 20-50 steps while sleeping. Its good if you want a general idea of your steps. I personally like the heart rate monitor.

Works for the most part. There are several days where it cannot find my watch even in ideal conditions which can be frustrating. It also does not always update the watch face when a new one is selected and will error out and never change. Overall the app does what it is supposed to and is a great monitoring tool.
Food entry is limited in New Zealand. I can't use the scan option nor can i manually enter due to differences in food labels from USA. Would be so much better if i could. Otherwise great app.

The app has a lot of great features I like. However, it just showed me an ad for a new Fitbit and that I don't like. I have already bought the product and I'm using it. Don't pollute the app I need to use for a product I have already paid for with ads.

Edit; dark mode???? loving the focus on mindfulness but I'd appreciate an option to take the vibration off as it's VERY distracting new app update is beautiful! They really listened to feedback and the clock faces are improved. The new interface is more useful and everything just looks better and more modern. As a user of the Fitbit inspire hr (1st Fitbit) this is the perfect step for me and this app has greatly helped my journey. thanks a lot. The updated clock faces are awesome as well!

Great app. I wear my Fitbit from waking up until going to bed at night. The "sleep mode" doesn't work well for me. But every aspect monitored during the day time is helpful for keeping me on my toes...activity wise. Thanks !

It's been exciting using Fitbit. Gives me the distance I cover and encourages me to keep walking to win a barge. A win is celebrated which keeps me hoping and happy. I need to explore other functions such as track my sleep hours as well

This app does not register actual sleep time. I have insomnia and I remain inactive late at night (watching TV, reading, playing music...). The app records quiet time as sleep time! That is a major flaw as far as I am concerned. Otherwise, it is a great tool. Thank you!

Life time of very little quality sleep. Fitbit was a gift. Since I've set a goal and changed my pre-sleep habits I seldom fall short of goal and often exceed. I keep a sleep log noting each stage and number of hours.
Works for me. Been using it for a few years now. Keeps me motivated.
Overall decent. Still waiting for dark theme. Perhaps now that you're Google owned, a dark theme will be developed... waiting and hoping.
Good! I am trying to figuring out the calories in, out, over budget etcetera... It seems a little hard for me to grasp. Eventually I am hoping that I will get it.
Could have the option to switch automatic syncing on/off. Could have new challenges sometime different.
I used two other sports apps before and this one is the best so far. Disadvantage: limited database of food. If you are, say, in Slovakia or Poland, you have to log everything manually.
Terrific guide to the daily fitness program

Phone needs to be restarted twice a day. So app will locate wrist device, and sync. After help from support. Inspire HR works pretty good. Sometimes doesn't record sleep quality very well. But works better now.
I have the Charge 2 and it works great .cant wait so i can afford a new one
Relatively easy to use. Really like the sleep quality information and am finding it useful in adjusting my patterns.
Does everything I need, easy to use.
Useful, bit the resting heartrate cannot be updated right after the sync, it usually takes a while for updating

Idk if it's cause I added a child fitbit to my account but everytime I open the app it acts like it's my very first time on there. Anytime I click HR, sleep, etc. It has a pop up explaining what it is and I don't need that. I've had fitbit going on 4 years, I know what a sleep score is. It's annoying. And I think there should be an option to not have a password required when switching between the two. I understand why some people may need it but I don't share a device with my kid.

I rarely keep additional apps on my phone and thought I'd probably end up uninstalling this one. But it actually does create a seamless experience with welcome extras. Only wish they were an ability to stream from any music app to the watch or add files manually
Real good if your into fitness
Could sink better with more diverses and the step counter could be smarter. Hop on the motor bike for a few minutes and gain 5000 steps
I love the app. I gave it 4 (instead of 5) stars because it takes a WHILE to sync. I often have to restart my phone AND watch to get it to sync to the correct time.
Overall it works well. I am disappointed that it does not work with Virtugym.
Simple to use.
Love the app and the information it gives me. Have had a Fitbit since 2013 with no problems until the last 10 days to two weeks. Have to uninstall then reinstall to get it to sync on my android.
I like the use and does what I need.

Like! This app has really improved over the last year or two. Used to have issues with it not syncing and freezing up. All those annoying issues seem to have been resolved. It suits my purposes and has more features than I will ever need. Something for everyone.
Great app pairing with a Fitbit tracker
It works well. It will sync even without the location on but will not tell you right away. I enjoy the challenges against friends. Thank you for helping me stay motivated.
The app is very good, its just that I dont like how my phone has to be an OS+7 just to sync with my inspire2 :( but ti's a great app!
Great at first but won't connect to my phone and my Wi-Fi been trying for a couple of days now getting feed up trying
the only problem is the user of this device is not as.smart as the device, but I think I got the problem worked out

Generally good. It is a little mysterious how they determine phases of sleep, but I like getting the information.

Fitbit has been an amazing app with great funcinality. You can manually log items, use the app to update more specific items though i do wish that the app and watch spoke to each other more without having to manually sync the watch every half day/day.
My sleep pattern is intermittent. Just seems to stop for a week or two
Had it since Christmas and like it so far. Still exploring what it can do.
seems accurate. great motivator. misinterprets a few things, but overall a good experience
Used to love it even though there was a lag between different components updating stats. Now that Google has bought fitbit I'm looking for a new fitness tracker.

This app is good!
Ican keep fit and it helps me Where I stand, in my lif
Go to youtube for setup. Makes life a lot easier.
Love this app!
New to fitbit, seems pretty easy and helpful...need to know how to set up spotify on my Versa 3....can anyone help.
