Great app! Watch/app have some glitches once in a while.

It makes me happy ive been 5 years using most of thr programs
Great app a bit slow sometimes syncing but overall easy to use and informative
Love it
Hehe lol, I mean it ok, samsung does it better, update the look, make it kinda like samsung health but with fitbit graphics and stuff...
excellent, but has me walking every night while I'm sleeping. also says my heart rate while exercising is higher than it actually is.

good app
Very scary with the info (but good info) it provides
Mainly very good but syncing often requires me restarting my phone.

You know... we already pay decent money for these Fitbits as it is, it is the absolutely most ridiculous thing that we are required to pay $10 a month to access the rest of the great amenities our watches come with(Fitbit Premium).
Great but doesn't always get my steps counted. Maybe Because I have small wrist

App is good but notifications won't work!

I am so frustrated with this, I was annoyed when I stopped getting notifications on my FitBit from my Android phone but now the app on my phone can't even detect my FitBit this is completely unacceptable and to think I was going to start paying for FitBit premium. I have updated my rating, there were updates made and now everything is working well. I am now a premium member as well. Just wish I had all of the premium options without needing to buy a newer version and more expensive watch.
Great motivational tool.
Love this app got it mainly to watch sleep patterns but it does so much more
It's very helpful and encouraging. I like it.
I wish I could link this to the steppi app
Does as describes. Occasional issue connecting with device but good overall view of days activities
I can't get new version on phone or Amazon tablet. Can't play challenges on older versions. It won't update since Jan. 2020.

App is fine. Widget only displays steps. Doesn't change with Main Goal even after troubleshooting.
Love the app... just wish I knew how to connect my fitness pal to their food log so I don't have to do it multiple places. But very efficient and can monitor progress well.

HAVE used everyday for many years. ðŸ˜

I would love some new challenges also.

Great app but Premium subscription way too expensive. Needs sub options so I can pay for what I want and ignore what I don't. As it stands they won't get a cent out of me. Now they are owned by Google it must be time to think out of the box and make subscriptions a lot more attractive. Their previous reply simply confirmed it was a bot that didn't understand the proposition.
It would be nice if the laptop version would also sync and update my steps.

New Fitbit much better with the app, most of the kinks worked out Loved my Fitbit One would be 5* but have not been able to sync since the beginning of July it is almost September - Ridiculous! Customer support suggests same trouble shooting that have done repeatedly and it still does not work. Customer support told me I can't sync my fitbit one through the computer.... very sad
Good app, but can be glitchy at times.
Great so far, still has a lot to learn.
helpful in recognizing just how stationery my job is.

Syncing issues. Got a fitbit sense, and the onboarding experience was pretty disjointed. Also, can't seems to sync after the initial setup and the Sense doesn't seem to track sleep either. All the steps to sync it are to turn off/turn on Bluetooth/app/phone/device, none of which works. Oh and you contact customer service via Twitter... Yeaaaaah.... Edit: factory reset and syncs working... Sleep tracking working too.
Iove my fit bit. Only concern is it can get lost easily
It reminds you to move hourly
It lags all the time. Never updates the information correctly and it hesitates to record workouts, even with the versa.
The app keeps forcing close when I click on anything. It opens fine. I think it's a problem with the latest update. Updated 1/15: app works great with no issues

I have been using my Fitbit and the app for years. I check the app daily to monitor my progress. I keep an eye on resting heart rate, how I slept in the evening, watch my step count and exercise and I track my weight. I like the addition of the female health section and keep note of many things there including my mood. It syncs really well these days. Improvements are introduced and the updates have all run smoothly for me. Fitbit will be part of my life for many more years to come.

I love Fitbit because of the reminders to motivate me to keep moving. I used to sit and talk on the phone to get business done now I walk around the room as I'm doing it. I go out for walks and realize If I go a little farther I can complete the next mile.. I've been doing a lot of bicycle riding lately and I'm going to check into the app to see if they have something to register my riding other than the heart rate. I hope they do if not that's something they can improve on. George, Whitehall PA

Fitbit is great for those who are setting goals that are to do with their health. It is a very good app that gives you information about how much steps you've done. It is also good for tracking your sleep. It is also good for those who want to know how many miles they've walked. It helps for those who want to try change habits and getting healthier by logging their food into the fitbit app. You can can join the communities who help others with exercise and give them ideas of what they can do.

I have 1 for over 3 years and just bought a new one. I love it! I track my z to know how I sleep. Another reason to love fitbit is the heart beat monitoring. I have a history of irregular heart beating. It happened once in a while. Sometimes in June it detected it, so fitbit app notified me, twice, until I responded. I was monitored for 3 months and it contacted me later with comments. I wear my fitbit 24 hours!

Would rate 4.5 stars if I could. The steps I'm taking is lagging on the app. And some of the active mins is RUBBISH! When I'm walking the active mins shows 33,39, and other random numbers. And I've always got 10k steps and it sometimes shows low numbers. If I don't get a reply from you I'm going to bump this down to 3 stars. Every time I don't get a reply from you I'll takeaway 1 star until it's 1 star(0 stars if possible). Once It gets down to 1 star we'll have a nice long talk. Thank you! Bye!

I've used the FitBit app for over 4 years with 2 phones and 4 different Fitbit devices. I have been happy with the information and services it provides. There is always room for improvement and sure there have been glitches but so far everything has been resolved pretty quickly. I am a pretty satisfied customer.

Absolutely an awesome gadget to have and a must have!! I got my Fitbit in December and I am totally in love with it. If you want to make a healthy change in your life get yourself a Fitbit. That step counter urges you to get more steps in than the previous day, I love challenging myself. You can track your food intake and water. There is also a period tracker which is really helpful for us busy ladies. I also love the badges you receive for a certain amount of steps on a day. Just loving it!

Fitbit is a great way to track your daily activity (exercise, sleep, heart rate, water intake). It was great to participate in some of the studies, like the recent heart monitoting study and be apprised of any abnormalities. Non-invasive to participate. Great tool for notifications, receiving texts from your phone. On those days when you don't feel like doing much, it can be a gentle motivator, even when you don't do enough to meet your daily goals.

I love Fitbit! I started off very dedicated, but then work got extremely stressful and I didn't utilise it fully. Starting a new year has given me motivation to start using it again. I think the app is good for giving you hints and tips on things to help utilise your goals; and the only problem I have, is the 'sleep' data. Its not accurate. It records non-movement, so doesn't distinguish between actual sleep and watching a movie. Plus, any time I moved, the sensor light woke me. So irritating!

I love my FitBit not just for fitness but it's my FAVOURITE way to wake up, just that lovely little gentle vibration on my wrist ... is much nicer than any sound and doesn't disturb my partner. My private medical insurance is linked to my FitBit so it's really important for me. I'm about to have a hip replacement and am not looking forward to the low scores that will follow as seeing my usual high scores on my FitBit really cheers me up!

The Fitbit app has been great for tracking everything! I love how I can look at anything to see how many steps over walked, calories used, how I slept and so much more, just too many to list here. It's sync's with your Fitbit device easily. Then your set to look at your stats. It also gives you helpful tips & suggestions when you open it. Get the app, besides being free, you won't be disappointed!

Received a Fitbit 4 for Christmas and have been like a kid in a candy store since. I am surprised, though, at all the negative reviews for the app! I installed on my Samsung and have had no real issues. Syncing is quick and accurate. I did figure out, however, to allow the sleep feature to calculate your sleep score do not use the "start sleep" option, instead just allow it to auto detect your sleep!

Edited Dec 27 2020 The app is so much better. Its nice to be able to save 5 clock faces. I've had no crashes or issues with bugs. It's a good app with caveats. It's ridiculous that you cant switch clock faces easily. There should be a list showing which ones you have purchased previously and an easier way to apply them. Without having to go through kiezel pay.

Use this to track daily activity as part of my body transformation programme. Helpful to track heart rate when running also and to see how hard I have worked even during my boxing classes, so can compare recovery times etc. Use the sleep mo tiring to assess my quality of sleep and track how many hours I get and I like the estimates on calories burnt. Footstep cou ts are very interesting to me, didnt realise how many steps I take when boxing. Would recommend app.

Awesome app! I just wish that the premium services came with curtain models that are more expensive to buy. And I wish that anything, and I mean anything should be able to be scanned for their nutritional info. There have been products I've bought, made in store, exp. Veggie Lasagna, Spring salad, irish stew, sandwiches, etc., etc... Other then that...nothing bad to say.

UPDATE: I called the help desk and with some setting changes we were able to fix the notification alerts! ðŸ˜ I've loved Fitbit for years. I really enjoy the challenges with my friends, it keeps me moving. But now that I've upgraded to the Samsung Galaxy 20, it is no longer is compatible. I receive no notifications to my Versa. I'm now thinking of switching to a Samsung watch. Even though I won't have my challenges with friends, l'll be able to use ALL the functions of my smart watch.

I find it easy to work with this app! Its very suffircient for me and its easy to use! Its easy for me to log my water, weight, and my calorie intake! I dont know about other's experiences but I love this app and would highly recommend it if you had a fitbit yourself! They can track stuff from your steps, resting heart rate, daily mileage, calories burned, heart rate, your sleeping scores from REM sleep, light sleep and even deep sleep! You can set alarms to remind you to get moving every hour!

My Daughter gave me her flex2 when she upgraded to a different one a couple of years ago. Before it was just a neat way for me to track my steps for my own health needs. Though now we live in separate states she can see I'm moving daily through our steps competition connection during the week and rematching weekly. It gives her and I some piece of mind I'm moving ok daily as well as myself seeing she is active too.

I love everything about the hardware and the software. It really helped me manage my medical conditions while also encouraging me to get healthier. Only thing that I wish it had was blood pressure monitoring, but that's not terribly common so I don't count that against Fitbit. Both me and my wife love Fitbit.

App is easy to use and has helped me to stay motivated and track my fitness and lifestyle goals to include eating better, sleeping better, and over all hydration. So many useful tools available that can be set up to remind you to keep moving forward. Definitely a most have app.

I purchase my Fitbit at the beginning of the year. I absolutely love it if you are the type of person to stick with something, log in your food and exercise daily even going for a walk, you will see results. The community is great for encouragement and support and for competing in Daily and weekly challenges. My only complaint is I wish Fitbit would install more trails. They only have three trails and I've completed them 10 times over, please give us more Trails Fitbit.

Worked great with my charge 2. Can not get it to set up my new fitbit Versa. I do believe it will sync Versa. Loved my Versa so much and have had it a few years. When i heard they no longer make them decided to buy another one while i could. Going to try one more time to set it up with this. fingers crossed. Let's hope it works.

So far so good ( fitbit Sense) .. okay, was a little confused at first. But that's on me, for not reading manual. Patients is needed for 3 to 4 days.. it needs at least 3 days to gather enough info on you!! Give it a week and you should be running smoothly. Needs a few days to now your body type etc.

I have noticed that the past week that this Fitbit app has been running much better. Seems like they fixed bugs that were previously causing issues. I have my rating to a 5-star rating. I originally had it rated as a two-star before they did the fix. Thank you for fixing the bugs!

It's a very helpful device putting insppiration to go for more efforts when one follows output statistics. Only one problem is the recording performance and charhe retaining capacity of fitbit diminishes after 1year of purchase. I've charge3 fit bit which after full charge when used shows low battery within max 1hr time.Since repair shops are not available in my city it's very difficult to rectify the problem.

Great app with only a couple issues I've found. The sleep tracker is way off base, but that's not a deal breaker. The water tracker doesn't give the option of the size water bottle I use, but again, not a deal breaker. It tells the time, calories burned, and distance traveled accurately, and that's what is important for me.

the calorie counting has helped me lose weight. Once you've entered the food you eat it saves it and calorie counting becomes a doddle. It works out what calories you can eat each day. I've recently lost 12 kilos using the charger 2 and the app. Really simple to use. It counts all the calories you use exercising, whilst sleeping etc. I also love the heart rate, i am more aware when i am tired or under the weather.

I love my Fitbit fitness tracker. I wear through work and it's proven to be very durable. The GPS is accurate and the battery life has been great. I'm diabetic and it integrates with my One Drop Software and my weight scale. I am very happy with the app and my device.

The fitbit app is my favourite of all the apps I've used for tracking anything. I've strayed away from it a couple of times to try other apps and fitness watches but I always come back to fitbit. Its almost a one stop shop for me. The only thing missing is somewhere to record my blood sugar levels (as a type one diabetic this would be handy)

Currently working fine. Cross fingers it stays this way. Update 29/12 - bug in HR screen. Sometimes doesn't show the HR trend graph. Rebooting doesn't resolve it. Fitbit app is set for daily target of 5 miles, but webpage settings keeps showing target as 8.05 miles. Reset several times but difference reappears. Updating amount of water drunk doesn't always show on main app screen. Closing/opening app sometime resolves. Main app screen goes blank at start of new day. Have to kill app to resolve.

This was a gift & although I had to become adjusted to the tidbit, I enjoy tracking my steps & keeping track of my water intake. It also keep track of my heart rate & now my weight goals. I still haven't begun logging my food intake. It's too tedious. I probably will not since I'm more interested in the physical exercise.

Great that there is a connection between the fitbit data and WLR, the weight loss website I use! It's helped me to work towards my weight loss goals! I have gone from "obese" (bmi = 32) to "just overweightâ€œ (bmi = 26.2) and I am confident I will be able to get down to "normal" (bmi <25) within another month or two!

I'm almost 68 years old so the learning curve was steep for some of the more advanced features. That said the watch works great. I lost almost 6 pounds the first week. It also tracks my sleep very well. Got one for my wife and she has had the same results. Wouldn't want to give it up now.

After reading many negative reviews, I hope my experience helps other users. I've been using Fitbit App with Ionic (3 yrs), Charge 4 (month) & Fitbit Aria 2 Scales (~2 yrs) and on many different phones & tablets. Fitbit App always works great as long as you allow location, bluetooth & internet to the Big Brother :-) Then, all data syncs excellently; layout is nice; graphs, analyses & user friendliness are SUPERB. I HIGHLY recommend this App. Keep it up Fitbit! Ps: Fitbit, Pls dont ask location!

Best tracking app ever! Even it has all food brands with details for adding different food calories. It has good training coach programs and useful videos for working out at home. However, I am using the premium for free for the first year, and I am not sure if I extend it to the second year because it is quite pricy per month (about 13 CAD/month)

My notifications keep on turning off. I have followed all advice from their website but it doesn't work. I have been deleting the app 5 times a day and downloading it back just to get notifications running again. There is no point looking for help on website because I have looked everywhere.ðŸ˜¡

I couldn't connect my device to the phone, it took 2 days of struggling on my own before I contacted the support department via live chat. I was helped within seconds after reaching out and within 15mins I was up and running again. If you're struggling, go the the live chat, it's excellent service
Simple to use and not obtrusive. No constant beeps and boops to stand, sit or sleep. Just a simple app with a good layout. Wanna get more out of it you have to use the app to record your progress.

I've used this app now for over 3 years. I'm not saying it is perfect but it has been nice tracking activities for that period of time. I wish we could set different goals for each day of the week but it can track all the workouts (not weights but it's better at rep counting then I am sometimes). I run/walk most and it is nice to look back and see course layouts, times, splits, and heart rate is a major stat for me. I assume it isn't as accurate as a chest strap (not compatible) but good enough.

Happily surprised! Recently switched from another tracker hoping for better sleep tracking. Expected issues based on reviews, did have some until the 1st firmware update. Would love a bit more granularity in the data BUT the main thing is that i'm super happy with the app and tracker. It's positive and supportive, and sleep tracking is top notch - it even registered a 2hr nap today! Also like the heart rate zone notifications as i have a tendency to overdo it during workouts.

Love my Fitbit. I own the charger 3 and now charger 4... use it for all activities ..walking, running, workout on my cardio machines which it syncs with,, my weight scale which it takes accurate weight and fat. Along with keeping a history of all, working out doors,, and especially swimming....I use it for sleep and for nutrient counting, I am very pleased with this product and app.....I have not had any problems with any of my devices or the app. I have been a avid fitbit user

Just used the Inspire for a year and am now using the Versa 3. The app is great, continuously syncs. Could be a bit easier to activate my music app to it but love being able to access my Google Assistant from it. Keep up the good work Fitbit!!ðŸ˜ŠðŸ¥°

Since the update the Fitbit won't sync with the phone in terms of notifications and messages. I don't get any notification for messages and I have tried every trouble shooting options, that too multiple times. Disappointed and very inconvenient.

This watch saved my life. Im a 3yr beast cancer survivor, started having health issues. Memory loss, numbness, fatigue, & confusion. The drs thought my cancer spread. Tons of dr's appts, blood work, ultrasounds, MRIs & CT scans. All normal, Drs couldn't figure it out. Was looking at my fitbit reports, O2 levels were high. At a neurologist appt i asked for a sleep study because of the warning on the report. I have severe OS apnea! I had to get CPAP. Going untreated could lead to stroke or worse.

Fantastic app, easy to use, not fiddley - only wish the food logging bit could be better as currently use a linked 3rd party app to log my food which syncs with Fitbit, wish that functionality could be replicated on this app i.e. easy food diary with abilty to create and save recipies/meals/save a list of fave foods AND individual ingredients/food elements for quick & easy logging; and most importantly linked to an excellent food database including a barcode scanner! :)
I love the Fitbit app. It helps me keep track of my sleep patterns, my eating patterns, how many steps I take per day and how many calories I eat per day. It also helps me set my own health goals.

I love my Fitbit versa watch and the app is a perfect companion. I use the app daily to connect with the stats and check to see if I have any challenges. I have not had any problems with the app. It has been easy to use. There have been a few men friending me that, I am suspicious are not looking to use Fitbit for it's intended purpose. I ignore them. Otherwise I have a collection of very lovely caring friends.

The app wasn't syncing my data but this was my fault as I deleted user data on the Fitbit and the only way to get it working again was to remove the linked Fitbit from my account and start the process from scratch. So if you do delete user data bear this in mind. When working the app is great.
Nice app. A friend gave me her old fitbit and I just really love it! It's not a fancy one but it does keep me moving. I only wish the battery was better, once it hits the 50% mark it dies.
Great! I've upgraded to Charge 4, and the sync was seamless. It syncs well with MyFitnessPal, so the only thing I'd like would be... actually, I can't think of anything! ðŸ¤”

Love this app and the Fitbit in general. It helps you stay on track and better yourself. Update: since I got my versa 2. I love it and love how u can put 5 watch faces on there. The only problem with that and I think we should had a hear/like button that saves all our favorite clocks so we don't have to scroll down to find the ones we love. I know we can save five like I said before. But there are so many good ones.

I've been using the app for several years now. It's great for tracking steps, water intake, and weight loss. It's also great for keeping up with friends and family who are using it, and competing in challenges with people you meet in the communities.
I love this app! I'm able to track everything. From my steps and sleeping patterns to my periods. Also, being able to join or create fun challenges is one of my favorite features.

I love how with just a bracelet I can track not only my miles, heart rate, and steps, but also how much water I drink, and even set an alarm. If you are wanting to get a watch that can do it all, get a Fitbit!

I use this every day! It is a great way to know how well I'm sleeping, how active I am, how many calories I'm eating, etc. Plus, if you also have my fitness pal you can sync them for easier food upload. I actually went to the apple watch for a while and almost immediately went back because I just like the features of fitbit so much better. Highly recommend!!

I've had the charge 2 and now the charge 3. I love how the features hold you accountable for your health . It's like an electronic doctor and the nutritional categories are phenomenal. Well worth the 5 stars.

I love the fitbit my daughter gave me i wear it all the time except the shower it's not water proof. It works with my phone with the app. It makes life a little easier i get certain notifications,like an alarm,phone calls, messenger,or texts. I just wish it could do both. Sometimes it mite not notify me but that's rare. When i do get a notification it Vibrates. You don't have to be healthy as an OX to wear one. My opinion if you can get one it's worthwhile.

This is a very motivating app. Though my boyfriend and I do the same activities, he burns more calories due to his size. So, this little fit bit is a fierce trainer for me. Hopefully, I'll get this COVID weight off soon!!! I love the sleep quality monitoring, too. That is very helpful.

I like that I can track what's important to me, and the Inspire HR I wear recognizes when I'm exercising. I like the wrist band choices so I don't feel like I'm always wearing athletic gear. My husband and I both enjoy Fitbit tracking and recommend it to all.

I love my Fitbit because it tracks my activities and sleep accurately and effortlessly. Some days you just want to slide through life, but the tracking prompts me to put forth the effort to reach daily and weekly goals. In the effort to compete with myself, my Fitbit has become a valuable tool that keeps me going forward and pushing myself to be more active.

I've been using fitbit for a number of years. Had a few issues a few times, but since I got my Versa 2, I've had no issues. I love that it not only monitors my heart rate, but also my oxygen level. I like the suggestions for better health and I like the reminders to move.

i love my fitbit!!! i rely on it for quite a bit. it is a blessing in my life. i was recently having trouble with it pairing and working correctly BUT i messaged fitbit and they were super nice and extremely helpful helping me figure out the problem. 5 stars for the product and 5 stars for customer service. i couldnt be happier. thank you for an amazing product and an amazing experience!!!! â˜º
I love it. It keeps me active and it improves my fitness by showing all my activities and GPS is great to show your routes covered. I have it with my versa 3. I wouldn't be without it.
Great statistics. Tracks my exercise and sleep patterns with easy to read graphs. Like how I can go back and look at past weeks stats to compare and look for ways to improve.

I've had a variety of Fitbits over the years and they serve as reminder to stay active. Over a year using the Fitbit Charge 3 and very happy with the way of working.. App works good and easily accessable, it also connects good with other sporting apps which im using and aynchronizes really well. I just also upgraded myself to the Fitbit Sense and awaitinf its arrival.

It was easy to set up my Charge 4 fitbit took about 10-15 min to get everything set up it dose what is says and it is easy to sync everything as 1-2-3 it is a very easy app! The premium payments are a bit $$ but still on the free plan it works very good

I count on this app to help me get up and move and for the past year has been able to keep hydrated and keep moving; have kept my weight stable but this year hoping to lose some weight. During this past year with quarantine I was able to watch my diet, limiting what I ate and was able to lose 33 pounds just 2 pounds away from my goal and I credit my Fitbit for my ability to keep on track.

The app and wearable have been helpful and important to me. I had heart problems 4 years ago. My son got me my first Fitbit. It helped me to start a fitness regimen. My cardiologist was able to review data on the app which was very beneficial to him at my first annual review. I've lost 35 pounds since then. Have kept the weight off and watched my fitness effort and level increase.

The Fitbit app is easy to navigate. It does so much more than showing data regarding your exercise routine. It has a GPS and connects to your email. It tracks your sleep patterns and critical body functions such as your overnight oxygen level. I love the Fitbit app!

I really like keeping track of my steps and sleep, but once in a while the sleep monitor doesn't work & I just get a darker blue line. I have my tracker on right - the same every night - according to the directions. Other than that, I love it!
Being obese, I am on a long term journey to change my eating habits and the possibility of typec2 diabetes. This app helps me reach goals regularly and keep on track. It's just perfect.

I have found that my Fitbit is accurate & does exactly what it's supposed to. Highly recommended.

I lived by this with my versa and a healthy meal lifestyle change. I dropped 100 pounds in about 14 months. Now I'm hooked on working out, I've put 25 pounds back on but in lean muscle. The app didn't do it FOR me but it kept me accountable and that's made a big difference!

Amazing app. Great tech. For advise that helped me find my charge 4: Allow notifications to go be sent from your phone to fitbit... Then go to the place ya best have chances of getting it... Text the phone and then you'll hear vibrations coming from the Fitbit... Then you'll easily find it.

The game has developed so many different glitches and errors. Pokeballs freeze when trying to catch (especially annoying if you paid for a raid pass, forces you to close and open the game again). The game as it is right now is a horrible buggy mess. The game randomly crashes or won't load to begin with. The worst part right now has to be the remote raiding system. Out of the probably 15 raids I have done remotely over the past week or so, I have had my game freeze on every single one, forcing me to reset the game and try to reenter the lobby before either the raid was finished, or in some cases I ran out of time and lost my pass. It's an alright game, it doesnt crash that much for me personally, but the only problem is that when I go to buy things from the store, that costs really money, I pay for it the money leaves my bank and then i get an error message and i dont get the item. I've played this game since the release & made purchases with the store without complications until recently when items I bought weren't deposited into my inventory. After receiving no help from support, I looked up the issue online & learned I am hardly the only person to have this problem & be completely ignored by their troubleshooting team. Uninstalling.

The game is saying "GPS signal not found" everytime i open the game. This has been happening after the recent update. However, my GPS is on, yet it is saying "signal not found". So, please fix this issue as fast as possible and other than this, the game is awesome.

UPDATE REVIEW: at first i gave the game a 5-star review because of how much I loved the game. went down to a 3-star review because of how many "bugs" it has; which apparently took so many updates to fix one, but had more come out. now I'm putting it at a 2-star review. can't even access the game; says GPS not found, even it was working before. waited all day to go back on, but still having the GPS issue. tried to uninstall & redownload the app, yielding the same GPS not found issue.

An endless ratcheting down of the player's enjoyment in favor of profit. I've been a member since July of 2016, and have wasted precious dollars on this game. At every step, the developers seem intent on screwing the user along the way. A constant stream of heavily monetized drivel, and more recently, the very foundational mechanics that make this game remotely worthwhile are being tinkered with, to maximize Niantic's ability to extrude their lifeblood from their dedicated fan base. Pathetic.

The idea of Pokemon Go got so many players at the start. But since then the development and execution has been so poor. The gameplay hasn't really been expanded other than the battle system which is a clickfest plagued by bugs. The vast majority of raids participants are spoofers. Mega evolutions should have made the game far more interesting but were implemented with no creativity. Mega candy? And now XL candy? Maxing a poke now requires an eye watering amount of candy.Sad, so much potential.

Niantic could careless as long as they are making those big bucks. For you cheaters..its sad what pathetic losers you are that u have to cheat to win. That says it all CHEATERS=LOSERS

Pokemon Go is mostly enjoyable, but resources depend on where you live. Urban players get far more of the game readily available to play than suburban players, who might have to go miles out of their way, while rural players might have no resources at all. Without them, the amount of pokeballs is severely restricted, legendary pokemon are unavailable, and the inventory upgrade currency nonexistant without microtransactions.

Everything is great about the game, literally everything, except 2 for now. Remote raids passes are awesome, they make life so much easier, but they are a little expensive, I was hoping the price could just decrease by a little, this is not a huge problem, however it would help. As we've already come to gen 6 this year, there are much more pokemon than before. Especially mega evolution pokemon, regarding that, I hope Niantic takes note of this review as everything is great in the game, its just that before mega evolving a pokemon, the only source of that mega energy are from Mega raids. The problem is, I am a new player, I haven't mega-evolved most of the pokemon. I always look out for raids, especially Mega and 5-stars, however people only seem to battle in 5-star raids. I would always be the first one to enter the lobby for Mega-raids, but rarely anyone would join. Even if there were, its incredibly rare that more than 5 people would join. Which is another problem by itself, as the mega energy is given by timing. Basically, I'm not sure why but many people aren't interested in mega-evolving pokemon. So that leads to new players like me not being able to mega-evolve a pokemon even if I'm willing to spend money, as there's no alternative to getting mega energy when that specific pokemon is not mega-evolved. I hope Niantic reads this review and try to give an alternative or an easier access to mega energy. Thank you.

I have used CCLEANER for very many years, on both my business devices and on my personal ones, on various levels of Window and Droid devices. I used to regularly monitor it to analyze how it performs, as I do with any new apps, and it simply does what it is supposed to, and opened my eyes to how much my now former protection apps did not cover.

For months I couldn't figure out what was clogging up my phone, even though I was uninstalling apps. I tried multiple junk cleaning apps, but they didn't clean any more than my phone did by itself. Then I noticed this app on my mother's laptop, and saw what a good job it did of cleaning out her junk files. So I decided to try and get CCleaner on my phone, and as I was hoping, it cleared up unnecessary hidden cache that my phone couldn't. Now I have 3GB more storage space than I did before!

Here's what I do: OPEN FILES - In your tablet / phone's files, duplicate the file you want to open. Open the duplicate, not the original. SAVE FILES - Share them to your email. I've been a SC user for quite some years. It is an amazing service and caters to my needs more than the competition. Ive been using soundcloud for years now and its been a great service but I want to point out some issues I have with it. Pros: - SoundCloud has an insanely large variety of exclusive up and coming artists, as well as mixes and mashups, reason enough to try it out. Cons: - About 25% of the time I play a track, it loads infinitely until I have to inevitably force restart my app for it to work. - Load times are slow and tracks may just stop working midway in which case you need to force restart again. - No direct messages on the app (keep in mind, it's 2020). - Playlists take days to sync up to the desktop version.

Soundcloud is a good app, but I prefer Spotify. Soundcloud has a more complicated setup and isn't as straightforward, but it allows for personal creation better than Spotify. The downsides to Soundcloud: you can't find all of the music you want at once, there is no loop or remix button for your playlists, and the verified creators' music isn't as easy to find as their remixes are. Otherwise this app is really well made! 85% recommend! ðŸ’•

I used Pinterest in the past with no difficulties what so ever. However, for the past 5 months or even longer, the App and the Website never load. It always says, "Error. User not found. Please try again" or "Something went wrong on our end. Please try again later." (keep in mind I'm connected to my internet and wifi) There are times where it does works and I can freely use my Account and such things, most of the time, this is not the case. This is getting to a point where I'm over it :(

So, for the past month I've been having an issue with the messages notifications. They don't show up in time and because of that I missed several texts from friends, who also said they are having this same issue. And when the notification DO show up, it's several hours later than the actual message was sent. Please fix this. I love pinterest, but if keeps being like this I may have to uninstall it. Update: Now the app doesn't show any notification at all. Fix this.

Idk what's wrong. I used to love this app. But now when ever I open a pin and scroll down, it doesn't show similar pins and shows just completely different pins. This has been happening from quite some times. If this continues how would I be able to find new ideas that I like.

I am re making this review because I've found even more issues with pinterest since I started using it and it doesn't fit within the character limit. Pinterest is very useful for self care, sorting out my thoughts visually etc but there are aspects of it that harm my mental health, which is the opposite of what I'm seeking from pinterest, and, more generally, a lot of useful features I need are missing. You need to do a lot better because this is not nearly enough. This is nothing.

Its unbearable to try to go to any pin! The page jumps, there's a million click ads. You can't touch anything or it'll freeze, refuse to load, jump, skip, go to another page. Ads cover up reading material. It's terrible now. I don't know why everybody isn't talking about it. It's unbelievably frustrating to try to follow a recipe or a diy tutorial. The only way is to screen shot directions if you are able to get them loaded.

Huge disappointment ðŸ˜ž. I used this app with no problem for years on a Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge and then, last year, the press and hold features stopped working. I just upgraded to a Samsung Galaxy S20 this week and IT'S STILL HAPPENING AFTER A FRESH INSTALL AND NO SYNC. Fix it. I loved this app, not so much anymore.

Sadly ,everytime I look on pinterest and see a recipe I would like ,I have to hear the oersons life story ,page after page after page ,inbetween all that I am passing by a million ads . For this reason I have stopped looking at pintrist ,I just google the recipe ,get it quik and easy . Sorry for pinterest,I could have been a good app. This is the complaint I hear from everyone !

I downloaded Pinterest eons ago when it first came out. I have been loyal ever since. Sadly, I can no longer e joy the app due to the copious amount of ads. The ads are so bad, you cannot even get to the recipes or activities anymore. After 10 years, I am now deleting the app. There is just no more use for it because you can't even access the content you need. I get the business side of things and needing ads in order for the app to remain free, but the amount of ads is absurd.

I used to love this app, but now for some reason on Android phones they have deleted the search options so I can't even search other people's boards or even search for other users. I was so frustrated with this I contacted their team and asked for this to be fixed, only for the person to say that they would get in touch with their team about it. That was weeks ago. Please fix this. I use Pinterest less now because of this missing feature. Very disappointing.

I've always loved Pinterest, but over the past year or two, the amount of advertisements is so out of control, it's almost impossible to use the app. I hardly ever use it anymore because its so frustrating. Such a bummer because it used to be a great app but it's terrible now and basically a waste of time. I just Google recipes now. It's such a bummer.

I don't come to Pinterest to "shop". I find it annoying that Pinterest is trying to sell me what ever I search. I'm looking for home renovation ideas- not trying to buy a new fridge. I'm looking up makeup inspiration- not a new mascara to buy. You should be able to turn off the "shop" part of the search feature.

The application was amazing, I think it's actually my fault, I didn't have enough storage space on my mobile, so I uninstalled Pinterest. When I reinstalled it today, I couldn't log in, it showed choose an account so I chose an account. It loaded for about 5 minutes and it didn't log in. I tried uninstalling first and then reinstalling Pinterest, but it still didn't work. Please fix the bug.

You can't even use the search bar.... it's terrible. It's good for photo ideas, but don't bother clicking into the links, they all had ads on ads on ads. Expect 3 ads on your screen when you click into a link or a "pin" that's not including the four pop ups, the one that redirects you. And so forth. So yeah it's ok.

I am very annoyed by the recent update. It took away the ability to filter search for other boards. The reason why I used to spend so much time on Pinterest was because it was fun to search for and look at other people's boards. I used to spend hours doing this, but now I want to delete the app.

So after using pinterest for more than two years, i suddenly have this big error. As i'm logging in my main account, a huge pop up appears saying user not found. To get rid of it, i uninstalled the app and installed again thinking it would work well then. But now im not even getting any option to log in. It does not stop buffering. And im not able to use pinterest for 2 weeks now. I've uninstalled and installed multiple times after the issue but IT JUST DOES NOT GET FIXED. :((((

Please stop updating Pinterest as it continues to keep getting worse. Please go back to the original like on the computer. Using the Android is a nightmare! You no longer have Topics, where did it go? You no longer remind us if we duplicate a pin by mistake. I miss not being able to save pins that I like for myself without having to find one of my boards to put it on. Also when I search for something I don't have the option anymore to look at boards.

Pinterest is great generally. My go to search engine ðŸ˜Š. I am not liking this new "face-lift" its looks too scrap book like, especially the highlights over the Pic. The hearts are completely unnecessary. I don't need to see how many ppl liked the Pic. I know what I like. It's my page after all. Less is more. Simplify it please.

I hace been using this app for the past 5 4 years now and since last 2 months whenever I ope. A pin it shows a promt ' User not found' and just today while I was trying to save a pin without actually opening it was wasn't working the options of share, edit,save,etc didn't come up at all , I had to open the pin and then save it. Please look into this matter . I really love this app it's amazing . Please fix this problem as soon as possible as I have a lot of important stuff saved on it too. Thx.

Too many ads. This used to have tons of great ideas, good articles to read, but now its full of annoying ads, and multi swipe videos, it has less content that I've asked to see, even after updating my prreferences. Its harder to find anything anymore. The board organization was a great addition, as well as the 'find more like this' feature. But seriously every other pin is an ad.

It is getting more and more frustrating to use Pinterest because of the ads. It seems the ads cover 90% of your screen so you can only see one or two lines of the content. And the pop up ads pop up over the area you want to click for more content forcing an ad to takeover your screen. Too many times I just give up and go to Google.

Can't search boards anymore???? Really hope this is a glitch and not intentional. Literally all I get is ads. What's the point in having Pinterest if I cannot search for new boards to follow. I DONT want to see just ads. I want to follow people. This is too big of an app to be wasting my time and space on my phone... If I can't search boards soon within the next update or two I will be uninstalling and never reinstall.

Not what it used to be. Too many offensive ads, offensive posts, wordy posts instead of images, epic novel-length sjw junk better shared on Facebook and Twitter than text slamming an image-based social media meant for other purposes, no way to report abusive, illegal, or unethical posts, and worse. It's like a bunch of paranoid, overhyped, SJW 13 yr olds found it instead of adults.

The app is great (though the new ads are very annoying) but ever since I updated the app every time is opens its says "Oops, something went wrong! Try again." It doesn't matter if I'm connected to Wi-Fi or using my data. I always have to refresh it once or twice to get it to work.

On Android phones, the app stalls and suddenly changes pages before you have a chance see them. Zero stars! This app has been bad since 2018. Now it's totally useless and obviously beyond repair. Almost nothing loads on my phone since the last awful "polish up". If something does load, it freezes and won't open. I can't access my pins and they can't be sorted. Unrelated and unwanted topics are jumbled together on the same screen. There are also way too many annoying ads.

I gave this one star because I find it heartbreaking that I see on the news that Pinterest is yet again featured as political. I come to Pinterest to escape politics because it's comforting. Please keep your site politics-free. I don't care if it's one side or the other, please keep your company separate from the political realm. Thank you.

What a stinker of an app. The latest version is virtually unusable. Can't reliably distinguish swipes from taps or scrolls. Artifacts (white dots) keep appearing over images. Every image accompanied by a slide out message about 'trying the look' or some nonsense. Constantly pops up 'user not found' in red. Popup messages telling you that the app has done what you asked. Totally spoils the browsing experience of what is a great concept. And the built in web browser is useless.

Worse with each update, each year. Used to be a great resource for collecting ideas, but now it's the same as IG or FB where the website just cycles you through itself, opens nested windows, prefers the app, and then continually crashes. I've been a user since early beta days--this app has gone way downhill recently. There must be someone new in charge as it's now unbearably slow and cluttered. Further, search and browse are so full of ads i have to wonder whose experience do they really care about. I get it, my attention is a commodity to them...duly noted, I can easily make idea boards on my phone and file recipes on my drive.

So so sad! This was the perfect app for me I love to craft, cook, read, research new ideas, try new things. All the thing I love in one place, and I get to save everything in organized boards. I have used Pinterest practically since its start 10 years ago, when you had to be invited via email. It was so fun and interesting. I don't need circles of people I don't even follow intentionally at the top or my own boards suggested to me; I know where to find them. Just stop.

When pinterest was first developed it was amazing. Able to view others' boards without pop-up ads ruining the entire experience. Now there are at least two ads per view. This isn't part of the app, but some feel it is necessary to thrust the product to the camera. STOP IT. Not cool. Makes me stop watching you.

I wasn't rude to people, I never saved anything innapropriate to my boards, or anything like that. Even my 2nd account was deactivated. I don't think I'll be using this app anymore.

The "search in your pins" field does not work. It used to be fine but each upgrade it gets worse and worse. I can't find any pins without scrolling through them all. Love pintrest, hate the auto refresh. When you click on something within the home screen to look at a link, it automatically bumps you back to the top of the feed. It's so annoying! Pintrest please fix!

This app has been great in so many ways and I love it. But lately the app keeps crashing. I mean it's good app just needs some tweaks.

I love this app and find it helpful in so many ways. I love this app so much. This app let me look at pictures and ideas then I can choose to socialize or not but...why there's no other pictures recommended anymore when I open a picture? I love this app, but the push notifications are becoming annoying. I would like the option to receive a notification showing a daily or weekly roundup of repins, so I can still monitor them easily without receiving notifications all the time.

I like it but it's a lot of ads of people selling, not just sponsored advertisers. Same pins over and over with titles that have nothing to do with the pin. Otherwise, I like it.

After using a Nook for over 10 years and only able to buy books from B&N, I was super excited to get the Amazon Kindle app and try out my new tablet. This app is AWFUL! Still problems: (1) There is still no reading feature to justify texts. (2) Lists of potential purchases can only be added to, not accessed and managed via the app. (3) Unwanted purchases are too easily made. (4) Accidentally deleted purchases r almost impossible to reinstall. (5) Upgrades to Audible don't sync properly. (6) The filter feature is never accurate. (7) Push notifications come through even when switched off. (8) The app is too bulky, using up far too much space (1GB) on a device.

Used to be good. Now it's slow, crashes frequently, focuses on selling you more books instead of reading the ones you have, and forgets where you were in books occasionally. It's like they decided they had enough market share and could start treating their users like cash machines because it's not like you can move your library to another service since you don't actually own the books you buy.

Total garbage. Wants you to sign in every time I use it. Won't let me read my own books, I paid for. Never trust American companies. They are incompetent. Their service is unacceptably low. It took me 20 minutes just to read my own books, because my password was no longer "available". It is my password, I invented. You clowns. On top of this, all my books were deleted. These were my books downloaded on my device. I think I'll just pirate books from now on. Thanks, you clowns. Do not trust them.

I love kindle books. Save trees and paper and all that jazz. But this app is garbage. So slow and unresponsive. I just want to read a book or find a new book to read. I get so frustrated that I can't enjoy the wonder of literature. For all the money I pour into Amazon day in and day out, you'd think I could at least immerse myself in a digital world with minimal effort...

This app keeps locking up.... this has been a problem for months.... It won't follow other devices reliability. If I hadn't spent so much money on books on Kindle I would delete it. One book keeps crashing the app, some books read/work fine one keeps crashing. I am guessing because its do thick.

Everytime the app updates it fixes one thing but breaks something else. Currently dealing with the audio companion only working on some books and not others. The solutions that the help desk gives will fix it for some books but then make other previously working books no longer work, even books that I am currently reading and just a few minutes prior was listening to will no longer have the audio companion available.

This app is very heavy and requires a lot of memory. My 3GB smartphone doesn't allow me to read a book while listening to a song. Why do you feel you require forced access to location and blutooth? Your app should not be dictating a check my location or enable access to blootooth devices. This should be by my option alone. All this is potentially doing is endagering me by tracking my whereabouts or opening my device up to intrusions or attacks. I can not allow this update on this or other devices especially if they do not allow me to disable these totally ppermissions that are totally unecessary for a reader app.

Useless app for mobile reading because there is no mobile view mode. Also dark theme is glitched. Add these things together, and I have no idea how to read anything using this app using phone. Do I have to scroll each line???? Or read each page in 5 size font??? I am looking for something better than Mi Pdf viewer and there is nothing to be found. Sad.

I really want to like this app, but it keeps deleting all my content. I like the ease of looking up words, the highlighting and notes, the ability to do dark mode, etc. Prose books are great in it, comic books range from great to poor. None of that matters however when the app randomly dissociates with my Amazon account and consequently deletes all the downloaded books. This happened twice in the last week. Tech support was no help, they recreated the error but with no solution. Risky investment

Frustrating This app is upsetting, I spent hours reading a book and making notes for a project of mine, I wanted to check the notes and most of them are gone for some reason they were not saved. I said to myself ok calmdown at least you can use the search box with key words to find some of the most important things well that won't work because the book is not enabled for searching.

It's pathetic that we still can't get a simple text-to-voice support. I understand that you want to sell Audible subscriptions. and I'd pay them. But majority of books I want to read are not available on Audible. Audible is mostly mainstream and/or pulp, and very rarely quality specialist books that I need.

The bug has returned. Clicking any hyperlinks on the page crashes the app. Page turning and bookmarks work, but not hyperlinks. To recreate the bug, keep clicking on hyperlinks several times. This bug was introduced in November and fixed in early December only to reappear in the latest update. This does not happen on Kindle Oasis or PC version, but plagues the Android version both on my Galaxy Note 9 and Galaxy Tablet A. Please fix. I use this app daily.

Keeps forgetting my login and settings, forcing me to log in again. Having forgotten all my local settings and downloads, I've had to attempt to recreate it from memory. I gave up the third time. Will attempt looking for solutions again in a few months.

New Update caused issues Signed me out. Upon signing back in- I had to re -do all my settings. AND its wiped my collections!!!! I can see my books (hopefully they're all there) but my collections have been wiped. As someone who reads series of books this is devastating! So angry right now!

Whenever I am opening this app it's showing only one pop-up "Kindle isn't responding" and even if it does it never load the recommendations also it can't synchronise at all. Been 2 weeks and app has been crashes upon ooening. Ive emailed, reported issue and even took tablet to my phone provider, its the app having issues! No replies or reponses from anyone. Not sure what happened. Just purchased two books and they are not in my library and not allowing me to open. WTheck is going on? Just requested a refund from Amazon. Quit advertising to me!!! I hate it!!! I want to look for books the way I would in a bookstore. Love the app but recently alot of the books I read, their sequels have been pulled for some reason. Updated : still About this book shows up every time I open the app so I have to check that option on and off every single time after I bought new books which triggers this stupid option. Whilst Kindle is my go-to app to read books, it is so grating that with every single update: - the shortcut to the app disappears - downloaded books all vanish and have got to be downloaded again, unnecessarily using up data allowance - information about which page was reached is lost for all books, including those read (i.e. unless you had bothered flicking through all pages including the end credits, books you've already read will show up as unread)

Searching missing persons in non-fiction brings up Ann of Green Gables. This is very unhelpful. This is after sorting by relevance. As l sat in my seat, preparing for a 4 hour plane ride, my Kindle app decided it couldn't recognize any of my downloaded books, even though they'd worked fine on my outbound flight. I even delayed switching to airplane mode so I could re-download as suggested, however still no luck. Now here I sit and all appears to be working as normal, literally a day late and I assure you, I won't be spending dollars on Kindle books if I'm hoping to read them while traveling.

Unusable! I've spent hours every day using this app, but with the latest update it will not open the current book I'm trying to read, leaving it unusable and worthless. It's also not syncing my new books to the app. Fix it please!

The app has gone from bad to worse!!! It freezes upon opening, you get that "Kindle isn't responding" message and there is nothing to be done!! audio narrative is full of bugs, doesn't remember where you left off, there are places with glitches and it jumps back to the beginning of the chapter over and over again!!! Amazon I have expected better.

Annoying interface and the making notes option is weird to use in it's current form. And the dioctionary is absolutely unhelpful. Bad translations, the bar pops up when you want to highlight and often covers the word. A pain in the ass to use. I don't understand the hype around this app

I am an avid reader. As such, I have strong opinions about books and authors. I loathe Steven King and self help books. And yet every time I open it up - there are both of them staring me in this face. I've "improved my recs" and they still show up. Ridiculous.

I get an error message every time I try to read a book or save to my library that says Oops! Something went wrong. Please return to the page and try again. Has been going on for days, and I have Kindle Unlimited. Extremely frustrating and defeats the purpose of having the membership.

The author chooses the most atypical, uncommon examples to attempt to "cutely" explain straight-forward concepts - and fails. He writes in a long-winded style which is 80% fluff/superficial comments and 20% "cute", poorly-chosen, nearly useless javascript code examples. Please do not purchase this book.

No Linux version. Chromebook version keeps switching between full screen and "telephone" mode. A true POS. Also does not seem to come up on external monitor. With all your fancy programmers, AMAZON, can you not write a LINUX version or something that will maintain state properly? SAD.

Since the last update the app is borderline unusable. I've been using the app for years and have never had any issues until now. I can't purchase a book on my phone, but apparently it works on my iPad for some reason. I also can't download a book now, which is even better. I don't understand why this is so broken. purchased a book and it won't let me read it. the. then said I exceeded the amount of devices that could read that book immediately after purchasing. had to jump to hoops to find be able to access it again but it won't download any of it.

I would give this app zero stars if possible because it will not open and download books whether bought on Amazon or sent to kindle by me from other book sources. I've not been able to access the Kindle books in the storefront for almost a month and receive a message routing me back to the storefront if I click on a particular book. The tech support agent (April) has been wonderful keeping me informed on the issue status. Resolved on 11/12/20. April advised it was a broken link from the last update. Working fine now!

Was good... but its buggy now and even with background data shut off and wi-fi on, it's still eatting my mobile data and I can't figure out why. I think something is bugged with the downloading and listening to audio books, because once I started using that all my problems started.

I am having so much trouble downloading the books on my phone. Even after deregistration my old phone's are showing up. My desktop application says the books are delivered to phone, but it hasn't. Very frustrated.

Used to be a five. Have had this app for years and loved it. BUT the latest update is a mess and I cannot open any new purchases. No reason why given. The books show in my library but will not open. Guess no more Kindle books for me.

Good app, but the services are deteriorating: 1) Prime benefits are now negligible. Prime reading collection is very bad, as if not even worth to read for free. 2) Removed monthly give away of bestseller for prime. 3) Recommendations and book suggestions, bestsellers are all commercial books. Read gems always stay behind. You find them only when you know them. 4) Lots of different versions for the same books. A lot of collection type books with multiple novels, which often are poor quality.

It is borderline unusable. I zoom in to make the text fit the size of the screen and every time I go to the next page, it resizes so I have to refit it. When I try to scroll down, it just highlights a line or two of text and I can't easily u highlight the text. It just tried to do too much and ends up doing stuff you don't want it to do.

I use this app to read while on move and this app has an excellent sync capability. It syncs all my Kindle books effortlessly. The only problem is that there is not many font sizes available. The size which I have to use is a little big and decrease it one point, it becomes too small. There is no intermediate size available. This improvement will surely make Kindle-Smartphone combo very productive.

Cannot download books. I have books that I was reading on my galaxy s8 without issues, and books that I pre-ordered that are now available. On my Google pixel 4a I cannot get any books to open or download. I even tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app. What's the point in paying for kindle unlimited if I can't even open books?

Disappointed in latest update. The search parameter no longer leys you filter while searching under an author's name, as in price & audible. I am not going to click on every single book to see if it has audible narration, the price or is a free kindle. Why would you get rid of this feature when I pay for a subscription. You've made the app harder to use, not easier, therefore, you will lose business! Switch to Goodreads & your local Library.

Great if you love waiting. Want to open the app? Wait two minutes. Download a book? How about four minutes for it to acknowledge you tapped it? All interspersed with constant messages that Kindle isn't responding. Possibly the worst-optimized app I've ever seen, with ludicrously poor performance across multiple devices. Amazon should be ashamed.

Have had Kindle Unlimited for years. Normally good. Latest update has changed store functionality. You used to be able to view all of an authors books and sort them by publication date. Why can't I make a basic search in kindle store. Either disconnect the store or make it better. It's annoying. Simple things like checking the price of a book is also a struggle.

I've been a Software Engineer for 35 years. The frequency and severity of bugs in this app show some of the worst quality control in the industry, every update worse than before. Update 8.36.0.100: Opening the app often resets the book to the beginning. Just changing to another app and back causes juvenile 'oops' pop-ups, often changing pages by multiple chapters. My advice is download a version from over 2 years ago. It worked back then.

No proper backup system at all. Lost all my notes and highlights twice. A book takes 100 of hours to read and just because you don't have proper backup system, a person loses everything. Leaving kindle...

The reading part of the app is great! Super easy to use. The store is a nightmare. The format is strange, it's hard to search for what you want, and the recommendations are always the same. Like if I haven't bought the books in the last 6 months, why is Amazon STILL putting them at the top of my recommended lists?! Clearly, I don't want them. Also, the way it is always recommending books in a series, but never the first one??? Super annoying and frustrating to use.

Terrible Reader. The store is convenient, but the reader itself has very limited, basic options. The font sizes go from too small to too large, with nothing in between. The same is true of the margins and line spacing. So the formatting options are essentially choices of bad, worse or worst. I would happily uninstall it if I had a better way to read Amazon's ebooks.

I love Kindle but not since the new updates. I hate that it opens to options, not my books. Then, too see my current books I have to go to my library and then click back to home. And whose bright idea was it to include, on my home page, books I've already read? I ONLY want to see what I'm currently reading, not everything I've read. Aaarrrggghhh!

When used on a tablet in a location with poor wifi connectivity, the reader app user experience is awful. Typically it will get slower and slower while reading, then become unresponsive. It often causes spontaneous crashes of Android, triggering a reboot. Often the tablet must be rebooted more than once before the Kindle reader will let you browse and read your books. Occasionally (maybe one time in four), I'll have a trouble free reading experience. No problems with other reader apps.

Bookmarks and notes are terrible. The only way I know to find a bookmark is to look for a dot on the bottom slider - well, they don't all show up there, which means I don't get to see my bookmarks. Notes: is there some reason the notes window has to be so tiny? Furthermore, the app should allow me to write in the blank spaces in the book so that my words appear ON THE PAGE without me having to open up some too-small window - consider us recipe-book readers. Amazon, stop hurting your users.

I took advantage of a cheap 3-month trial but really disappointed at the choice, or lack of it. Even many classics, like many Agatha Christie novels, which are past their copyright period still have to be bought in addition to the subscription. Many series of books have only the first one free as part of the subscription. Too few recent acclaimed books are available. The app itself is good, book choice is poor.

I have a Kindle app on 6 different devices but my collections only sync on 2 of them. On this device (Lenovo Android) the collections appeared, but the books were unsorted. I have over 1200 books from Amazon with a large number of non-fiction that I go back to frequently. Not having functioning collections is an issue. Also, on 2 devices, the dictionary periodically disappears requiring a reboot to bring it up. Kindle app makes you hesitant to upgrade your device.

I could not "rent" new books on the app (2ish year old android phone) and support was unable to determine or fix the issue with the app 1 star for when it worked 1 star for the support person I called I tried chatting with customer support (which tried nothing at all) and calling customer support. The person I called determined it was an app issue, but there was no time frame for a fix (work around was "renting" through a browser for kindle unlimited books).

The user interface makes it awkward to categorize books, and it is also makes it hard to find books that I had previously categorized. I wish each book had a metadata field for entering why I purchased the book, especially a searchable one so that I could find all books recommended by Mom, for example, or books that I have noted are useful for my research (I just want to search by whatever words might appear in my personalized metadata for the book). Currently, I have to just enter a book note.

Please for the love of God add a way to see missing or new books in a series I am reading, its getting harder and harder to find what I am looking for, especially now that you can't even search an authors content by date. A way to keep track of previously read books from kindle unlimited would be great too, I know I have forgotten about a series or two I liked because I read the first book in kindle unlimited like a year ago, new books are probably out but I can't remember the series or author

I've used this app for years and years, and have weathered it's many, many changes, both good and bad. But now you've taken away my ability to download a "sample" more than once? Unforgivable. You've also changed the app from opening up in the book I'm reading or my "home" to the store instead, which scared the nonsense out of me, thinking my precious library was gone. Stop messing with things that were perfectly fine! (Also, I want my samples back after returning KU books!)

Good for the most part, but no matter what options I choose in the reading settings, the "about this book" and popular highlights show up. I really dislike and never use these features. Well kindle is excellent, but what isn't is what you get for the paid for service. I find it unbelievable that I pay for a service that provides very few decent books as a result. It's insulting considering the vast fortune of Amazon. I have both Prime and unlimited, and decent books you would expect such as serious sci-fi novels are entirely missing (e.g. foundation trilogy). It's the same with amazon prime video service though, most new & decent films or series they charge for.

Book downloads for my phone get stuck way too often. The app has always been finicky, and I hate how cluttered the interface is, since it wants you to buy more and more and more books and so advertises anything remotely related and you can't turn the recommendations off. Ugh.

Almost as good as the Windows 98 version of Microsoft Reader. (Not to be confused with the vastly-inferior Windows 10 version of Microsoft Reader.) I was so in love with this App until they changed the layout. I love, love my Kindle, but the layout has messed everything up.

Terribly unreliable at best. Good luck with your kindle unlimited membership. You can hardly download anything without there being an issue regarding downloading it. Half of the time you can't download it because of some error issue/message. This is ridiculous.

And sometimes that screws up and sits in my library, where I can't read it or delete it, until I force quit Kindle. Come on guys!

I have used this app for years, not having many problems, mainly just that its recommendations are horrible. Now it is almost unusable.
