Search function is slow, clunky, and inaccurate. sometimes I search for a book or author that I know exists and nothing pops up, so I have to go to Amazon in order to put it in my cart, then come back to Kindle to download it. It's an okay app, at best. Once you have something in your library, the reading experience is nice.

The app lacks its own text-to-speech, and relies on operating system TTS, which is a struggle because it reads all of the surrounding menu text each time you turn the page, and because it is not user friendly. Google Books has its own TTS that is easy to use.

In ny opinion the interface is too crowded, the organization on the kindle store is look a bit messy. Side loaded files do not display their thumbnails in the library unless they're downloaded. The app also doesn't notify you when your wishlist books go on sale. I like the kindle app, I use it frequently. I hope all the issues can be fixed in the future updates.

Ebooks are such a wonderful idea but Amazon really ruins it with the app. On the version that came on my Fire 7 they have light text on light backgrounds, over all they have small and icons that cannot be zoomed, and they don't have a speech generator to allow you to listen to books that do not have audio. This could be such a wonderful tool for people with low vision but they don't support that usage in their library or store sections of the app.

I use the app on my phone. I love the selection and the prices!! I give it a five star just for that. Unfortunately I have to give it a 3 because of how often I have to re download a book or audio book after I've started reading. Sometimes I have to involve tech support. They are friendly but take days to resolve an issue. Again this a great app full of books for any age or genre but its also full of quirks.

kindle is often sluggish when I tap the icon. I don't understand, it used to quickly bring up whatever I was last reading, but now seems to spend a lot of time phoning home before showing me my local content. I just want to read my books, not boast about my reading or get recommendations or any other internet shenanigans. please give us a pure reading version. thanks

Constantly it is a very nice app.. We can browse and search novels, dictionaries, comics etc. With the name.. it is very useful also we can read the popular books of great writers,scholars, socialists, etc.. We can use this app in free time also by reading the books instead of playing games in the mobile.. In all directions I found the app very useful and progressive for our bright future

I have loved using Kindle on my phone for a long time. But today 01/07/21, it will not work. I can't access the store and it will not sync. I unistalled and reinstalled, still nothing. Please help. It works on my fire tablet, but this app doesn't.

Suddenly the text of every book I open appears in landscape. It will not rotate to portrait! This is true of every book I have opened. My preference is the portrait. I have tried restarting my phone, but that made no difference. Is there a fix for this?

I like to have the text to read options instead of signing up for audible. it should be standard for those with impaired vision. the pc version does not work well either. but it's still a good app although it lacks needed features.

Navigation not very good/convenient for reference books that I need to flip around pages alot (i.e. sheet music). As well, would be beneficial to recognize QR codes in books. Right now the only way I can do that is to display on one device and use camera on another device

I've using kindle dor years now. But the customer service i connected with was terrible. Not only s/he failed to recognised, let alone fix my issue, s/he even cancelled my purchase without my permission. I had to repurchase said item on different vendor since i doubt the issue can be fixed by their customer service. The continuous flow mode is a blessings, sadly it didn't work with all book, some stcuk on flip page mode without option for continues flow mode. Displaying table was terrib though

the kinds is great I just sometimes can't read on it long. Even with the brightness turned down. sometimes a book in the hand is better. But this is also great for reading on the go and especially if you don't have space to keep a ton of book

Can't tell if all your new books have downloaded so either needs a new tab that shows the books not on device or a book count in the librarys all & downloaded tabs or on either side of the tab headers. Needs an option to decrease books sizes by either deleting or changing pictures size/color depth. An option to have all books in a single 7zip file to save space (or easy transfer to new device) & only the book you're reading uncompressed. An install all new books button.

Laying in bed, and I couldn't sleep, so I thought I would install the Kindle reader. After waiting for 10 minutes, book still wasn't open, I rebooted my phone. Book still wouldn't open, so I tried a different book in my library. So far every book has opened, except the first one I tried, which is of course the one I want to read.

I have been using this app for years, the lates update removed all of my settings and deleted my books and collections. It is very time consuming to download them AGAIN and sort them AGAIN. what did you do? I am not even sure if i can get them all back, as not all were purchased from Amazon. Update... 01/05/21... I do not know what you did, but the app keeps removing books that i am waiting to read. I do not always have access to wifi to keep downloading them. It also sorted the books into ser

I have owned kindle books for many years now, the problem I have is with the experience more than anything. Many of my books aren't marked read as I don't usually read he free chapters at the end. The unlimited service is good, but I find that not having the books I have already read marked is a pain. Also, their recording of the time I read and number of days read in insights is always off. That said, if there were another system to read all of the books I already own, I would switch.

Too many "false" recommendations and stuff I'm not interested in, like a counter for the days I've been reading in row. Ok for people who want this, but it's too big and blatant and doesn't have to be on the fro t page.

Overall, a very good app for reading. My only complaint is the repeated display of Library, with all it's revolting advertisements (labeled recommendations), when I want to default to Home, with the books I'm actually reading.

It's good, but could be better. Like I want to transfer a book to my pc, and there is no way. Now before you respond with download kindle app for pc, stop. I did that twice and it does not work. Sorry Amazon.

I just wish you guys didnt make it so hard for people to use text-to-speech because I have an executive function disorder. It's an invisible disability that makes it hard for me to retain information. i understand you are trying to promote whisper-sync and audible but people with disabilities shouldn't have to pay extra because it's already hard for us to hold down jobs.

Desperately needs exact string search for large reference book lookups, for doctors, lawyers, pastors, researchers, and software developers (me), there are many things I just can't look up with the dumbed-down search of Kindle, and I have invested thousands of dollars in this platform. Code Complete, I have it in paper, AND in Kindle! With that one feature, I would give it a 5!

Very disappointed in this Â£300+ kindle. My earler one lasted years without any problems. This one keeps freezing, won't turn on or off, takes hours sometimes overnight to reboot itself. I have removed the protective cover which turns the device on and off when opening and closing and there seems to be some improvement. I've reported twice to Amazon, the 2nd time asking for a replacement, but because it was then 13 months old refused and offered me a mere 15% off a new one.

Ill give it 2 1/2 stars. Though it takes a lot work to download a book from the public library(and I HATE that there's no way to find out if there is a choice of epub PRIOR to borrowing books) it does work in the end ON MY ANDROID PHONE. It does not, however, work at all on my kindle fire. It doesn't seem to recognize that device and it never downloads into that kindle app.

I use Kindle a lot. Something needs to be done about your shopping lists feature. I can't merge them and can't delete them and I have over forty of them now, causing confusion. Why even have them at all with no user control?

This is a great book service app. One I reccomend. The reason for the three stars is that there are many books that are not there and I have had to use Google play books to get them as there is more choices so I would like kindle to try to make more choice.

Can't access store on newest tablet. I have Kindle installed on two Android tablets. For several weeks now, the app on the newest tablet will not connect to the store. Fortunately, it still works on the older tablet so I can download books and then sync them, but it is an unnecessary extra step. I have done every troubleshooting trick in the book and talked to a Kindle tech, but nothing works. Very annoying!

they desperately need to fix their recommendations. suggesting books I've already read through the app commonly. I pay for Kindle unlimited so they suggest other paid books first. the reading part is fine though, night mode is nice on the eyes.

love the convenience but get frustrated with app design. Add a place where we can manage the device registration for example as you insist to limit devices and restrict downloads. My actual kindle does not sync and it's not that old. 3 stars for potential but really it's a 2, you can easily improve

Translator doesn't support many languages. I'm mostly happy with this app, but this one little thing that's very important to me - translation to Hebrew - my mother tongue language. While the app seems to use Bing translator - which supports Hebrew and many other languages - the app supports only a VERY SMALL subsets of those languages. I really don't understand why.

It used to be great. Now it seems like every couple of days I have to uninstall and reinstall the app just to be able to download a few books. Some books download just fine but others get hung up. This happens every single day.

use this app all the time. the only thing i really do not like about it is that i am unable to delete library books(or really the notice saying that the book was returned)/purchased books from the inventory. having a clean inventory is very important to me.

Wish it was easier to navigate my new paperwhite. The kindle app is a decent app but paired with a Kindle device not as much. That said, I use my every day. If I knew of a better option I'd use something different.

I purchased a book recently and cannot open it. For years I had no problems. I believe that Amazon has had some limitations which I do not understand. I use my cell phone as my device for my Kindle use.

Love this app! Plenty of good free reading but also some limitations to. I just think that if your already paying a monthly Amazon fee that all the books on Kindle should be for free. Except of course new releases. But after they've been out for a year or longer then they should be free. Because there's some old stuff on there u gotta still pay for if u wanna read it. I read a Darth Maul book free. But the next book in the series u had pay for to read it.

Still get a ton of recommendations for books I have already read. Also, the majority of top picks and new books recommended are books I'd never read and have shown no interest in. Finally, if you have kids or teens you will have to look into what they are reading. Have found several books in the sci-fi and fantasy section that were listed as children books, listed for ages 12-18 and were basically nothing more than lewd pornographic content.

Mostly good, but I'm fed up of it forcing me to read in landscape instead of portrait. It's supposed to be a book! I'd also like to be able to archive books when I don't want to read them any more. I'm sure my original Kindle had that facility.
It's over sensitive to screen touches, in that it turns a page when I'm trying to pull down from the top to access the Android system. Other than that annoyance it's very good.

I have used this app for years. Loved it suddenly it will not allow me to look at books to download load. Keeps giving me a message 'sorry we have a problem try using search or go to store front' I am using a galaxy tab A. I did down load it to my phone and it works well. I need it to work on my tablet.
Good reader. The only thing I wish would get fixed, the font size adjustment is too coarse. The selection goes from small to large size with nothing in between.
It is convenient but not so helpful. It would be great to see features for the impaired or for students writing book reports. Just a suggestion. It might help revenues.
The reader itself great. Amazon's need for proprietary control sucks. I speak of not being able to use it to read e pubs and other material not being sold on Amazon or able to borrow from library.

Took prime subscription for prime reading. ya, there were decent amount of books available but as universal, the book we wish or become excited about turns out 'kindle unlimited' subscription. Thus, money money money!

Like the Amazon website, the Kindle app is very sluggish and prone to making you tap things you didn't mean to because of the lag. It's a good thing Amazon is always willing to accept a return and give a refund, because that "1-click buy" has gotten me a couple of times.

Excellent reader. Nice features. Almost no complaints except: Images/Illustrations/Diagrams appear really small, cannot open it full screen or zoom in. Long press opens a magnifier but that also is very small.

In most cases experience has been good. However, in past in two books had issues with content and navigating using standard control. Contact with Amazon is difficult and it doesn't provides much support. So when buying a book it is recommended to To check full book including table of contents for completeness i.e. missing chapter or pages etc Any issues related to navigation e.g. enlarging of fonts etc.

Kindle on my phone does not give me page numbers. I want page numbers. I like the fact that I can get Kindle on my phone, but when I get interrupted, I prefer a page location rather than a percentage of reading accomplished and rate of reading.

Zoom Feature - Am I missing something? The zoom is non-existent on the app version. I can't even zoom in on pages in the PC version. The app says you have to double tap but if I even tap the screen once, it changes the mode that the page is on. It just leaves me feeling dumb and frustrated. It's a nitpick that goes a long way because some books on here have small print that I can't see even if I squinted (Lord knows how awfully pixelated some of them look on the PC, that again, you can't zoom).

This was a great app... Super easy to use. The last update had made it so u can't buy books from the store. I have to use my laptop to make purchases then they appear on the app for me to read. It's a pain. If they get it fixed it will be 5 stars again :)
Problematic. Frequently closes on it's own or freezes. Often fails to sync reading progress with other Amazon devices. Using the app on an Android phone with updated software.

What the hell Kindle you give us Insights for around 5 days then take it away again. Never been so disappointed in an app. Was 3 Stars now 2.5 Stars...

good collection and you can find occasionally value but you need to dig before you can find what you want. I like the preview and sample download to be most helpful and the note taking feature never works.

The app would have been actually useful for me if it had provided dark mode for reading, with whitish text on dark grey background, like in many popular apps. The bright white text on pitch black background hurts my eyes just as much as black text on white background.

Not the best entry to this series. A lot of the tension among the allies felt poorly done, even forced a time or two. Still, story lines are all generally wrapped, and the conclusion is mostly satisfying.

What happened to continuous scrolling? I have always used continuous as my preferred choice. I read mostly in bed and find out the most comfortable way of moving forward in the text. Its not necessarily a deal breaker but I do hate it when devs remove features. Gutted.

Audible is better this is ok but sneaky there is a 3.00 charge feom this app O supect it amazon ðŸ˜
It looks cool but its just books
Only used it a few times so I have no real good opinion, sorry...
It isn't to bad application you pay for a book, of your choice, and injoy the reading of it....

I like to have the text to read options instead of signing up for audible. it should be standard for those with impaired vision. the pc version does not work well either. but it's still a good app although it lacks needed features.
Cannot access the wish list in app. Missing book after purchase.
Functional, but slow and clunky in some areas.
I am now downloading 8t read the book harry potter and the crushed child It has not yet downloaded I dont know whether it will be available on it or not
You can add books to a wish list, but the list is then nowhere to be found. A blatant omission in the app.
ðŸ‘Œ cool
Meh!
nice

The app lacks its own text-to-speech, and relies on operating system TTS, which is a struggle because it reads all of the surrounding menu text each time you turn the page, and because it is not user friendly. Google Books has its own TTS that is easy to use.
good
I wish it offered a read function so I could listen while on the road
Works as advertised

This use to be wonderful app but for SOME UNKNOWN REASON on TWO of my devices at different TIMES this MONTH my BOOKS WILL NOT OPEN. ..Hoping reinstalling will work on this device ..on my large device NO WAY TO REINSTALL..ðŸ’©
Why does it drain my battery

I have loved using Kindle on my phone for a long time. But today 01/07/21, it will not work. I can't access the store and it will not sync. I unistalled and reinstalled, still nothing. Please help. It works on my fire tablet, but this app doesn't.
Great reading app. The only problem is that you can't move it to a memory card since it disappears when you switch your phone off and you have to instal it again
you can make this much better.
love it for the books, and the magazines. easy, and intuitive user interface.

I love reading on my kindle fire. It takes metrics while I read like how much time left in the chapter and in the book. I determine whether I'll keep reading or take a break! I can read stories to my boys at night in the dark with my kindle at bedtime. I have it a 4 instead of 5 because some books are unavailable that I'm interested in and I want to use kindle like a one-stop shop. I would definitely recommend using this for your reading.

I enjoy this app every day! I have my library available wherever I am. There are many tools available to customize how I want to read, or to organize my library, to Sync a book with my other devices, to make notes and highlights within my books and have them added to a journal, and the ability to share text, and lookup words, and more. I've used this app a lot for personal and group study. I appreciate the deep discounts and the huge selection of books and audio available!

its simple to use and buy books at cheap price. and I love it. thank you Amazon for this. I installed this app for the first time and it was so easy and good that I bought a book within 5 minutes. its brilliant. but I would say there are still books which I don't find over here. can you do something about this. Albert Einstein and His Inflatable Universe ----Book by Mike Goldsmith I want this book on kindle.help me! then i will rate it 5.

Pretty close to ideal. With the highlighting options, quick review of highlights, quick skip of pages, continuous scrolling instead of flipping between pages. My only concern is that the back button takes you back to the library instead of going back to the previous page. This seems to be a problem mainly with Android version, not Apple. Also for the application you cannot do audio reading; an option that is reserved for the actual kindle device.

I'm an avid reader who is always in the middle of a new book. It took me a while to get into buying digital books because I enjoy re-reading and sharing them with friends. I also like to see all of the books I've read accumulate on the book shelf. It gives me a feeling of accomplishment. But since I began using Amazon Kindle I've only read digital books. They are cheaper and I'm still able to re-read them and transfer them to any of my devices. It's very convenient.

Living out of the US, Kindle is very convenient for me because it's hard to find English books and the price and delivery time for hardcover/paperback books to overseas is not quite what I'm looking for. 1 star from 5 stars because I feel some Kindle books' prices aren't that much cheaper than the hardcover/paperback...

Love this app. There's plenty of great book option that are absolutely free to read and everything is available at my fingertips. My only complaint would be that searching for free books in the particular genre that I like to read, can be challenging. I needed up joining a monthly subscription service to be able to read more books from my favorite authors. With the subscription I'm limited on how many books I can have in my library and have to trade them out if I want more.

I love reading and Kindle makes it a lot easier to read wherever I want without the threat of losing or damaging my reading material. However, my main complaint is the Kindle isn't very good at image rendering and it can be difficult to view textbooks, cookbooks, or light novels to their fullest. Still, I am satisfied with what I did get from this app.

I loved this book. It was well and tightly written. The history was well researched. The only thing i didnt care fot were the frequently dropped f-bombs. I'm no prude, but more than one or two in your basic sentence are generally too much. Especially from well brought up girls. Otherwise, this is an excellent read, well worth your time.

Love it but...two things that would be a great improvement and save some aggravation is if there was some indicator that shows if you already read a book. I have read 100's of books and authors change the covers and sometimes the descriptions. I then am buying or borrowing a book I already read. Also, maybe an option to stop seeing certain recommendations of a genre of books based of recently read books. If I didn't care for a book, I am now shown countless recommendations just like it.

I love this app. My only concern is that there are not enough books that you can listen to without having to pay a considerable amount, when all you want to do is listen instead of reading. This is where I am able to find so many good books, but I can't reading when I'm at work because I work with my hands continually moving.

I love reading books on Kindle. They have got a wide range of collections. In this digital age Kindle acts as an easily accessible library. Sometimes the prices may seem high. But that's according to the sellers. Sometimes they have sales too and a great chance to posses your favourite genre of books. Go get reading & Have fun.

I was a novel a week gal until an accident- this app has helped me reconnect with my love for books and I am happy for that! Without Amazon prime though- I probably wouldn't use.... sadly it would be too expensive. I prefer paper- real books, and if I was paying the same amount I'd def order used books.

Kindle is very easy to use. You can also highlight texts and make notes. If there's words you don't understand, you can click on the word to get it's definition. The sad thing is these functions only work with books downloaded from amazon and supported apps, not all e-books. Still, good stuff.

I love some aspects but others annoy or frustrate me. like they used to have a place where you could go book marks. if you moved away but wanted to come back no problem. But not anymore. I like some of the overview page thumbnails. And what it does it does well. But would like a bit more of what it once was as well.

I have been using kindle books for about 10 years. I would rather read from an actual book, but this is much easier to carry hundreds of books at a time. with the app, I can read from my laptop, tablet or phone, and all are synchronized to my kindle.

many deals and offers... able to search by keywords, really liking the Litrpg results. good pricing on the unlimited... good 'sort by' system once I understand it. very few crashes. would have enjoyed a nightlight function or search function using a picture of a book... but I'm not too disappointed with the customisations available whole reading... a bit of a pain that some custom only show when rotated display... overall a great book-reading app!

so far so good. I use it all the time. however, I gave it a 4 star because of the difficulty it is to find books that are listen and read. Not the books to listen to through the Kindle Audio but the other program. I pay 7.99 a month for the subscription and have a hard time finding books that indicate listen and read. very frustrating to spend hours trying to find books to listen too in my subscription. when I search its all mainly the Kindle Audio.

Interesting storyline and characters but gets tedious in some of the details. Also has repetitive quips and descriptions of some characters and things, where I find myself skipping over phrases and lines which have been used multiple times before. But overall I like the strong female character trying to do good for her country and people, that isn't swayed by riches and maintains a high moral code.

the app is well made, I mainly just want there to be a way to separate reviews into parts, so a separate review for the content of the books vs how well the publisher has done to put together a decently edited digital version of the book. I also would like an easier way to discover content, it feels like you get boxed into the same few categories, and I also would like to blacklist certain purchases from influencing your algorithm without deleting them entirely.

The app is great. I'd like to see the homepage a bit more customisable with the title/author under the cover picture and the chance to hide the suggestions and offers to give my library some more space: I don't need a constant reminder of other titles. When I need it I can always show this part

If you buy the audible book through the Audible app separate from the Kindle book. Kindle has a hard time syncing the 2 together later, sometimes it's practically impossible to be able to read the book while the audio is playing along too. Also when you do have them synced the audio will be highlighted while it's going, but often times what is highlighted is falling more and more behind the audio.

Honestly I love it!! You can pretty much find any book you want and some you didn't think you'd want. There's books for kids as well as adults. I only put 4/5 stars because I personally don't like really short stories and there is quite a few short stories. Other than that it's your own personal library

almost perfect...need to be able to set/change default open screen (library or last location), change text color in black mode (light grey), fix collections so they're easier/more intuitive to use (takes a lot of trial and error to figure out), choose type of notifications (specify genres, authors and change frequency to weekly/monthly)...there may be more, but those are at the top of my wishlist

Can't beat the content. The reader is also great. My biggest issue is just with how overloaded the functionality is. Scrolling the last page should either close the book or do nothing. It shouldn't be completely different from the close button and be a rate and upsell screen.

A good integration between a personal digital library/reader and online storefront. the ebook reader feels well designed and comfortable to read. criticism: organizing your personal library is still a bit of a chore. ebooks are convenient in many ways, but for organizing them, physical books, I feel have an advantage.

I love this app, wherever I go. However, I would like more free Unlimited choices. I frequently try an author find that I like them and all the other books from that author are pay per book. Some are substantial, like paying for a print book, some are nominal, but I do pay for the Unlimited service... so its a bit irritating.

I wish my Kindle Paperwhite worked as well as this Android app. Everything about the experience except backlighting and screen size is better on the Google Kindle app (Galaxy Note 10) than on an actual Kindle. Better touchscreen action, smoother interface with Kindle store, and better user interface (paging, navigating, etc.) Seems funny that the Amazon app on the Google-based device works better than the Amazon hardware, but there it is.

Nice app with great selection and decent price. However, most advantages with prime membership aren't available within the app (I found out in an email and need to redeem through external browser) and you can't mark books as already owned (half the suggestions I get are for stuff I already own on paperback).

Works well and syncs progress between devices. EDIT: dropped one star - received notification on phone of a title I might be interested in, so I followed it only to have the app launch but no sign of the said title. Not a big issue but irritating. Wife tells me this often happens.

The Kindle app is the best e-reader I've used. It's not perfect, but it does a good job across many of the functions necessary for a positive experience when reading ebooks. Unfortunately the Kindle app for Android differs significantly from the Kindle app for iOS in many of its functions. For some things, the Android app is better, but for others, the iOS app is better. And both of them are vastly superior to an actual Kindle device, the Kindle app for Windows, and the web-based reader.

I love the accessibility and range of books. My only criticism is that you lose your books if you close your amazon account and as we have paid for these books, not just a subscription, I think this is quite poor. So now I only buy books on kindle that I don't mind losing and are alot cheaper than the physical book

I love being able to access books whenever I want. There are some books I couldn't so find limitations there. overall good app. I like that it saves my pages, where I left off. I like the helpful features to take notes.

The app is good but i have only one issue which i am generally facing while i am reading any book is that if accidentally i am touching the screen the page is getting turned when i am in the bed. This is not the issue with Google play book that i had faced. This app requires a important update that when there is an accidental touch and when is really i am changing the page.

I've replaced filling my downtime by browsing social media with reading and it's so much more relaxing/fulfilling, on top of which I'm finally getting through books I haven't finished because I didn't set time aside to sit down and read. The UI for this app is extremely intuitive and user friendly, also customizable so reading off a screen isn't a strain on your eyes. The only reason I can't give 5 stars is that the app pretty quickly drains my phone's battery

Although I like hard copies of books. Like when you have a book in your hand a quilt over you on your cozy bed what else you need!! But this app is a good alternative to read books. I will recommend to read short stories on this app because for me novels and book series are good only when you have a physical copy of them. But it's still a good app. The only drawback is that it is not advisable on a mobile. I suggest to use it on tablet because the font size troubles a lot. But overall thumbs up.

An interesting and absorbing story, very well written, but sadly inconclusive. Strange to think that after all the investigation and interviews we still don't know what happened any more than they did back in 1959. What intreged me was a passing mention of something Irwin said happened when he was 3 years old, which is not followed up on by Booher. In his defence though, amnesia has altered his interviewees mind - so sad that no regression hypnosis was tried.

pretty good, one of the best on the market obviously. However the app makes no use of the Galaxy Fold 2's capabilities, and more critically, won't let me send to kindle a web page, or .epub, or even .txt file straight from my phone. I have to go to my computer to use the Chrome Extension? Really? the iPhone version let's you do it all from the phone. Disappointing, but manageable.

very good app for reading books. You can find almost any book here. You may have to buy some Books because they are not available for rental on subscription. But still there so many books you can read just with subscription alone. You can also change the app theme into dark mode and turn on the page turning effect which is so cool. I won't recommend this app to people who likes to read free books but the subscription is not very expensive.

Kindle's a great app and simple to use. Sometimes I'm not sure about their cataloging when checking alphabetically or by author in my library, inconsistent. I did like the old version better because I hate having to look at the "recomends" now.

The app does what it is supposed to most of the time. The newer updates have gotten rid of most the glitches and crashes of earlier versions. The recommendation system is not great, but for a free reading app, it works pretty well. Plus you save a ton off of list prices.

almost perfect. however even by lowering the brightness off my phone the color of the page is too intense. On google's app they allow the color of the page to be change to a dark yellow. I had to be the Oasis just to get the brightness Option. therefore I give this app 4.

it's the app I use to read and it's good enough that I dont really need to look for another one. It's pretty solid except it's kinda slow on loading things, which is just annoying enough to dock a star. btw my phone is relatively new and fast so it's the app for sure.

I love this app. But there was a feature that has disappeared. In library/collections there was a category at the end for books that were not assigned to any of my categories. From there I could add them when I wanted. It no longer shows up and organizing my books is now difficult if I wait to add them. Can this be fixed? I need it even more, now that "home" does not show all the books I own anymore. Please help. Thanks

I love my kindle app. Works just like an eReader but smaller. I have had issues in the past where all of my books undownloaded for some reason and that took a really long time to fix. But overall, it's great.

One of the best online reading app. A wide variety of books and easy storage. Although the page curl feature of Google Play book feels better. One the best feature of this app for me is sharing and storing our own downloaded books as PDF, though it can't be read like Kindle original books but still it's good. They should work on this to integrate downloaded books.

"Add To Wishlist" feature creates a new shopping list everytime you try to add a book to your wishlist when using an android tablet. This is the only reason that this app has a star knocked off. It creates a big mess of lists when I've already created a list for books I'd like to read. Judging by the forums this has been an issue for years. It would be great to see it fixed. Otherwise the app is very nice.

Pretty great! Sometimes the sync between devices is a little bit off or I can't open a book at all. Those 2 things are frustrating. Everything else I love! Well it would be nice if there were 2 separate book lists for read and unread also. Â¯\(ãƒ„)/Â¯

Great app. Not only great collection of paid books but the free ebook category is equally massive and qualified. Only request is to delink use of Amazon acount from Kindle app and Amazon app. At times there are multiple users of Kindle in family using common tablet etc for reading and it is quite difficult to manage such accounts in Kindle and Amazon on same device

I am addicted to reading and this is by far my most used app but I wish it had better features. I have a lot of books and scrolling through could be easier... and maybe a star system on the books within the app would be good to help me remember how I liked them if I wanted to re-read something or not.

it's a great program that delivers what it says it will. there are lots of tweaks and adjustments that can be made to the displayed text and colours etc. I particularly like the way I can use the app on multiple devices and it synchronises when I open any of the books! The sample option lets you trial most books and downloads via whispernet in the background! I wish I could transfer my purchased books between my other accounts or lend them to my partner?

it's really good. I have been using this app for years. This along with my Kindle keep the experience almost seamless. A minor grip is I wish it automatically makes a document out of all the highlights and notes we make, per book, like Google does with playbooks, where a document per book is saved in GDrive if we have any highlights or notes in that book.

The Kindle app is user friendly. I like the set up. I can easily download a book anywhere using my phone. It's great as I don't have to take an extra device if I don't want to but I still have access to my library when out. It is easy to connect to, and buy books from, the Kindle store. I haven't had any problems using it.

I absolutely love ðŸ’—the kindle unlimited!!!! it is absolutely fantastic!!!!ðŸ’—Reading ðŸ“š is so very important to me and my family ðŸ‘ª kindle has made it easier to read to much wider horizons than I could unless I lived in a library.....

Love the options for different reading settings, and love that series are now grouped. I really would like a feature that allowed you to see if the next book was out in a series I own. The notifications of books coming out often get lost in the multitude of notifications on my phone.

It has been a great experience with kindle. It provided me with global and indigenous books.But the cause of my disgruntle us only the charge that i paid. It seemed to be a bit expensive for me but yet I purchased its scheme.One more think that I would like to address here is the deficit of some books in kindle Unlimited. swaying all these it was a good experience.

I love being able to read 5 books at the same time and make notes and search them. I seem to learn better this way for some reason. And I'm happy because my brain is actively engaged in contemplating various topics together. I am inadvertently finding and making connections between dog behaviour, anti racism, buddhism, and addiction recovery, right here in the palms of my hands.

love the app. I just wish there was an easier way to organize everything and keep up with everything you have already read. Maybe even have a notification come up saying that youve already read a book, so you do not borrow or buy a book more than one. Kindly unlimited is a must!

Kindle is a great place to read books but some books which I wanted to read like 'Diary of a Wimpy kid' is not free. This book has 15 parts and none of the part is free. It is very disappointing that none of the 15 parts are free. And overall Kindle is a great app!!!

I love that I can take my books with me anywhere, anytime; write notes, look up meaning of words or references. Now, if Kindle could only just develop an app where it can give off that gloriously comforting smell like books, it'll be perfect!!

Good value for a high volume reader, selection is ever expanding. I would really like some enhancements to the filters/search capabilities on the history of borrowed Kindle books (by title and by series). (hence the 4/5 star rating)

I love it. I love the recommendations, I love that it saves my books and that it let's me organize them by author, and it has a night mode, highlighters and I built in dictionary if I come across a word I don't know. I do wish it would let me organize them by what I have and haven't read. I think that would be useful, but otherwise great app.

Love being to read whenever, wherever. 2 things that would make it better: 1. Some sort of indicator in the store for books you've already read. 2. A dark mode option for the actual books. I've read on other apps that give you different shades of grey for the pages and, personally, I prefer a dark background with white letters

Overall good, but whispersync doesn't work as well as it should, or as well as it used to. Especially between audible and the kindle book. I'd say 50% of the time it doesn't correctly update the location. That being said, everything else works like it should and I do a ton of reading on my phone.

I have the Kindle Unlimited subscription as well and I like that some of the books have a free audible upgrade. The app is easy to use, but there are occasional mistakes or typos. Overall I like the convenience of having the app on my phone so I can read wherever I am.

The Kindle application is pretty neat for me especially while I'm hassled with a health problem and would rather not go to my personal library for a good read. I like being able to use the convenience of this program to enjoy reading my interests from my portable device. Thank you for another neat product.

I use this app all day long it has never crashed or let me down I love kindle unlimited its honestly the best that I've stopped reading on play books and only use kindle on my phone. It only gets 4â˜†'s because there isn't enough options for font and viewing and a lot grammatical errors in every book but I still use it 24/7 so thanks. P.s. it would be really nice if there were more erotica on kindle unlimited.

I am glad they have updated the app to delete books that a person no longer. wants. However they need to add that feature to books that have been checked out from the library. Or make it so when the lending period is over not only is the book returned but the cover disappears off the kindle account.

works but missing features. would love to see custom page-color, custom font colors and the ability to reverse the option to flip the page with volume controls. overall works well on a good quality phone screen.

Thank you for this app. All I want now is to share files (pdf etc.) between my PC and phone. You know like trough cloud storage or something. My collections sometimes dissapear without apparent reason and its a pain to rearrange a 150+ library. I live in fear that this will happen again.)) To have build in translation tools will be super cool.

Love the great selection of Kindle Unlimited books. I just wish it would indicate whether you've borrowed it before and not have ones you've already read in your suggested reading list. Five stars if those two features were added!

Generally, it's a great app and I've read plenty of books through it. I just find the UI a bit weird and not as intuitive as it could've been. The sync feature _mostly_ works but is also not terribly well thought out (ideally, it'd be seamless, but it's definitely not). Hence, one star off for that.

Pretty good app, one complaint. My Galaxy S20 full screen view includes the front facing camera at the top of the screen, so the text is interrupted by it while I read (and my eyes are always drawn to the top line). If there was an option for text to end just underneath the camera, that would be a great feature.

Getting there. Love the last update where you can permanently delete the books from the app. Now add a language filter itll be even better! **edit/update*One of the new updates I do not like is when you click on the author's name it brings it up totally different than before. Its hard to look up books or buy them, please go back to the original way!

I love using my kindle. I cannot get access to Kindle unlimited in New Zealand though so that is not great, unless there is something I am missing when I have tried. I am also onto my third Kindle as they do not seem to last that long when you use them every day and have lots of books downloaded. I love the ready access to new reading material.

I would give a 5 star rating if the ap had the option to read aloud. Alexa will read my books aloud, but that burns up my data. I can't afford audiobooks and my eyesight is getting pretty bad. Come on Amazon, help an old guy out!

Although it takes a little while to get used to the way it's set up, it's pretty good. One thing I don't like is that when you go to the store to look at other books, it does not instantly recognize that you bought that specific title already. Also, I wish there were more authors offering their books for this format.

I love Amazon Kindle, its convenient to read, store, take notes and export the highlights and notes. A concern though about being a prisoner in a closed ecosystem. For that concern only, I gave 4 out of 5.

love this app. only giving it a 4 starts because the app has been glitching the last 2 weeks and says "Oops, unable to download try again." for almost every single book I try to select it definitely gets very frustrating.

I am able to get nearly everybook I want an usuallyat a better price than I could get it elsewhere. Plus, I am able to chang the font if I don't like it & make the print larger, which makes books books much easier to read. I would recommend Kindle to anyone thinking of getting a digital reader.
The kindle app is very useful, i get to read sample of books without buying them outright. It give you the opportunity to know how interesting the book is before you purchase it.

I love this app but have 2 things I'd like to see change. the app should be able to keep track of books already read/borrowed. you don't find out till you borrow it and go into your library to read it. also I would love to have more audiobook without having to pay into another app, since I am already paying for this one.

Overall very good but I have a frustration with font size that I'm calling out here in the hope that Amazon will address. As you increase the font size there is a huge jump from having about 90 words showing on my phone screen (at 3 below the largest setting) to about 45 words on the screen (at 2 below the largest setting). For me 90 is too small but 45 words on the screen makes the font huge. There should be an option in between that shows about 70 words on the screen.

Great for reading but when switching between devices, it doesn't sync properly and the pinned pages get super annoying since the only way to remove pins is by slowly flipping pages until you get to where you are. When switching from mobile to pc, everything syncs fine, but swapping back to mobile, you always have to scroll and try to find your bookmark, then the app is constantly trying to get you to go back to the previous "pinned" page since thats where you last were before switching to pc...

kindle made reading easy, it always remembers where I left reading (page) which i usually don't. the stats which it provide about reading time, reading progress always motivates me. it would be good if we have reading pointer which flows through paragraph,to control our reading speed (just like highlighting the text which we are going to read.) and guide us through out the reading which might help to concentrate even more.
So convenient! No matter where I go, my books are always with me by kindle, phone, or whatever magical device I can use. Compatible features like changing fonts, size of text, and scrolling features.

So far a great app to read my books. Loving the dark mode setting, much easier on the eyes, plus being able to adjust the font size is nice. Only downfall is that the books I wanted to buy for the Kindle is no longer available but luckily the ones I did buy that they took off their digital store I can still read.

I would give it 5*s but I just personally love to read a real book....flipping each page, feeling the hardback cover with the tip of each finger tip!!! But put that aside this app is a great one in mY book
Great app. I wish they'd stop changing the layout though. Keep my books at the top please. I appreciate all the features they offer such as whispersync and highlight text.

i think it works pretty well. I only I have trouble with sometimes is when I change font size the pages won't match and some text is cut off. I have to change the font size to read the line or two of missing text. otherwise I like it.
I am slowly getting kindle books when they are way cheaper than the physical ones. I must admit though, being able to look something up while reading it is really handy and less time consuming.

I had used kindle unlimited 30 day free trial and enjoyed it. So I decided to get Amazon prime for kindle books, free shipping and movies. I'm not reading as many books as I had with unlimited as the selections are different. I liked the unlimited selection of books better.

overall it's good. But if you want to feel e book like real book you have to give the option write on book by fingertip or any pen which is comfortable using on android or iOS. Add note is different but I want to write on the page itself.

Good app with lots of useful features. Sometimes the features can activate unexpectedly which can be annoying. My preference is continuous scrolling rather than page turn. Repeatedly swiping the screen often triggers highlight of a range of text or the speed scroll which can suddenly shift the focus by 100 pages. Fortunately there is a return to page function.

Generally works very well. Not infrequently the audible narration purchased with the text will restart at the beginning. This requires a forced stop of the app to re-synchronise the text and the audible narration.

I love Kindle! Especially like when I don't have my Kindle with me and find myself waiting, I can pull my book up on my phone and read anywhere, any time. The only drawback is that you can't share books with others. That limits how much I'm willing to pay for a book.

The app was one of my most used app until the recent update when the developer somehow removed the search option from store menu. I mean, how am I supposed to look for the books by name? Should I wade through the sea of books available amd spend hours looking for my chosen book? Please address this issue fast.

books are instantly available, no need to wait for delivery, important or favourite sentences can be easily noted with different highlighters. English vocabulary online available, so it's better to read kindle.
