I enjoy this app every day! I have my library available wherever I am. There are many tools available to customize how I want to read, or to organize my library, to Sync a book with my other devices, to make notes and highlights within my books and have them added to a journal, and the ability to share text, and lookup words, and more. I've used this app a lot for personal and group study. I appreciate the deep discounts and the huge selection of books and audio available!
I like having my bookshelf with me when I travel. I wasn't sure I could make the switch from "real" books but it's working.
very convenient, still trying to adjust from paper. Have a hard time navigating...probably just me.
Paying for a subscription, I wish there was more free options..

I love, and highly recommend, Kindle Unlimited. Personally, I enjoys reading on the daily & likes variety of different kinds of books. I consider this is 10/10 worth the price. I love its user-friendly interface, selection, & ability to continue a story exactly where I left off from all of my devices. I recommend to anyone, but especially bookworms like myself, who enjoy reading but not the price tag that comes with constantly buying new books or storaging a massive physical collection.

I live in Switzerland, a difficult place to buy books in the English language. I love to be able to read basically everything available in English, and just immediately after it has been published! I also much appreciate the copious amount of scientific and medical books on kindle, and the fact that one can also rent these expensive books sometimes. I have kindle app on my phone, tablet and PC, and I think it is great that they are all sync. I am a super happy kindle customer indeed!!!

Adjustable front light lets you read comfortably for hoursâ€”indoors and outdoors, day and night. Purpose-built for reading, with a 167 ppi glare-free display that reads like real paper, even in direct sunlight. Read distraction-free. Highlight passages, look up definitions, translate words, and adjust text sizeâ€”without ever leaving the page. This device does not support playback of Audible audiobooks. Prime members read free with unlimited access to hundreds of books, comics and more.

I really enjoy my Kindle App! It allows me to carry a huge portion of my treasury of books in my purse, back pocket, or wherever I place my mobile device! I have purchased most of my paper paged books thru my Kindle app so that I literally have them at my fingertips at any time. Because it outs cloud based I have access to my library via my phone, tablet, and computer!

This app has literally saved my life! I love to read but this app & Kindle Unlimited have changed my life!! There are so many books you can read, you'll never be bored again!! They have every book you could ever want & also some even come with free audiobooks! Best 10 bucks a month I've ever spent! You wont regret it!

This is probably the app I use the most so it has to work well, which it does. The font, font size, background colour and reading style can all be customised to suit your preferences which makes reading much more comfortable experience. The inclusion of a dictionary, for those words you are not quite sure of, is very handy, as is the ability to highlight passages that resonate with you. The only gripe I have with the app is the fact it takes a long time to sync between devices sometimes.

Wouldn't be without my Kindle...aged 70 I've read far more books in the last few years than in my entire life before then. Being able to sync it over all my devices is brilliant. I can pick my phone up and instantly be taken to the page I was reading on my tablet. And the range of books available... even thousands of free ones... is immense. Having a Kindle does away with the space needed to store books...your very own compact library. Kindle is definitely one of the best inventions ever!

While it often feels like Kindle is sort of the only option in a high quality ebook store, Amazon's Kindle app is pretty much unquestionably the best out there. I've never had trouble using it or encountered an issue with it. I can easily find what I'm after and am always able to get what I want from it. A very minor complaint is the way it loads books after a search which can be a little slow.

I just love this app. It keeps all my books in one place and I don't have to lug around all the heavy books. I really do enjoy reading real books at home but when I'm on an airplane or in a hotel it's nice to be able to read a book that suits my needs at that time. I mostly read Christian books along with bible studies. Thank you and all the developers who put this app together. Great job.

Love my kindle. My library goes with me everywhere and weighs a mere couple of grams. I can read what I want whenever I want. I don't go anywhere without my kindle. I can look up meanings of words and phrases, bookmark pages, highlight pages and so much more. The available variety of titles are soo absolutely wonderful, and offers me the opportunity to read different titles at the same time.

Though the UI can be quirky, I use this app everyday. It is consistent and reliable, and that's what makes this a five star experience. Of course, the general user experience and flow could always be improved but on its current merits and features, it is a solid offering. I have more than a thousand Kindle books that I purchased over the years. If there was one area of improvement I would suggest for the app, it would be in supporting further categorization and view filters.

Besides a great reading experience, this app lets me keep multiple lists of books. I can quickly mark a book or author as a favorite. One click lets you follow an author, to be notified of their new releases. The app also tracks which days I've read, and all the books i've read during the current & past year. While the app is free to use, I love my Kindle Unlimited subscription, which gives me a free book every month & unlimited access to hundreds(?) of thousands of books, for under $10 monthly.

Best thing since sliced bread. I have boxes of books I will probably not read again. The ease of accessing my virtual library any time any place, phenomenal. I also love the immediate access to dictionary for a word, highlighting and note taking. I know we take allot of this for granted now, but I was born before Gore invented the internet, so I still get excited.

This is best app for reading. it had come a long way and if you're an avid reader like me, with memory issues, this is awesome. I don't have to remember where I last saw my book or if one of the dogs lost my place by moving the bookmark. Don't know a word, simple look it up while reading so you can get the full context. and the auto suggest allows for u to find books that are along your reading interests.

Love this app! I use it almost every day on my phone. It works great. I like that there is also a version for PC. If anything ever goes wrong, such as it appearing like you have lost bookmarks, notes, etc, there is an excellent help chat INSIDE the app, and the person who helped me had me back up and going in minutes, and my problem wasn't a simple one. Very helpful and great service!

I have used this for a while now and app has improved. Provides lots of features at a reasonable price, some are even completely free. This app basically lets a phone be used as a kindle device. This app helps spread the importance and enjoyment of reading. Also it probably brings reading to people that wouldn't actually read otherwise. This app is great overall and provides something for everyone... I'm glad I installed it and recommend it to others. Thanks.

I really like the ability to click on citations, to take notes on my highlights, and to search the text. I've also never had any bugs, and the app performs well. I use Kindle nearly every day, because it's much easier to use for research than a traditional paper book! I still enjoy holding a book in my hands from time to time, but Kindle has a lot to offer that anyone serious about their studies should consider.

What can I say, I love reading and this app obviously saves me lugging all my books with me when go anywhere! Also, my subscription here is ideal as it saves me going to the library! My only gripe is that there is only a limited catalogue of books to choose to borrow as with a library, you can order any book(s) you want! Still, gotta love this! ðŸ™‚ðŸ‘ðŸ™‚

Kindle application is wonderful. I didn't have to buy special device to read books, only install app on my phone/computer. Reading books doesn't use a lot of battery on my phone. There're so many Kindle books, interesting ones, cheap ones, some of them are free, variety of genres. I would definitely recommend this app to everyone. It's free and no special device is necessary.

Love my Amazon Kindle app! I particularly love the Kindle unlimited program that let's me read a ton of different kinds of books without having to buy the actual book. Its kinda like a library. You "borrow " the book and then "return" it when you're finished. Love it!

I enjoy the Kindle app and keep the word definition on so I can further enjoy my books. It is nice to be able to pick a font that is easy to read and a background color that suits you as well. The ability to change font sizes is also helpful and most books when downloaded come with an option to use audible if you have it (for an additional price). Overall I've been very pleased with the app.

In the words of Po Panda, a Disney film, I started at level -1. I have broken my back twice, had a reconstructed elbow, and one leg shorter than the other that torches my hips. With the addition of this exercise program my hips, back and legs are stronger. I had practiced for a week I got into the bath tub, as I exited I thought here we go walrus exit. Nope I crouched and rose. It is really constructed so you can just begin at the basic levels and build each week. My hips are in a new place.

How much I love this app, can't be explained in words. I used Kindle reader too but app gives you multi-platform experience. From textbooks to fiction, non fiction, DIY books, personality grooming everything is accessible. In fact your library is available at anytime anywhere you want. This gives flexibility to avid readers to save time in public transportation, your boring office functions, and even in toilets. Make the most of this app and yes of course! you are saving environment also.

I really like this app. I've had it for over a year and still haven't figured out all the settings yet (that's mostly on me, not the app). I like how smoothly you transition from page to page by swiping, unlike my Kindle tablet. This app works much better on my phone than my actual Kindle tablet does overall. One thing I do like about the tablet is that it has an amazing battery life. Personally I prefer the app on my phone over the tablet

I used to say I would never go digital with books, but the ease of finding and downloading books through Kindle has converted me. Not to mention the space I save by not having to buy bookshelves to put all my books on. I also love that I can download the app on all my devices and am able to read on whichever device is most convenient for where I am.

Really great app fir reading with heavy discounts on books, and U DON'T EVEN HAVE TO WAIT FOR DELIVERY!!! ITS SUPERFAST AND I LOVE IT as a kindle user for the past 2 years and believe me, it just gets better with the official kindle device where it even feels as real as a paperback book with according textures and faster service. Thanks Amazon...

So many books all in one place. Easy to pop in to my bag and no need to carry 4 or 5 books with me on a 2 week holiday anymore. Don't get me wrong I much prefer to hold a paperback but the convenience outweighs this. Plus I never have problems trying to obtain a book I might have trouble finding in a book shop.

great variety of books and easy to use app. however I wish they would bring filter option to search books that are free with Kindle unlimited only. this app is a life saver in lockdown when it is risky to go to shops to buy books. I spend a lot of time reading on Kindle on mobile phone. it is very cheap and handy.

My favorite app!!! Reading is my favorite pastime. I love being able to browse my library, store my favorite books, and enjoy reading anywhere I go without dragging my hardcover editions around. I have Kindle Unlimited so new reading material is always at hand and there is so much variety. The app is easy to use and user friendly.

I've used the Kindle app for sometime. The convenience of having books you enjoy at your finger tips is a joy. When I traveled for work, I didn't have to lug books around in my carry-on. I have recently embarked upon a new online class and found a hard to find book on the app. The only downside, you cannot synch your books if you changed your login on another device if you upgrade your device. Make sure you keep the same login. User error. Overall, my experience has been excellent.

Love Kindle! I love that at any moment, on a plane or tucked into bed at night, I can visit a library and be swept away by any genre that fancies me. Whether instructional or fairy tales, it doesn't matter! I love books and though nothing can truly substitute the look and feel of a real book, Kindle is pretty close. I love that I can change the settings to make reading easier on the eyes. Love to read! Love Kindle!

kindle is the ideal platform for reading and or personal pleasure or study. The world's library at your fingertips. Some of the books are free, however there is a marginal fee for most books (online) that I ve purchased. The books are yours to read at your leisure. Logging into your own private account assures you of always having access to your purchases no matter what the platform. It my daily reading app, I thoroughly enjoy the platform and I'm certain that you and your family will as well

I have been reading my E books now for quite some time. I love being able to take my tablet into appointments with me because it is easy to remember to leave with it, unlike many paperbacks that have been left behind half read. The best part is that I can find any book I want from fluff to deep philosophical works and read them at my leisure. What did I do before Kindle?!

This read was a delightful suprise. Loved it. Have been into time travel novels for years and never have I wanted to read the sequel more. My sincere gratitude belongs to the husband/wife team who surely balance each other perfectly in real life, just like their lovable characters do. It was very funny and kept me laughing ( a hard thing to do this year. I absolutely adore the new ( to me) concept, going to WW2 era. Could you write a sequel or series for this book please. Merry Christmas.

love my kindle unlimited I love to read and this gives me access to whole series at a time. I never have a problem finding something to read, my problem is there isn't enough time in the day to read everything I want to get to. there are unending choices available and tons of free books and or free to read. Best thing I ever did was get kindle unlimited.

I love it. It has many features that I like, including the various ways to display your progress in the book or even chapter, or the fact that it gives you the choice to pick your eye protection (via the device settings or the app's). Another thing I like about it is that it synchronizes very well across devices. I've been using it for a few years now, at first on the PC, then on my smartphone, and now on a tablet, and I have to say it hasn't disappointed me on either. I highly recommend it.

I love the kindle app. Not only are kindle books (usually) much less expensive, but having them on my device wherever I go makes being able to indulge in a read so simple and convenient. I enjoy reading on my Kindle paperwhite, and I can store an entire library of books on it, which is super helpful because books often take up quite a bit of space, which unfortunately, I do not have.

Very well-written. Casual easy-to-read common language and enough anecdotes and asides to communicate a warm human side. I am a retired professional engineer who worked 35 years in nuclear design (physics, reacor behavior) and transitioned from unbeliever to Bible-believing born-again Christian midway through that career. Most of what this book relates is EXACTLY the conclusions I have reached. The few differences are well considered and explained, such that I accept the author's position.

I used to be against ebooks until I downloaded Kindle. It has perhaps the biggest library of any Ereader on the market. Any book I've shown interest in has been on this app. I'm still a little bit of a Book Purist in that I'll buy a copy of a book but usually only after I've read it on here first just to keep my personal library growing. This app has an animation when you swipe the screen its like turning the page of a real book and for some reason I just love this app even more because of that.

I would be lost without my Kindle. I have carpal tunnel syndrome which limits the size of book I can read, and as a self proclaimed bookworm it put me in a sort of hell. I have always loved the thicker, longer stories as well as sequels so imagine my delight in once again being able to read books of more than 300 pages. In addition, to have my entire library at my fingertips is a blessing in itself. If you don't own one and live to read, I recommend you buy one ASAP. LOVE mine.

This is so convenient and easy to use. I love books and there are so many to choose from. Also they can b stored online so you don't have to worry about taking up space on your cell or tablet. Read your books anywhere... and..no heavy books to tote around. Thanks for the app...makes my life easier.

I love that I can take a book any where with me. I have read in 5 months over a 100 books. I've found different genres that I never thought i would like interesting. I love the ability to find new authors at my fingertips. I have to say almost everyone of them have not disappointed me. With the their words they paint such beautiful pictures to engulf u in the story. I'm beyond happy.

I love having endless books at hand! I have discovered new-to-me titles, tracked all titles in series that I have liked. In a house of bookshelves that are overflowing, Kindle is the essence of compact, without losing any substance - in other words, the titles are not condensed versions. Instead of packing a healthy load of books for vacation reading, I have an unending book load that fits in my purse! Perfect for flights, waiting rooms, car rides, etc.

Great for books but also for comics as well. I love the ability to go panel by panel. It's intuitive design really heightens the drama and keeps key scenes from being "accidentally looked at" ahead of time keeping big reveals on the next panel/page experienced the way they should be. Almost cinematically.

I am a voracious reader and have always preferred hard copies however, having the Kindle app allows me so much more flexibility. When I'm out at factors appointments, waiting in line, or in the passenger seat my phone allows me to continue reading with ease. Also, if you are as serious as I am, then you should sign up for kindle unlimited where you pay $9.99 per month and borrow up to 10 books at a time!!

I love reading on my Kindle. I don't always take it with me when traveling because I am afraid of losing or damaging it. So having the Kindle app and having them synchronized so I can pick up where I left off is really nice. Also, the store is very easy to use and the hundreds or thousands of reviews help when choosing a book to read. This one is a no-brainer in my opinion. Get it and use it. Forget about opening Facebook when you have 5 minutes to kill. Read instead. Or massage your jaw.

My Kindle app has become my preferred way of reading! The ease of making notes in the text and sharing quotes and excerpts has made it immensely useful. For an avid reader, to be able to carry around dozens of books to be read at a moment's notice, that's nirvana.

I could not deal with my book habit without the Kindle app. Even after weeding out the books I won't use again, I have over 1000 books. With the Kindle app, I have unlimited library space. I can organize books into collections, and sort by author, title, or date. I can read on my phone, tablet or computer, and choose which books to load on each device. And you're not limited to the Kindle store. The app reads most file types, and my favorite publishers send books directly to my device.

Very convenient while traveling and when combined with Kindle Unlimited it is even better. I save money and don't have to worry about finishing my book and not having anything else to read till I can get another one. Some things I would like to see are a night time mode for reading before bed and tracker for authors or series I have already enjoyed.

"A promised land" narrated by Barack Obama was my first ever audible book. It won't be my last. I am concerned that no other audible book is going to be as good as this one! I had a tendency to take a walk with the phone in my pocket. I thought of it as having Barack in my pocket, telling me the story of his life and first term. it was awesome!!! Smiles, Gary

A great alternative for book lovers who find managing their hard bind read challenging because of frequent travel routine to farthest corners of the globe. Very user friendly as mobile handset has Kindle app to access library anywhere, anyplace, anytime. While I am a critic of too much of technology infiltrating our lives today, Kindle app has managed to keep the love for books alive in a corner of the heart. A boon for all book lovers who find managing time difficult with their hectic schedule

Thankful for the enabled text to speech option. I love how it just reads the whole book without me having to turn every page. it's still a robotic voice, but it sounds decent, much better than other screen reader software.

Easy to use - can adjust font quickly. A lot of free books available. The one thing I don't like is that if I am not in the app it kicks back to the beginning like start-up and you need to go in and open it to find the book you were reading 5 mins ago. That's a bit annoying. Other than that - all good.

What a blessing Kindle has been for me! I love reading, but my eyes got so bad that I could only read books with large print. The selection was very limited, however. My niece bought me a Kindle when they first came out. The best gift I've ever received! I have since subscribed to Kindle Unlimited, and have been able to read thousand of books. I can change the font, as well as enlarge and bold it. I can't say enough wonderful things about it! Thank you Amazon!

Best reading app, better than Google books, Kobo, & Nook because of the functionality and Goodreads being able to sync. If I had a criticism it is merely the price of books sometimes is too high - there is very little overhead for digital media, no printing press, no ink, no paper, no electricity to run said press, etc.; therefore, kindle best sellers could be more affordable instead of the same price as the paperback print editions.

As an avid reader with poor eyesight, the Kindle app is wonderful. I have unlimited which is cheaper than buying a ton of books and allows me to try new authors without fear of wasting money. The ability to change font size is such a bonus for when my eyes are tired.

The Google reading challenge is probably the only New Year's pledge that I can make and keep. Reading daily has become my escape from real life. It's nice to find a spot of sunshine, a blanket and a favorite drink to curl up with my Kindle and escape the noise of the world for 30 minutes.

I don't know what I did before Kindle... I use it more than any other app. Whole libraries of classics (I love classic scifi) are available for 99 cents. This app syncs with my Kindle reader so I never lose my place. It has a dictionary, notes, hilites, etc. Lots of books are free or on sale.

I fell in love with this story and these characters. If you want to be transported into the charming world of the Regency era, you have to own this trilogy. Good, clean fun, this trilogy is a page turner you won't be able to put down. While you're stuck at home, give yourself a little vacation into this beautiful world. It's written beautifully and well, it's just perfect!

I love Kindle! My husband gave me the very 1st one produced and I have been hooked ever since! I now have a Paper White. Being able to get a book anytime and anywhere is awesome. The choices are endless. I can always find something. I've found some of my favorite authors on Kindle.

I love using Kindle! It makes reading convenient and easy at night. Although I love reading paper books using the Kindle app has saved my neck and eyes by being lighter and by being able to adjust the font and lighting. I subscribed to Kindle Unlimited and it's worth every penny! I've read 74 books just this year. I highly recommend it!

Very good, and not quite what I expected, this short light novel (ultra light?) takes the classic isekai trope in a direction you don't see often, focusing much more on the psychological aspects of having past life memories. One thing I found odd was the MC's inability to read. Five is a bit old to not know how to read or write at all, and there's no mention of efforts by her parents to remedy this. Sweet without being too saccharine, and with sequels out already, I'd recommend it. 4.6 stars.

I use my Kindle app all the time, and I love how you can make the pages look bright like real book pages, make them curl as you turn them, and then bookmark it when you're done reading for the time being. You can carry as many books with you as you want, and read as many at a time as you would like. I absolutely love the Kindle!!

Has a great variety of books! Provides some audio options. Great to invest in prime and prime reading because you get access to a lot of free content and popular genres that have whole series of amazing stories. There are non-fiction items as well and practical books such as self help, cooking and manuals.

Amazing platform. I do miss one feature: a mode that locks the screen onto a page, making the screen entirely unresponsive except for a few hard-to-accidentally-trigger buttons or gestures to change page or revert to regular mode. This would allow a late night, clumsy, in-the-bed reader to grab the phone anywhere, on any corner or mid-screen, like they would hold a paper book after some time. Because we do use this app for hours on end.

I love Kindle unlimited. I have had the service for about 4 years. what I like the most is.. that once you start picking titles Kindle will dish them up to you.. so you liked this? you might want to try this!! I love it. I have branched out in my reading, and I feel like I have learned a lot. this year with covid it kept me very entertained. thank you Amazon!

LOVE the Kindle app! I've been using it for years with very few issues or glitches which has only ever required a restart of your app for fix the issue. Nothing beats an actual book but the app makes it so much easier to be portable and read while on the go.

Kindle is a good platform for bibliophiles since it provides ebooks at a rate lower than hardcopies, sometimes at half the price or even lower. so we could read more books under lower budget. Kindle offers are also pretty good. The only problem is, in some books there are quality issues like typing errors and it would be much more comfortable if those issues are corrected ASAP. Other than this,Kindle is an awesome app for readers where we can adjust fond, and all settings according to our likes.

I have had a kindle since the first model. I love it. I love the fact that I have access to all my books anytime and any place. I have over 500 books that I can go back and read. im able to get away from reality for awhile. I also enjoy Kindle unlimited. I've read hundreds of books from there. I love finding new authors to read and take the journey with them when they take off because they are so good.

Having the choice of practically any book I want to read, on multiple devices, in any location has been a joy! The book prices are good and I've never experienced any glitches with delivery or availability of items in my library. Great all around!

Anytime I have an opportunity to read I do. Having the kindle App on my phone means one less device to carry around. I love that I can click into my book and it immediately tells me where I was last reading and asks if I'd like to skip to that page. Yes please! Amazing App! 10/10 would recommend and I have, many times.

at first it was weird for me to read books via technology, as I always enjoyed holding the book in my hands, but it only took a couple of books to get me into the swing of it. we have prime and unlimited books so I can read so many books! love my kindle app!

this app let's me read all that I want, I can't change the size and font of the letters, I can also change the background color to better fit each situation. I am a true book worm and this app will tell me how many days in a row I've read, I think my longest streak was 5 months, so every day I would read for 5 months

This book is very educated not only for kids but also to adults. very creative, educational, attractive figures and easy understandable for young kids. Good to have a visual dictionary and characters introduction. I would highly recommend to kids and adults.

Using the kindle app - incomparable! if you love books, you need thus app, you just don't want it! Your bookasvare always where your devices are, you can get any book in seconds, and you can store thousands of books in the cloud. This app complements my other forms of book collections. Always available and always ready, my instant home as well as travelling library

Great reading app. I've always been a paper book reader. I avoided e-readers for a long time. However, I read a book every 3-4 days and it is often difficult to get to the library that often. The Kindle app has made it so I can still enjoy reading avidly and I find that I enjoy the convenience of always having my books with me.

Though I have a Kindle device but I bought it around October 2019 but am reading since July 2018. And at that time, this kindle app was all I had and the experience that it gave me was exceptionally remarkable. Books are the greatest escape, trust me and if one can't afford to invest 500-600â‚¹ on paperbacks and hardcopies and interested in e-readers but sceptical about that also, then before investing 8k or 12k on kindle device, use this app first, it gives you the best feel. I have been using Kindle for quite a few years. I like the dictionary usage and for reading books in foreign languages, Kindle couldn't be more helpful. I read books in four languages and I've had no problems in any of them translating unknown words.

I use it every day. This is the only way I read now. You can easily use the app to customize your screen and how you like to manipulate the pages. My favorite is continuous scrolling. I also change the screen color depending on what time/place I'm reading. If you use Audible you can switch seamlessly between reading and listening. It is so easy to look up a word or a reference you don't know by just selecting it. The best thing is having your library with you wherever you go.

I love real books as much as the next nerd, but you just can't beat the variety and options. I read books very quickly and have found so many new authors and genres. saves me money on buying 10 plus books a month, which may or may not still happen... I love this app

This app is such a great way to read books on the go. It is also useful to see colour pictures for books I read on my Kindle (in black and white). And I like how it syncs my place between this app and my Kindle.

Love how easy it is to read a Kindle anywhere and carry multiple books with you. Plus you can sync with other devices so you can continue reading no matter where you are. I had a 3rd generation Kindle forever and upgraded this year but stayed with a basic Kindle. I'm a weird purist that I just want my Kindle to be about reading content. With Prime you can borrow free books and I've read some amazing authors I might not have stumbled across without it. Huge Kindle fan!!

great app. a PROBLEM, recently, my PC Kindle reader renders almost all my books, and mags in a corner-mirror style, illegible! I contacted Amazon CS, and altho they said they would be in contact with me further, that has not happened. i have uninstalled and held my jaw just so, but reinstall gives the same result. I do really like and appreciate the Kindle reader on my android devices.

This app kept me very occupied during deployment and never failed me. It allows me to read multiple books at once and never loses my page. But, it's not a hassle.

I have been reading on Kindle since 2011. I've read approximately 4000 books on my kindle. I've bought multiple Kindles and I don't know what it would be like without one. There is no end to the books, movies, mp3s, etc. that you can get. I recommend them whenever asked about them.

I enjoy reading on the Kindle. Very user friendly and helps me to own countless books without worrying about a space to keep it. Unfortunately, some bibliophiles may miss the smell, touch and weight of a real book. But once you adapt to the new age with your reading, you will become 2nd nature. My personal favorite is the 'Vocabulary Builder' function.

I really liked this series. It kept me wanting to read the whole series after I started it. I normally like a lot of action but this series kept me coming back for more. The characters were well defined and so was the world they lived in.

Reading is very important for our mental health. Kindle is an excellent app to read ebooks. All the features of this app such as adjusting the font size, page size, highlighting content etc makes reading comfortable for us and helps us complete reading the book quickly. This will be available with us anytime and anyplace and there is no question of searching for physical books, preserving them and remembering to carry them with us. It also has selected set of good books and its amazing.

love the ease of the application and the overall control it affords me for my reading. I don't have to be blinded by bright lights while reading at night and can toggle from how my page turns to font size and I love that. Nevermind all the great and available content through kindle unlimited. I love this app and will continue to enjoy it I'm sure.

Cannot go a day without using this app! Love the various settings and convenience of having a book with me at all times. Works with library e-books as well as other documents. Especially love the Kindle Unlimited option to read as many books as I want with a subscription. Links to Goodreads. Get it if you like to read.

I love this app! On the go this app is helpful and when I'm at home my phone kindle app syncs up with my kindle tablet. I also enjoy having definitions at the tips on my fingers as well as screen and lighting adjustments. Also not sure if this has it or not but my only thing I wish it had was a sun mode where the screen brightens up a lot since the app has a night mode. Overall though 10/10! If you enjoy taking books everywhere this is for you!

quick and easy to read books at your finger tips. I love that you can adjust the screens. so darker or lighter. different font and font size. makes reading on the go easy and cheap. I read on my samsung phone. young so my eyes are fine- older folks who have a harder time may want to consider using a bigger screen like a tablet.

Amongst the best apps available in the entire Google Play store for reading. Ideal for people who plan on building a reading habit as it helps you break the alpha barrier by making an instant purchase at a smaller amount than a paperback. With reading insights, x-ray, a built-in dictionary and Word Wise, you face less and less barriers coming your way. The Kindle Unlimited subscription is very affordable and you get a lot of books for free with a prime subscription as well.

This app is a lifesaver. I am never without something to read! And because it is so popular, most e-books, even free ones, come in the Kindle format. So you can read Gutenberg project books here the same as Kindle books purchased from Amazon. That is, as my teenager would say, pretty based.

I previously gave a poor rating because the app stopped loading books I had purchased and the people in the first line of Kindle customer support were less than helpful. When I was, after much waiting and agony, finally transferred to a technician she quickly found the problem and solved. The ethernet in my workplace was the problem; wifi in the same workplace worked fine. The app has works perfectly now but it would be nice if book collections created in the app appeared on the paperwhite too.

at first I didn't know of I could get into reading books, that aren't actual books. I always seemed to think that I needed the actual thing. Mostly docking points for the system integration (which is classic Adobe arrogance imo). If I could open images directly from the gallery (etc), it would be much more efficient. A very powerful app, but... 1. The UI uses dark gray text on a darker gray background, which is nearly impossible to read. 2, Photos taken with the Camera im DNG format will Not upload. It just says Pending and reports a random percentage that never completes. 3. Overall the app appears to he without purpose. It is impossible to make meaningful edits on a small, uncalibrated screen. For example, it is impossible to judge the effects of adjustments to Clarity, Texture, or Noise Reduction.

Streets are not up to date and I ended up in a bus lane only. GPS suggested to drive straight ahead, however, in the middle of the road was a circle only for public buses to enter. There was no way for a vehicle to use the same route. I had to back out and ended up to my left in a warehouse parking area which was prohibited to enter for non commercial vehicles. So thank you, looking forward to the bill(s) that I am going to receive. PLEASE UPDATE YOUR STREET MAPS UK London!

It is not perfect, but it's a very good app for offline navigation. It requires data connection to install and high speed to download large map files. You may have to reinstall it a couple of times at first to get it going. Voice instructions stop working periodically, but powering off and on your machine will restore them. It does have Greek voice.

Spent some time with the app, looks awesome and just what i wanted, would have been super to be able to import routes to the app... but otherwise, lovely, simple to use app... thans team for your work!!

Update: For several months now (Nov 2020) the app keeps instantly crashing when it loads. I'll try to reinstall it and edit this review if it works again. Seems to be Sygic without the extras and demo expiration period. Good GUI. Main issue is random failure to speak before some turns. Keep an eye on the screen vs. depending solely on voice alerts. I've had this problem with other Android apps; may get another Garmin.

I installed it and no maps. I selected 2 maps to download. Program says its in the queue. 2 hours later, its still in the queue and the car battery is LOW! Some notifications I bypassed right away because I want to see how this program works before I give anybody money or my info, schedule for deletion tomorrow. Tried it again and was able to download maps. So far, so good. The detail is great. Tomorrow, I will use it to see if its better than Google. Revised, I prefer this app over Google! You hit the drive view and it is easier to view while you are driving. The search bar is smaller than Google so more map to see. Feedback, would like the sampling rate to be faster so the map updates faster than 10 seconds. The detail is less than Google which is good, better view of where you are going. The favorite is good except you have to type a more meaningful description and you must stop to do this, same with Google. New/finished street construction not updated on the map yet, waiting. I have turned off the wifi in the car so no ads but I am willing to pay for this app! Good job guys.

Excellent offline GPS navigation. Turn by turn voice directions. Downloadable maps for ever 50 states, plus other countries. An invaluable app for driving through cellular dead zones, spotty cell coverage areas, or if you just plain old forgot to pay your cell phone bill haha. Accurate, and reliable. My only negative is that this app is quite heavy on battery consumption. Even when closed, the app uses a lot of background battery. Overall the best offline GPS navigation app there is.

1. The best among 8 other offline gps i have tried so far. 2. At the first installation, there was a problem of shutting down during navigation. After reinstalling, this problem disappeared. 3. Another problem. Downloading large map file was impossible with slow internet (50 mbps for example.) I had to use 300 mbps to successfully download NY map file.
It is a very good app with offline use available. Clear display and time estimate is very accurate.
The offline location search is accurate, well done. I like this capability very much. BTW, is there a way to show the native street names for the maps of non English speaking countries?

Very good app. Seems as though I need to turn on data momentarily to get my position, because if I don't, it takes forever to locate me. is this normal? After I turn data on, I can turn it off again within half a minute as my location is found easily. But, if I don't turn data on (momentarily) it doesn't seem to find me, and the app just seems to stay on the location screen. Please fix it so no data is necessary. Other than that, great app.

Well laid out and clear interface. Excellent having the dash cam, heads up & real view options. Addresses were spot on too. Would like to see more customization options and optimization of waypoints which would get it 5*. Also too close to a junction before you get turn commands. Overall a good app with potential and one I'll be using and keeping an eye on for updates.

Great app! Here's my suggestions for improvement: --- I would like to see the lane guidance show up much sooner. By the time it shows on the display, you are already upon it. --- Would be nice to know the next turn before the 2 mile mark. The next turn should be shown all the time with the number of miles until you get to that turn. --- This goes along with my previous comment, if the road is continuous, it should not show the end of the road. If I am on route 44, it should not tell me to continue on route 44 in 5 miles, and then in another 6 miles and then again in 10 miles. If the route is the same, it should add them up and provide a total distance before you have to exit or make a major turn. --- Would be really awesome if someone could build in a road grade information display showing the road grade for the next x miles. Example: 7% grade 2 miles ahead for 3 miles. This would allow ample time to adjust your speed based on your load (or large RV in my case). Showing a profile view for the next 2 miles would be excellent. --- Needs to zoom out further when the next turn is more than 10 miles ahead so you can get a greater view of what's ahead. - The app crashes once in a while when trying to solve a route with multiple waypoints, but not too bad otherwise. I like using it.

The app is awful. As someone who uses Yelp frequently to post photos, write reviews, and explore restaurants and businesses around the area, I use this app a lot. However, after the app was updated it's terrible to use for all the items I just listed above. I can't sort through my photos easily and post multiple photos for one review. I can't even update my profile photo without the app crashing. I've also had to uninstall and reinstall the app several times. Very disappointing.

If you're a business owner and get a "free credit" offer for Yelp ads --> PASS! I was specifically told I could monitor the credit on their billing page and stop the service before being charged if I didn't find it useful...I did this and almost two months later it still showed over half the credit left, a week later I was billed almost $400!!! And Yelp refuses to do anything about it. Avoid them like the plague! They employ predatory tactics to make revenue. They're scumbags.

Horrible app, won't even allow me to do something as simple as upload a profile picture. I've tried many many times since yesterday until today and every time after I add a picture the app just shows "sorry, something's wrong with Yelp right now. Try again in a bit." How long is a bit? Then they don't even have any support to answer questions, so I'm stuck. And then they treat your profile as being less reliable for not having a profile picture...smh useless app.

Now with more problems than ever. I got in line with the Yelp app and it told me to check-in at the restaurant at 7:44pm. When I got to the restaurant at 7:42, and the hostess tapped check-in for me (2nd in line), it erased my entry and now I'm back at the end of the line (20th), not to be sat for another 30 minutes. Yelp, when you took over for Nowait, you had one job to do, and failed at that too.
When doing a "search", this app keeps closing. Very frustrating!

I like Yelp for the most part. The app is a little buggy, like notifications would scroll the same things over and over, etc. But the new layout sucks. I can't see people's profile pics. Before I could at least see an avatar when I clicked on a profile (but clicked on the avatar the profile pictures wouldn't load), now no avatar is showing up. What the hell are these app developers doing?!?!?

Would have given this app zero stars if possible! I've used Yelp on occasion either to find new restaurants in my area or find good restaurants when on vacation. But, this app used 9.92 GB of my mobile data in less than 3 weeks time (since Oct. 13) and I never opened the app a single time in over a month. I need Yelp to reimburse me a minimum of $75 per 5 GB of overage on my Verizon Wireless bill. I have screen shots proving your application's data usage. I look forward to your resolution.

Yelp is an app that allows people to read reviews of various businesses as well as to write a review. However Yelp staff and Moderators are able to pick and choose reviews and those they dislike are placed in an area that's not currently recommended. I also know without a doubt businesses can pay Yelp to have better reviews posted and poor reviews removed. Yelp has become bogus and no longer worth downloading. It also uses a lot of battery consumption and memory.

Whoa! Used 5GB of mobile data! Beware! Apparently I had Yelp open in the background on my phone. I went for a long drive and turned data ON to access navigation. After an hour, I got a message saying I was almost out of my 3.5GB data limit! After carefully looking at usage on every app, I saw that Yelp used 3GB that day, and over 5GB over the past few weeks. I am deleting Yelp and encourage others to do the same!

I hate that if I'm on my phone I HAVE to download the app, I don't use it often enough to keep it is talked so about 3-4 times a year I have to reinstall and then uninstall the app just because I can't read reviews on the movie site. It is very frustrating and not necessary, but these people make it mandatory to use the app.

Very upset about background data usage. In one day, November 1st, after opening your app to find a place for lunch your app proceeded to use 3.8 GB of LTE data in the background using up all of my LTE data for the month in one day, for who knows what. This is shameful and needs to be fixed.

The stupid dinosaur shows up when I want check my badges or add a picture. Now the app crashes whenever I review or check in. Fixed the app by deleting it and reinstalling it. I still have four reviews Yelp refuses to list. At least it's not as lame as Tripadvisor. Now the app crashes every time I go into my check ins. I've reinstalled the app twice to no avail. Yelp needs to hire grown ups with a work ethic.

Horrible app. Just trying to view ONE location online, but it makes me download an app to look at the reviews. Download the app and now it's asking for all sorts of permissions. Ridiculous that you have to download the app to view reviews. It would attract more people to allow them to view, see how useful it is, get hooked and WANT to download it. Now I'll just download it to view real quick then delete right after. Probably why I always use Google and their reviews instead.

Like others having issues of pics or even trying review or check-in. Really gone downhill & haven't seen any type of efforts put forward to resolve. I guess I should have saw this coming since it did so-called allow the upload. I removed the app & went to the web version. I refuse to have something this messed up hogging up space.

Yelp has now cost me $45 in overage charges because the app decided to go crazy and use 6+Gb of data in background data just in last week or so. When on wifi it used around 50Gb! Very unhappy for an app I never use! Be careful of background data usage, this app has been a hog! I plan on removing it after I record all the data usage details...I would like to talk with someone at yelp but they dont have a way for users to communicate from what I have seen. Very unhappy

There are way too many ads you need to get through before you can use the app. It wants you to share your location, link to other social media, etc., and you're frequently asked to do so. This app could be much more user friendly and less bloated.

Yelp has gotten worse then GOOGLE search when it comes to searching for the nearest business you search for. I hope everyone who screwed up the yelp app to make more money instead of being actually a useful app dies of a horrible disease!

Used to be WAY BETTER before PC "no hurt feelings" made them change the platform. Poor menu design and labeling. No clear manage my account and settings section with a place to review security choices etc. Couldn't even find where to manage my account and change my password. Had to use forgot my pw as the only way to make a new one. Maybe this was fixed and my version is old.

It's extremely frustrating that I have to download an app that I'm literally going to delete immediately just to look at a picture of a restaurant that I need to see just because I'm on my phone and not a desktop. Change this.

The app used 2GB of my data in just one day working on the background. I haven't used the app for ages just to discover yesterday that I run out of data. I checked on settings and was the Yelp app which used it all. Why??? I understand that some apps use data in the background for updates, etc. But not 2GB! I came to check the reviews and realized I am not the only one with this problem. This is the worst app ever. I want the $10 back that I had to use to get extra data. Insane.

This app has gone way downhill with all the glitches. Please get a new developer. Can't see list using map search, can't click into business sometimes, hanging map searches. Spend a lot of time browsing around using Yelp, but the state of the app is in now is making it much more difficult.

I was browsing pizza places and started an order because I wanted to browse the menu items get an idea how much food was. Long story short, I changed my mind and didn't want to order anything so I decided to leave the order page, clicked the correct button to leave. Next thing I know I get charged for what was left in my cart! No confirmation to order page or anything. The dumb app put in an unwanted order! I still love Yelp itself, but your team needs to work this!

As I've become more aware of Yelp's policies, I've come to trust their reviews less and less... to the point that I now actually avoid reading their reviews. I've removed their app from my devices and avoid their reviews when they show up in web searches -- a truly awful, untrustworthy company that skews reviews to their preconceived ideas of what companies should be promoted and what should be hidden - I don't appreciate their deceptive practices. Goodbye, Yelp. And good riddance.

Since the update, everytime I try to open the app, it closes right back. I never had this problem before. This was my go to for restaurants and other things. I even uninstalled it, still does the same thing all over again.

The app is glitchy. You can't see your followers for months already. I did the update earlier today and now I can't go to my check-ins. It keeps closing whenever I click on check-ins. This app will run eating up your data at a ridiculous rate. In the span of a few hours, I lost half of my remaining data with this app taking over 10GBS of data and costing me $100 in overage fees and updating my data costs. Their customer support is non existent.

I haven't even opened this app and since november 7th this app has used 44.58 gb of data this billing cycle. Most of it used within the last week. Uninstalling this piece of junk app now they're going to throttle my data for the rest of the billing cycle. I feel bad for anyone who installs this app and doesn't have unlimited data. Called for a appointment to pick up my son's glasses. You have to have a appointment to go to the store. Thanks for nothing Enterprise car rental! I then called the reservation number only to be told "Sorry there aren't any cars available at any locations " Why take the reservation!

Hi I made a express order from a company called COLLECTIONS ETC.back on 9/27/20. The item I order was supose to be here in 3-4 days. I went to yelp fron google to look at a review with pictures and it sends me to the playstore to download the app. I download the app so I can see this one freaking review and it "stops working" and closes on me EVERY SINGLE TIME. This is obnoxious at this point. FIX YOUR BUGS ASAP!!!!

Here's why the app is completely pointless: The rating of a business is absolutely irrelevant due to the ease of having negative reviews removed from a business's page. The number of businesses that have "51 reviews that are not currently recommended" is astounding. Business owners have to do VERY little to have negative reviews counted as non-influential. I'm in the middle of transitioning careers, and I'm happy to be saying goodbye to Yelp. It's incredibly unreliable, misleading, and scummy.

Yelp sucks. I had a grand opening event and there's a sign that stated if you disliked or liked your visit to please tell us on YELP or GOOGLE. Using this app has become a chore. Every menu you open, every search you do the first thing you see is an ad rather than what you are looking for. When I open the app I want to see the highest rated restaurant within a mile. When I click restaurants I also want to see what the users have said are the best restaurants in the area. I've been using this app for years then ask of a sudden it stopped working. I haven't had issues with any other apps, just this one. I can search ok but then try going into the restaurant and it goes right back to the home page. I've even tried uninstalling it and reinstalling and the same thing happens. So, I started using help just on the browser. But I had to uninstall the app or it would try to open it there. And when I'm trying to read the reviews and choose read more, it won't let me.

Yelp can be great at times, but hard to ever get a recent review. The reviews are all over the place and it shouldn't be that way. People change, and businesses change... however Yelp holds on to the past. I've seen many businesses try to improve their rating by changing the way they do business and customer service, and no matter how many positive reviews the customers have submitted, Yelp refuses to recommend them. It's a bit harsh when a business is really going above and beyond to get a better reputation score.

I like to use the app from to time to review new places, get a general consensus and make up my own mind. However, after being a victim of fraud in a way that has yet to be determined, to have an app that won't close even after I log out is unacceptable. Figure it out. Until then, you're gone. Sick of the hacking. Build better firewalls, enact tougher laws, something! But leave me alone.

Oh man...the food was really good but they had a live band and it was so god-awful. I mean, I listen to death metal so I appreciate extremely loud music...but this was obnoxiously loud, ear piercing, terrible music from the second we walked in. Could not even hold a conversation or hear yourself think. I'll come back if there is no live music. Please get a new sound guy. I mean if you like a tuba blasting in your ear, go for it. Food 6/10, Environment -9/10

This Ap has seen it's time. It's clearly not used as much as it used to be. The reviews are old and not helpful because the number of reviews are low, especially for newer businesses. Another downside is that they block the use of Google maps while Yelp is open. You can't copy and past a business address into maps and use a more effective map to get you there.

User interface gets worse with each update. It used to be easy to navigate, but now common features like check-in are buried deep after many links. But by far the worst of the recent updates is after check-in at a business a pop up demanding photos overtakes your screen. It's beyond annoying and makes using the app awkward. If I want to add photos I will do so. I do NOT want to be bombarded with this frustrating pop-up Every. Single. Time!! It wouldn't be so bad if you could turn it off.

I like to write reviews of places and I think reviews are important for places both for the business and potential customer. However, I recently tried ordering food via Yelp and it was the worst experience. I could only see a time window for delivery (45-75 mins) and could not track the status outside of that. Other apps I can track the food progress and the driver's location. I will not use this app again for ordering food.

I dont like that YELP tries to access my microphone w/out permission ALOT. I revoked permission and now get notifications every few hours that its trying to access my microphone.. im sitting at home.. there is no reason you need to collect microphone info so many times a day.... I really like the app when I'm in the cities and need to find new restaurants/things to try. I would love to keep it, but creepy! and I'm annoyed at the amount of notifications regarding the microphone.

Excellent sushi but the service absolutely sucks. Especially if you're going to try to order something to go on a busy night. Too bad because I really like their food and they could be very successful if they would hire competent staffing. I recommend Ninja Sushi

Almost everything is falsified. Some of the best places I've eaten at also have the worst rating on Yelp. The ratings are not trustworthy because Yelp will literally filter out the good reviews if the business refuses to pay for their ads. In other words, Yelp is untrustworthy. You'll sometimes see a new business start out with 4-5 stars, then for almost no apparent reason, slowly decline to 3-4 stars. Sometimes worse. Do your research before you download this app.

Very mixed feelings about Yelp. They deliver great directory on local biz's, but They still refusr to remove (provable) false ads or stop burying good reviews from long time clients. My client agreed to a single keyword & was then charged for EVERY hit/lead, other keywords, AND organic, too! maxed his limit! And address chgs wont stick. They won't fix either!

Good app but it throws you off with no notice you start reviewing it then they send you to another review before you get to use the app you want.

Love Yelp, but a glitch has made the platform unusable the past few months. When expanding the map to search this location, it shows applicable places for the first 20 results (1 page). When clicking on next 29 results, the search reverts back to your current location. Please fix this!!!!

Good app sometimes they get the order wrong
This update makes the icons smaller and all in white .Can it be updated again to way looked previous so easier to use , not all white with all icons which are harder to read?

I wish the app was moderated and regulated...someone's bad experience can really mess up how a company actually is....some reviews just sound bad just to sound bad and really can't determine if the claims are true or not. Alot of times I use yelp its 50/50 on a place and still have to use discretion on picking a place. I feel that I am back at square one even if I do pick a place.
I despise that you can't down vote bad or nonsensical reviews.
I need a photo of myself to respond on Yelp for Business but I don't need one to leave a review. I am not one for double standards. That is why I am only giving it three stars.
I hate when yelp deletes older reviews at will with no explanation.
So you're really saying there is nothing new in this update worth talking about, right? Yes, there's nothing new that I know of, but I hardly ever use the app to know.

The app is ok and I usually may find places I have interest on visiting. What I don't like...is the limitations of just a few mile radius of my location. It would be most helpful to have a wider range of places; without having to change the city. I see the option to change locations. I prefer to see other options of places in surrounding cities without having to change locations each time. I notice the places are not listed in order from #1 best rating to least rating. It's out of order and makes it difficult for decisions.

I like this app to be able to let other people know about my own personal experiences at service industry businesses but I only wish that the reviews were in order and not from 2 or three years ago and then 4 months and then from 2012 and then 3 months ago and so on. If there was a filter or if it was more organized, I would be so happy! But, sadly, all the reviews are mixed and the more recent ones are shuffled in to never be found.... Makes no sence to me. I know the people at Yelp can do better than this. Come on!

This is a good app. But delivery wise it gives me places that don't deliver to me and I wish it had an option that if you look at a suggested place and don't feel your wanting to go you can remove suggestion. I'm not a fan of Tex-Mex and it gives me a good about of those suggestions. Plus that link where you get cash back on restaurants that are with yelp, yes that didn't work.
I've been to this app 100 times, and would've rated it 5 stars on the first 99 visits, but I saw a fly next to my phone this time so I'm rating it three stars.

It's a fine app, I tend to trust it a little more than Google reviews. However, it's pretty glitchy. I get the "first to review" tag, and brag about it, only to come back to the app and find out I'm not the first to review. Embarrassing. And the Yelp elite squad tab is so glitchy, I haven't seen the correct YES squad for my city in some days now. Also, why are you joking about your patch notes? So unprofessional.

I tried to use the delivery option through Yelp/Grub hub. Yelp kept telling me there was an error processing my order so I cancelled the order. I never received a notification that my order was processed. In fact I got a pop up notice that I need to finish my order. So we got a Lyft to the restaurant because we were hungry! 30 minutes later we get a text from Grub hub person that she tried to deliver our food. So we ended up paying double for our meal. And there is no way to contact Yelp.

Great app to find restaurants it allows you to find exactly what u want. The reason the rating is so low is because when u select a restaurant to look at more closely it puts in links and info about other restaurants right at the top of the page instead of the bottom of the page where they out to be so that I've often thought I was reading about one restaurant only to realize I was reading about a different one so ANNOYING.

Yelp's algorithm for filtering reviews continues to be extremely frustrating. 100% of our reviews are Five Star reviews, but 75% of those reviews are "not recommended". Out of those 75%, i would say 80% are completely relevant and trustworthy. The thing that really gets me though is how some of those filtered reviews are "not recommended" one month, and then the next month they are; a few months later, they aren't again. Its the same review... It hasn't changed. Yelp's algorithm needs to be fixed

I think Yelp is great for helping ppl get a customer's point of view. However, I think it isn't a good idea to hide users reviews and make them not useful just because they don't go out or review that often. I didn't often leave reviews because I don't really want to put down a business, I just won't go back. Everyone's just trying to make a living after all. When it's a really bad place, or great place, or something needs to be fixed, I'll review. Does that make my review unhelpful?

It has gone dowhill since the recent Fall Update [to this app]. I requested a listing for "laundromats near me with wifi". It gave me three listings from Bakersfield, CA - But there are 20 or so in this town. Don't misunderstand me, Yelp! listed many more laundromats, but I didn't have time to drive to them and check them out. And why you might ask? Well that's because I usually try to do my laundry in the same town in which I live! All the locations of the other laundromats Yelp! had listed where in New York state!

First I can say our wait could be prevented by calling for a reservation. We waited 1:45 minutes, by the time we got in 1/3 of the restaurant are empty. What a surprised. We order our lunch at around 3:20 . It came very reasonable time , our drinks we order coke , there's no bubbles, so flat . We asked if we can have different one, she offered a bottle ones and she she came back they dont have it also, but forgot mine. Over all disappointed with that part . The food other wise is not bad.

Food is quite good but it is definitely a "Take Out" place. Must order at the counter. If you want to eat there, they only have small paper plates & plastic bowls & silverware. They have NO serving spoons or ladles (for the soup) if you want a family style dinner. We were disappointed. Their brochure shows real plated servings--not true--only paper & plastic.

I was very disappoint I went with the family it was $25 for adults and $15 for kids they gave is chicken fish and pork with rice( food looked good but it was not bad) and once you were done and everyone in restaurant received their food you will get more, well when we ask for more they said kitchen was close. We got there at 7pm order food 7:20 and got it 8:40. Sorry but I don't recommend it.

This generous 3 stars is not for the app itself (sorry) but because almost everything you click on the Yelp "mobile" website forces you to the Play store to download the app. "Yelp app or GTFO" is not a user-friendly business decision.

First of all when I open up a place I want to find reviews on it doesn't pop up. Other places pop-up sometimes they are similar but I have to scroll and scroll to get to the actual place I'm looking for. This is confusing sometimes. I'm not a fan of companies who force you to get apps to see their reviews. I should be able to do it on an internet search browser.

It's been acting differently recently. For instance, it had stopped translating from a foreign language to English. Another is when you hit "activity" followed by "friends", at times I don't get their updated. Even if I hit "following." I've missed several notifications too. This is all via mobile app. (Google pixel 2XL)

Facial and day pass were over charged by $40. I am disappointed by the purposeful convelouded billing. I needed to show them the website and have them compare my receipt for reimbursement. I had to double check my other receipts as they put automatic gratuity on it and still ask you to provide gratuity on top of that. Finally at check out the sales person verbally states, you will want to put a 20% tip for your service. Mind you the service was already being charged at almost $200... $40 tip!

This restaurant needs to make salt their friend. The beef & beans were so bland & even dousing it with salsa didn't help. Otherwise, the food was good & atmosphere great. Staff was nice & service was fast.
Yelp gave me a San Francisco address, and will not allow me to correct it to the Midwest.

Latest update breaks location integration on Galaxy S8. Requests location permission and when you grant it you get a message that location is off, even though it is not and never is. Double checked to be sure and location was/is on. Have to enter location manually. Not the end of the world but still inconvenient. You need to test better and certainly include all the most popular devices.

I like my experience but I feel there should be more of a incentive to do reviews. Seem we only write reviews if we dont like something. There is so much out there as someone who has moved quite a bit I want to see more recommendations for every area. That takes time but people woul take more of their own time to do that if you offed a larger incentive. Most places are not on your reward incentive. We need more! Everyone should be wanting their business and can easily happen. MICHELLE P.

The only thing i do not like about yelp is how at times when you post a review on something it is either removed or hidden without explanation. it feels like your dealing with a monopoly of "pick and choose" regarding a review you write. You do the picking on who and what you review, but yelp ultimately chooses what review will be visible to the consumer. And by the way, regardless if they allegedly use an automated computer system that chooses what review is legit or not. super frustrating.

App is useful as a foodie. Perhaps more useful once it becomes routine trying to use it for other locations. For right now, just adding it to the already overcrowded smart phone of other social media apps. What would actually give this app five stars is a map. I would like to type in a place and have a map show me all locations instead of just giving me addresses because an address doesn't really help if im not from the area. I can use this app but when I'm traveling I also have to use Gmaps.

When it goes into phone mode, it won't let you back out. So you have to close The app and then open it again. The search results are stuffed with false positives. If you only want Chipotle, for example, then you need to use Google maps, otherwise you get ohso many Mexican places and many non-mexican places too.
Having Horrible internet connectivity and constant Server error logs

Compared to Swarm this app is pretty mediocre. Not nearly as fun. Only a handful of badges that are not consistent in when you get them (over 500 check ins and I still dont have a badge you're supposed to get at 200), lack of support in many countries, and if you want to FIND someplace you checked in years ago? Forget it! Theres no map of check ins! How stupid is that? I have to scroll for years to try and find it and if you accidentally click on a place while scrolling, it resets! Bad UI!!!!

Kind of buggy, it seems to be a useful app but seems not to be friendly to the technically challenged like me, having a difficult time editing and it has me in California when I'm in Washington State and I don't know how to fix this. I appreciate the response however, if you need expert help with the site, don't you think it would be better to just make it more user friendly? Also noticed that when you hit "Edit review", it gives you a blank space, that isn't editing, that's rewriting.

The app works amazing giving you many options. One thing I am not liking is the it does not give u an option to negotiate tips from restaurants. It's either 15% or it would tell u that they dont deliver to your location. That's not a fair option specially when your waiting for over an hour for your food and your force to eat it cold.
It is too complicated to delete a user account.

The app just isn't very friendly. I've spent a lot of time google how to customize certain features - especially the personal profile information - only to give in and use the desktop version to make the changes I wanted to make. I'd like to also point out that I had no intention of rating the app, but it asks me to every time I use it, and typing this is easier than clicking the box away every single time.

I really love the app, honest. However the delivery quality have been lacking. I'll place an order and won't really know it's on its way half the time until the driver tells me they're here. Also, 90% of the time they ask me to meet them downstairs as they don't want to come to my apartment unit. If there was a way to change the location for the drivers to know where the unit is, that would be great. But most of the time, they tell me to meet them as they don't want to check the map for you.

I absolutely hate how your website forces me to download the app. But the quick response deserves something... I guess I shouldn't rate while grumpy. You honestly won me over. I finally downloaded the app after all these years. Already though, and maybe the option is there and I couldn't find it, but I was trying to sort reviews by most recent and couldn't find the option.

I like the ability to communicate on this app, BUT I think that too many people use it to hurt businesses. If you have a less than great experience, I hope that you try to let the business know first, before trashing them online. If you need to criticize them, I hope it is done in a constructive way. We all work somewhere and know the feeling...

I'm sure the app was great - but I was forced to install it just to confirm an existing reservation. I should be able to just do this in the browser. (What if my phone was low on space? Or I'm one of those few people without a smartphone? Or maybe I just want to have a choice in what I do and don't install on my phone.) Edit: Thanks for the quick response from the Yelp team - I appreciate it when an effort is made to make their user's voices heard.

The app works fine. Some reviews are questionable and Yelp lets them stand. For example, a restaurant review where nothing about the restaurant is reviewed. Instead, the reviewer complains that she had an allergic reaction for a condition she didn't know she had and blames the restaurant. Yelp won't remove it wven though nothing is weitten about food, environment or service. Makes me question the Yelp integrity.

Really needs a 'stupid' button to rate some of the posted reviews. The app itself works fine but the reviews are mostly 50/50 when it comes to accuracy and fairness. Which most of the time makes using it less than helpful. I use it to locate restaurants, I just don't use the reviews to decide where to go.

I love Yelp, but really wish they freshened up the UI and the app as a whole. All the filters and sorting options are so tiny, that it's not safe when using on the road (Google Maps updated theirs with bigger easy-to-get-to buttons). The app (and website) also seems a lot slower and heavy compared to other apps. i really don't want to switch to Google Reviews but it's so much faster.

Issue: I'm currently facing a bug using this app- when I try to call a service owner; it brings to call screen where I see the number; when I dial in I cannot come back to yelp screen if the call in ingoing. only when the call gets disconnected- I get to access the yelp again. When it is worst: This is really frustrating when I call at the restaurant and try to look at their Menu same time- i just can't. please work on resolving this issue.

Yelp is pretty good in terms if you want to find things to do where you are,it helps improve your writing,you meet new people,and then you also can learn how to tell your stories more. Personally I never really review places that I experienced negatively, but, do review places that I have a positive experience, because I want them around.

had the app for a bit now looking for tree trimming services and it does work to the point where it connects you to some companies and they respond fairly fast asking you for more information on the service you need and then after that you don't hear from any of them so now back to square one looking at Google to find someone to do the job .

Yeah I would like the option, when on mobile, to not have to download an app just to see a full review. It's annoying. I want to read one review maybe every 6 months, I don't need an app taking up space just for my biyearly use. Very annoying. The app is not unhelpful, just irritating.

Yelp is wonderful for quick locating of any number of a variety of different types of businesses and their customers opinions. Reviewing is nicely templated and almost writes itself. The food is always delicious ðŸ˜‹ Definitely never a problem with the food. Just one thing, nothing is as bad as finding a hair in your food. I just saw the servers in a commercial for people picking up food. All their hair was long and down. It was also like that before Covid19. Hope this falls in the right hands. Thanks

Ok app, would be better if reviews didn't disappear. My dads business is growing and he recommends people to rate his business in yelp; many of his customers create the yelp account solely to rate his business and it's not fair that because they aren't active on rating other business, the ratings get dropped. This makes no sense on getting a feel of a company if your algorithms discriminate against people with low activity.

Bookmarks no longer show whether a place has closed for good, and no longer show distance. These are both extremely important to me, as i have a good 200 bookmarks of mostly restaurants i want to try.
