You lose the search of the browser when yelp suggests opening its external app to view more pictures or to read detailed rewiews. VERY frustrating! fix it yelp, this really sucks! update: app is useful but problem remains. I only use the app without Google search result.

Disappointed. I eat there regularly and wanted to be supportive, so I got take out for restaurant week. Their special was 3 meats, 2 sides, drink and key lime pie for $25. I chose rib tips, brisket and sausage, kettle chips and corn bread. I thought I would have enough to share or carry me through the weekend. It looked like I had a lot of meat, but in actuality, there was a sliced french roll underneath to make it appear there was more. Not worth the price.

Has issues with VPN (PIA). I use(d) this app on Android and windows and it doesn't function with the vpn client turned on. I understand the location won't be accurate but it won't even let me search. And no, I won't be turning off the VPN.

This app sends me notifications for restaurants in cities hours away. WHY????? I looked at my settings and it has my city listed. I looked and no way to contact yelp. Because this app has location problems, I turned off all notifications. Seriously yelp, why are you sending me restaurant notifications for restaurants over 2.5 hours away???? If more stupid issues happen like this, I will uninstall your app.

Great idea and obviously a lot of people go off the reviews people give companies on Yelp. I dont understand why Yelp keeps deleting posts that my business receives. Theses are legit reviews from our customers and the only one to survive was from 6 years ago when we had different staff and we were at a different location. I monitor other businesses and haven't seen anything like what I'm experiencing.

It is good for looking for restaurants and places to go though, and for looking at reviews and leaving reviews. It's just horrible for takeout. I ordered takeout through Yelp's Grubhub extension. SUGGESTIONS FOR YELP: 1) sometimes, I'd like to add a single restaurant to multiple personal Collections. The way you have it now, I have to click the Bookmark button, select a single Collection from a list, then the Bookmark list closes automatically ...and then I have to repeat the same procedure to add the same restaurant to an additional Collection. Can you allow the possibility of adding multiple Collections in one go? ...perhaps something like a checklist, and a "done" button to complete the additions. 2) please allow us to search within a personal Collection - like finding a restaurant type - like 'sushi' - within my diverse 'Favorite Restaurant' Collection. 3) would be great to *search* for another user's curated Collection - not just stumble upon one as with the current system on your app. 4) have a menu button option for "things to do" in a given city. I have Notion on my Surface Pro 6 and it works perfectly. The reason why I'm giving it 1 star because Notion in my phone (LG Velvet) is for one, but fundamentally important, reason: the backspace is too annoying to work with. Whenever I type continuously and backspace occasionally while doing so, it works fine. But when I try to edit a different block, it deletes one LETTER at a time and removes my keyboard. It makes writing so difficult, cumbersome, and not at all enjoyable.

Data mining too. The first screen is a login screen. You don't get to see any functionality without handing over your personal data, no quick run through, examples, nothing. So if after a couple of minutes you realise you don't like it, the company already has your personal data to sell on. Bait The US may allow this kind of basic violations, but here in the EU this violates GDPR. Considering it's available here, it has to obey those regulations. Reported to Google as high data security risk.

I want to use notion to organise my small business contacts and bookings. The theory is all good. this can be done in Notion. However, there are two issues. 1) There is no offline use. You cannot save information for offline on mobile. This is a problem because I don't always have connection while travelling. Evernote has this. Google docs and sheets have this. 2) Web version is very slow. Because it is all online it has to send requests to their cloud in order to open databases. This is major pain in the ass when you are trying to fill out a client table where you would simply add client names. This take about 30+s for a single name! Just not viable for serious work where one needs to be quick and efficient.

This is a really great service generally - but I think I found a bug. On Android 6.1 on my Samsung Galaxy Note 4, the cursor doesn't move to the end of the line as you type, instead staying at the beginning of the line (or wherever you placed it). So for example if you type the letter 'a' then the letter 'b' then 'c', you end up with 'cba' in your note, with the cursor still before the 'c'. Can this be looked at, please? If this can be sorted I'll switch from Evernote, as I love your Markdown support.
Some really glaring inconsistent behavior on Android. App takes forever to open, pages created in the app don't sync up when opened in web and a few minor ones.

I *loved* this product when I first got it. I spent hours working on it. The more time I spent on it, the more I realized I could do the same things more simply with other products. But it was so beautiful! Unfortunately, then I started to see a few problems. I once relied on Notion to work offline in Android for vital driving directions. I got the google map ready but got an error when I tried to embed it (a specific function that is supposedly one of Notion's "miracles"). Then I made a PDF and uploaded the file. That worked. Then I opened the page on my phone to make sure the image was downloaded. Then in the car, when I needed it, all I saw was a blank page. Based on feedback (there was no help) from Notion's support, I realized that the best description for this is "Young product; mature price." Buyer beware.

I really like notion and find it really useful, so I don't want to give it up, but I run into major issues the Android app. Trying to select a favorite note to switch to right after opening the app sometimes causes a crash. Additionally, sometimes when reopening the app, the note I want will be open but then quickly replaced with a message that says this content doesn't exist, which is really frustrating when I know the note does still exist. I've had to switch back to other tools.
the app itself is great and good looking but as long it is not supporting right-to-left writing (Hebrew speaker) I cannot recommend it nor use it.

I loved Notion while I gave it a try, mainly for college note-taking, and I found so much more. It allows one to organize other things in formats other than simple notes. However, because of that, its note-taking features are not as stand-out as other options. Its search is not as good, and its offline features still have a ways to go (for example, I can't use the custom page copy button offline). The final thing is that the mobile app is slow to the point of being unusable, sadly.

Notion is an incredible service. One of the best. But this app for Android is not good. It's slow as a webapp, the features are confusing and hidden in menus, the app does not work offline, it takes more than 20 seconds to open, does not work well on slow and unstable connections, is not fluid and has no animations and a bug causes you to log in again every time the app is opened. I really hope for improvements.

I give the Desktop a 5 star review. The mobile has bugs, takes a long time to open, sometimes have to force the app closed. Other times when saving my work, get the spinning circle of death and loose my work. Having to force the app close to get it working again. I keep using the mobile app, knowing they fix these problems and it will be just as good as the desktop.

I absolutely love Notion on the desktop, it's wonderful for anything from simple todo lists to larger projects to just regular notetaking. But, this app is just way way way too slow. Loading takes forever, and once it does load, everything is just so choppy. I can barely drag a block of text. Add to that the fact that a lot of simple keyboard shortcuts from desktop just don't exist in a quickly accessible way, and you can see why you basically can't be productive with it on mobile.
It's a great app but way to slow . And the dark mode needs a black theme ( appearance) , the dark mode is grey which makes it unattractive .

This used to be my favorite notes/to-do list apps, but not anymore. When I first got this app, it would load right away and I could easily scroll through my different lists. If I had no WiFi, I could simply add something to my list and it would be synced as soon as I connected again. As of late, however, this app takes several seconds longer to load, crashes an average of three times before I can open it once, and has syncing issues. It's a shame to see such a great app fall apart like this.

I pray for Evernote to last for the rest of my life. Notion does way more than I need day to day, and it runs like it. Too long to open, too hard to navigate and, after 3 months trying it out, I still feel like I have a loose stack of handwritten notes crammed into my phone. The last straw was not being able to figure out how to zoom in on a picture I put on a page. I tried dragging fingers apart, double tapping and looking for "zoom in" under ... , then gave up. Only if I have to, Notion.

I have tested this off and on. Slow loading as others mentioned is a problem when trying to quickly jot something down. I also had problems with basic functionality. Could not load an image from my phone or Google photos. Selecting one of their images was extremely slow to draw. Sharing the notes out? The typical Share icon for every app in the world opened something different than regular sharing. The other non-intuitive way didn't share out anywhere. This app doesn't seem to ready.

Notion has a great set of features and flexibility which makes it great for storing notes and everything else. But it is just way too slow. Launching takes 10 seconds, navigating between pages a little less but still frustratingly slow. It claims to have a fully offline mode but in practice this is not the case at all. You will spend more time looking at the Notion splash screen and loading spinners than your notes. It's a world away from something like Evernote in terms of performance/fluidity.

Great tool. Congratulations. So why 2 stars only? Because this Android version is a nest of bugs. Crazy amount of bugs (Galaxy Note 10+ here). The app is not ready yet. I have to force quit it *MANY* times to see notes again (they disappear). And embedding PDFs just does not work. Oh, yes: I also rate with 2 stars because there's no handwriting. But the potential is huge. I believe one day I will edit this comment to rate the app with 5 stars.

I just love this app. The features. Customisable templates. All good. You guys could work on UX more but it's decent now. But I'm going back to Evernote for only one reason. App loading time. It just takes forever for me to open the app. I keep waiting. 10 to 15 seconds maybe is not a long time. But when you quickly wanna note something and waiting for long time is not a great experience.

1000 block limit? That's like 20 to do lists and that's it. It's fancy, but I'll stick to Google Keep, which doesn't have such an arbitrarily low limit. Why not use the user's Google Drive storage, and allow as many as you want? Totally misleading, since there's no ads or in-app purchases listed in the Play Store, but it's practically useless if you don't pay the $48-$60 for one person per year. Insane for a notes app.
Login problem
Fix this f*****g app for god's sake.
No offline mode! And I forgot my password and now the link send to me to reset password takes me to login page! What! I can't reset my password
Android app is really slow compared to Web/PC. Hope it gets better.
performance was not good and theres no widget support

I like Notion, I use it on Desktop, web and mobile. But Android app is too slow, it loads things for ages, and when I exit the app and return or just lock the screen and return to app it takes another year too load the whole page all over again, even if I don't edit a singe thing. I am using OnePlus 7 Pro on it's latest build of Android 10. I hope the app would be more usable over time.

I love the features, but the experience on my android device really sucks, it constantly reload itself everytime I switch to it from another app, making notes while switching app back and forth is really painful. I mean REALLY PAINFUL. Startup time should be improved too!!!!!
Dude the app version really needs improvement it's slow but I just love the web notion
I like notion but only on web, android app To much luggy, like using the browser version or idk, pls write a native application :)
The idea is great, but it's extremely slow on Chrome and Android. Several lines of text or table entries disappeared at random, which made the app unstable and unreliable for me.
The app is ok, two factor authentication would be great.

I love Notion and the way it organizes information. It's very flexible and organizes information the way every notes app should. That being said, the Android app is still incredibly slow when it opens up. I get the splashscreen every time I switch from it and back to it. A web wrapper isnt going to cut it, guys. Also, text size is small and I cant zoom in on notes like I can in other note apps.
This app is great and best but I don't know why it lags on my phone (I request the creators to please find solution for this)

I love Notion. But only on the web. The Android app is nonsense. It's ok for just viewing and selecting some properties of some objects. Specifically, if I hit of the ellipsis of a block (to, say, delete the block), the menu and keyboard pops up, and then vanishes before I select something, and then re-appears, and this cycles perpetually. There are many other glitches which makes this unusable. Notion's advantage over its competitors (remnote/roam) is the mobile-version! Please be responsible!
the idea of the app is greet. but there's some issues. i can't copy all text in the note only one line. another problem. no RTL typing support. please solve these two problems
I use Notion pretty much but I cannot open it in my Xiaomi Redmi Note 9 Pro. It's frustrating and super annoying since I have all my notes there.
A frustrating experience at best.
It takes a lot of time just to open the app

I love the Notion as a tool - it's awesome but.. ..the Android app is very sluggish and poorly optimized, which is a pity. I will gladly change my review when the developers fix the performance of the app.
Needs fixing (samsung note 9) I can't type anything anywhere when I open this app on my phone. The keyboard bounces up then away making it impossible to work remotely from my computer.

Goddamn this app boils my blood everytime I decide to give it another chance . Its been like 3 years since a lot of people asked them for reccuring tasks yet they completely ignore such a trivial and much needed feature. Their iphone first approach caused the app to be extemely slow and laggy. Even simple menues don't appear to have any smoothness while scrolling. For the love of God add reccurring tasks you imbeciles

This is a really good product, but the mobile app for this definitely needs to improve alot, for instance 1. having widget to access different pages and to view calendar/board/table similar to asana would be nice ðŸ‘Œ, 2. there is a long lag when opening between different pages, 3. Having a notification system/alarm linked to the phone would be nice as well, or 4. Just being compatible with good calendar
Takes 15 sec to load when I open the app. Please make this faster.

This app is extremely important to me. The databases concept and everything else about it is very much needed. However with the latest updates it had become almost impossible to work with this app on phones. It keeps glitching between wide page view mode and overall narrow view and it is impossible to type up what you want because it keeps switching between them and shutting the keyboard down. Please look into this. I've been waiting for an update to fix this problem for over a month now!

I want to use notion to organise my small business contacts and bookings. The theory is all good. this can be done in Notion. However, there are two issues. 1) There is no offline use. You cannot save information for offline on mobile. This is a problem because I don't always have connection while travelling. Evernote has this. Google docs and sheets have this. 2) Web version is very slow. Because it is all online it has to send requests to their cloud in order to open databases. This is major pain in the ass when you are trying to fill out a client table where you would simply add client names. This take about 30+s for a single name! Just not viable for serious work where one needs to be quick and efficient.

Notion is great! Use it constantly, which is why I probably have found a bug that's very frustrating on Android that started recently. Adding items in a list (todo, bullets, etc) and pressing the enter/return key to go to the next line and add another results in a blank line and me having to add a new list entirely to keep my original going. Definitely not optimized for speed, which I really want when adding bullets on the fly.
This app is very functional but needs end to end encryption for privacy. Until then, it's a functional app that doesn't care about the end users privacy.
This app is great. But unfortunately it consumes too much data. Within a day the data used by this app exceeds the data used for Instagram. This seemingly trivial thing ruined my user experience.
Numbered Bullets don't work on app.

Buggy. Love the program in other platforms but the android feels buggy. Keyboard keeps disappearing on me when I try to type. Screen shows up tiny. Really really bad version. It's really too bad, since it's a great program wise.
There's bug in new update.
Quite claustrophobic compared to the web version and not as nicely laid out. UI looks rather dated for an Android app and tends to be quite fiddly when editing text.
I have galaxy s10 and it's so laggy, I don't feel it was optimized well for the android, even if it wasn't lagging I don't think I will use it the design and ux are pretty bad.
My experience of this app on my samsung tab S6 is horrible and is really unusable it's really slow and have a lot of glitches. It works great on iOS but please make it usable on android devices also.

I was using this app since a long time but after the new update (yesterday), its not operating on my phone and its asking to upgrade my version which is not available on my phone. I can longer use this app as the keypad is not working. I have lots of data inside this app and was regularly adding more. Please send a reply to my query and solve this problem.
Performs too many full page reloads - here to use on cellular network
Which security is better 2fa or temporary password or permanent
Unusable for large documents, it takes aaaaaaages to load. Edit: another star taken off because when you copy and paste text it pastes it all jumbled!!
Does almost everything. No freehand drawing was the dealbreaker for me. I won't be able to draw ideas on this app.
Give us the offline features, only feature that doesn't let me leave Keep and grab Notion... ðŸ˜”
While Notion is an incredibly helpful editor, it's android app takes rather long time to load and navigate
Slower and not as smooth as the website. Takes a long while to open up which is the exact opposite of what you want when taking a quick note. Desperately needs a widget.
A bit too clunky for me.
It's too slow I love it but I have a hard time opening it if I need it

The app itself is okay but I don't like its offline version - because it's not really offline. You still need an internet connection in order for you to save your work. You need to preload pages if you'd like to view them and some functions don't work offline say, autocorrect, it does for a while and stops midway. I also don't like how you can't highlight specific parts of a sentence. The function forces you to highlight the entire paragraph ðŸ™„
Unnecessarily Complex
offline experience isn't just an option.... it's a basic necessity in a note taking app... Otherwise excellent on the desktop version
please optimize your app for android

It's a great application there's no denying that but recently started getting very laggy and Glitchy which made me uninstall the app sorry but I really wish you could make it less laggy on Android beside that everything is so perfectly splendid!
Doesn't seem to work well with a Bluetooth keyboard. I'm sure other aspects are fine, but that was a deal breaker for me.
Glitchy, please fix it.
Can't use it offline
does it really take too long when u open it for the first time? coz mine does. it's not even loading, only showing the icon badge
It freezes around 30 seconds on Splash Screen, other than that app works fine. Please fix this, I will update my review and rating later.
Great app on desktop, dark mode and other functionalities are missing on mobile. Will increase rating if gets added, but not worth using on my phone.
Why is this app so slow to use? It wont install on Windows 10 for hours on end. And on Android, it takes forever to load even though you've already logged in. Really takes all the fun away.
Even though the app is genuinely an "all in one workspace", it's too slow and lags a lot. I'd definitely use it someday once the issues are resolved but for now, uninstalled.

Please provide some flexibility to work with text. I can't select text in multiple paragraphs to edit, format or delete. Need to work on each block individually. This is among the basic things to be addressed by a note taking app.
Slow slow slow slow slow slow slow slow slow
I cant even open it... Somebody help. I was told it was really grt...but :(

The app is Good. I really need this for my online class but it's taking so long to open. It takes atleast 2 minutes to open, and sometimes it just says I should connect to network even when I'm already connected to internet. I hope you fix this.

Looks promising but no obvious way to select multiple lines of text (for example to reorder sentences or paragraphs). Also developer feedback conversation in the app is not continuous. Has the developer read my messages or not? Who knows?
I will use it when it will have writing feature with y S pen
The Android app is very slow and buggy
It's too lagging. I am using Samsung A8+ and I hardly navigate or edit my 5000 word note (only text). Every function is freeze when I open the note.

While I love notion on my desktop, the usability of this app is atrocious. Half of the time when I just want to scroll around I drag and drop something by accident, or activate some editing feature. Can you please just disable editing all together, so I at least can use the app to look at my notion workspace without the risk of corrupting it?
This app doesn't has feature or importing notes on Android version.. Many other features are missing.

The Desktop app is the best thing I have ever used for college. But the mobile app is a big contradiction to the standards set by the desktop app. Navigation is horrible and sometimes the app just crashes.
Takes 2min to start ..why?
Would like to suggest a dark/light theme toggle. I use dark mode on my phone but I would like to use notion with a light theme because it's easier to read my notes in the light theme. Thanks.
Recently installed the app. I believe it has nice functions but please fix the loading time. It's been 10 minutes already and it does not redirect to the homepage.
Very slow interface and loading time....

i really like the idea of notion and how the app is supposed to work, but it wont open on my phone. it's stuck loading on its loading screen when i open the app. my phone doesnt have issues or anything, it's really just the app :< help me please :<
Unfortunately using the app is a completely frustrating and time consuming experience.
extremely poor performance, though it has improved from unusable to just laggy.
Notion itself is 5 stars. The android app however has too many compromises, I have to use the browser version on my tablet. Its 2020 the app should be just as capable as the web version.

I found that everything lags on the Android version unfortunately to the point of being usable like 20% of the time.
Works really well on desktop, but can't log in with my apple ID on my phone. Been trying for a while.

Most amazing concept for a note taking app but sadly subpar experience in mobile. The app is laggy, slow and takes forever to load the content. I am running a very latest smartphone which doesn't have any issues no matter what I throw at it so I know that this a problem with the app itself. Comes nowhere close to the experience on desktop.
Extremely confusing, trying to navigate and figure out what I'm meant to be doing and what things do. The amount of times I've said ".... Er, what???" is astounding.
I by all means love the service but the android app is too laggy and transition are bad
I love notion but the desktop and Android apps are so slow and frequently crash.
The app is not opening , keeps stocked at the initial app opening page itself.

Back in around 2002-ish there was a site called Diigo v2. The hype then was web 2.0. I called it the first web 3.0 app. Everything should have been rainbows and glitters but Diigo forgot its' customer. In 2020 that's not new but Diigo did not build enough loyal paying customers yet so no one knew how big Diigo could've been. It practically ate up Delicious back then but like Notion, it didn't value the direction of its customers over the company. Use this don't rely on it when it doesn't load.
usually good, but started doing this thing where it closes the keyboard every time i backspace. using Samsung Galaxy S20+. makes typing very frustrating and pretty much impossible
I use Notion on desktop and it is absolutely amazing there but the Android app needs a lot of development.
Great on website but bad mobile app. Every time I press backspace on android, it closes the keyboard. This makes it extremely annoying to type
Deal breaker -- the app is useless offline. Even simple checklists are not available when you're on plane or somewhere with bad connection. Otherwise would've been perfect productivity tool.

While the desktop app is the most wonderful software i've discovered in a few years, the android version is a difficult experience. Most of the time the app cannot connect to the internet. On the rare occasions that it does, it is very slow.

Pretty frustrating experience. It has great tools, but is so glitchy on my phone and on my ipad (which I hoped would be better). They don't sync and it's hard to edit without it glitching. Will be giving it a few more days before going back to evernote.

(Update at the end) Doesn't work. The app closes itself. I use the laptop version which awesome but I wish it would work on my phone too. After i download it, the app is not opening. I tried to clear the cache and data of the app but still it not opening
The app is very sluggish and slow, Though the functionality is all fine, Its just too slow, I Want to access my notes quickly and The app takes almost a minute to get to the homepage
The app is not stable

I love using Notion as an all around productivity tool. It's the most versatile I've ever used. The Android app however, leaves a lot to be desired at the moment. Tables have been unreliable for me on the Android app. Multiple times per day, all my table entries disappear, or my calculations at the bottom of columns disappear. There's no true offline support either. Unfortunately, these issues make the Android app difficult to depend on, and I've switched to the webapp.
I can't log in into the android app! It keeps ln saying that I need to connect to the internet and requires me to sign in again (even if I am connected to the internet). Hope you could fix this :((
The usage experience in android is unbelievably bad

I love Notion, but their Android app is sluggish, buggy and sometimes non functional. It's frustrating to use and puts me off from actually fully using Notion. Lack of handwriting / drawing support is also a big negative. It's a shame to see this space not have a true winner, and I'm not convinced Notion will ever be given the lack of focus on Android.

1/9/2021- Syncing issues with Android app with latest version. any known issues it is? I am getting scared sometimes when am not able to see my content in android 10. Also, app crashing when adding content via share content from other apps. Most wanted or basic feature is missing still: tagging a bookmark is needed rather than visual bookmark.

I am giving it a three star because there is a few features or changes that need to be addressed. Like many of the other reviews. Having widgets on the Android version of the app would be great. Also the ability to copy all text and not just one line item. I will revise my ratings once these changes have been addressed. Until then my five stars await.

I really like Notion, but I wish it could be improveâ€”it should be stored directly just like in Windows platform. Edit: I've been using Notion for a very long time. I really love the app but I think the android app feels like an unpolished app. It has no offline support, which I badly need, and the loading time takes too long than expected.

Notion on web is great, but this app lacks some important features and is not optimised for mobile use. I can't give more stars until offline mode is present and useful widgets are available. Also, the navigation could be better. To sum up, Notion is great, but this app needs improvement.

I wish they had different Calendar views and layouts. I like to set my daily tasks on certain times and like to see them on daily or weekly, or 2 weekly layout, like Google Calendar. But here I can see only monthly view, which is not very convenient. And more task you put, longer it becomes, which is annoying. Meaning stretches the Calendar. You might say, you can use Weekly Agenda but there's no specific date and time. I don't want to do daily tasks on two places.

If you're looking for an extremely heavyweight wiki and all your use cases already match the templates, this is the tool for you. If you need something that's not already a template, expect 3rd-class treatment from the app since you can't really build them yourself to the same level. Mobile is only good for quick edits to an existing workspace, commenting, or look ups. Sharing hyperlinks gives malformed partial content extraction without the extra Clipper app (N/A on mobile).

I love notion, however app is missing a lot. Android version is so slow that a lot of times it's more convenient for me to just go and open the web version. And I really wish there were widgets and notifications

The concept of the app is phenomenal. A good mastery of the desktop version puts you in complete control of your life. It can serve as several other tools. Sadly the Android version is heavily limited by the performance issues. It needs some hefty optimizations from the devs to actually be usable. The app is painfully slow when there are many pages and subpages, and it's definitely not the fault of my device.

Starting from where I left was not a great thing because I constantly find myself in a deleted or finished page, and instinctively I press back button which leads me to exit. I definitely love the desktop app but mobile version needs to take a lot of way to be useful. edit: it is also laggy and does not have smooth transitions for some reason

Fantastic app... HOWEVER, it's probably never going to stop being horrendously slow to launch and use... Please, focus on making the application usable! Consult some other professionals or something if you need to. It needs to be a priority, because it's the single biggest turn-off that Notion has, and it applies even to fans like myself.

Three stars because it lacks its own wigets for android phones. It is difficult to know what tasks you have on your to do list. You need to open the app time and again to see the tasks which is less productive :(

The system is OK, but the Android App has some little bugs left. If you mention them to the Notion team they just play the block off game, no bug reports appreciated, everything is perfect. I wonder if they use Notion for real GTD.

Please change the emojis in android with the default emojis in our phones (ex. Samsung), and please make the animation of opening or closing pages smoother in android. Will change the rating to 5 if it will be done! Still like the app nevertheless.
It works fine most of the time but sometimes it doesn't let you edit things and it'll go crazy, I think it's a bug so please fix it, it's so f***ing frustrating , other wise the app is pretty

I've just started using Notion and was amazed by its capabilities. However, the app runs extremly sluggishly on mobile and has lots of bugs e.g. the menu for selecting data type for a cell doesn't want to open.

Really useful. Wish there was more customization options for fonts, colors, and the like -- you're currently limited to what they give you. Also, no high level security features like 2FA and end to end encryption make this a risky app to use for sensitive data.

The service is exceptional! The best all-in-one ever made! It's able to replace a number of apps in one, it's a real must to learn! However... This is the kind of apps that are used offline a lot! To take notes, create events and reminders, journaling and much more! The problem here is that, when offline, the app is unusable: no images, no emojis. Just not a good experience... The community needs an improved and full "offline mode", at least for not shared pages (no server-side errors there)!

I love the web/desktop version of Notion, but the Android app simply doesn't measure up. UI could be far sleeker, and the theme colour shouldn't be tied to system default. Overall kind of disappointing given how amazing the desktop version is.

This app of EXCEPTIONAL! it has gt lots of features that i loved!! However, there is still a lot of improvement space. 1. Notion is one of the best tools out there and is really helping me to become more productive and less anxious. But this app has a lot of room for improvements. The sync algorithm, for example, has to be improved. I'm connected to a really good wifi and sometimes some of the items created on the app disappear when synchronizing and then reappear magically after some time. This is the foundation of the app. Seriously, work it out.

I love Notion. I use the app daily for note taking, journalling and studying. It offers a wide variety of editing options, which can be a little challenging to get used to and really create the best version for you, but it's so worth learning. One of the things I love the most about it is its clean, intuitive design, which seems to be lacking in the Android app in comparison to the laptop edition, hence the 3 stars. Otherwise, it's the closest to perfection you can get :)

Hurts me to say this because I love Notion so much but this app is abysmal. React Native is really limiting the performance of the application and it's apparent in literally every little thing you do. Every app switch triggers a complete reload. The app just doesn't feel responsive or like a native app, it very much feels like a website. For the Love of God, switch to a native app!

I absolutely LOVE Notion, it's my second brain. There are just two shortcomings with this app: 1) the share function doesn't let me change anything but the name and location of the element I'm improving into Notion. I would really love to be able to edit more of its values while I'm adding it. 2) The relational properties of databases are slow. After I type the first few characters, it takes several seconds for it to find the existing element in a related database. That slows down workflow.

There's a long nothingness when logging in to Notion. Would be nice if there's a loading to indicate that something is happening. Add animations to android web clipper. Solid 5/5 on PC, on my Android however, it's super slow and bugs alot.
It's very slow in opening up and loading.
Quite confusing to use but quite good. I am using Google notes now but this I'm sure if u get the hang of it would do the same

Lately my Notion has been bugging a lot. I don't know why, but when I try to do my notes on my phone using notion it glitches (with some options just appearing blank and unresponsive when I touch them). This has been happening quite a while now and my Notion also crashes sometimes. Is there any way to fix this? :'( Thank you!

Your app is a life saver for me I don't know how much I use notion. I even ditched Onenote, Keep notes, Todoist and Evernote for this app.I am even trying to ditch Google calendar for my daily life organization. Just two problems, I don't have a flagship phone, so please optimize the app for low specs devices and add local storage support for the files rather than storing them on AWS. These are the only two flaws of Notion otherwise it's a app made in heaven for me.

Love this app! Great for managing your life and plenty of users that share templates and advice. The mobile version is lacking in some features and it's a bit slow, but I still use that more than the web version. However there are times I will specifically get on my computer to do something on notion. It's one of my favorite apps if not my favorite

It's a really great app which provide an all in one journal. But the thing is it takes a little time to open both app and desktop. This app should be boost my productivity, but with the length time to open this app, it might make my productivity slows down a little bit.

A nice app to manage notes, snippets, tasks and projects. And the best part is the ease of customising as needed. There is a learning curve though. One downside I felt is the time it takes to refresh. It would be a great app, if it works seamlessly like Google keep notes or Trello.

Overall the app is great and i love the premise: create and organize your life or projects through databases easily manipulated through any device without any coding knowledge needed. However, there are some obstacles, like not being able to multi-select text or blocks. I also have privacy concerns about notion employees being able to access the contents of my account wholesale. For a personal organizer, this should be number 1 priority: privacy and safety. The rest are good. 8/10.

I'm absolutely in love with Notion, I use it for almost everything in my life, and one of those uses is writing. I found a problem, though, and that is that paragraph indentation doesn't exists, not even in pc, and by pressing the TAB key, what's indented is the whole block. For writing, that's kind of a problem, as it's very useful to have indentation support both for usefulness and aesthetics, without having to press space key five times.

Lovely app, helps me organize my life and work. I wish the editing experience was better on the mobile, I often struggle to position the cursor in the right place and move things around correctly while editing text. But allows me to quickly check my pages, my other wish would be that it load faster. Even with fast internet it might take a few seconds to load a page.

I was looking for a perfect SAAS provider for LaTeX, MathTeX and Markdown notes, this seems to be the one! Really happy I found this and I've switched to Notion for all notes. However, I'd really want the developers to allow simple tables, instead of mandatorily making every table a data table.

So far...Robust. It's a learning curve but promising, more so if you can think outside the box. No widgets. No permissions for contacts, only certain features make phone numbers clickable, trial and error. Sharing difficulties, to some apps like evernote.. it shares as a sign-in to notion. Probably goes to intended note but too many steps for my need so I left off there. We shall see.

For the past 3 months since I started college, I used this app to organize my school related stuffs. Its easy to use and the tools are really useful. Hopefully, the developers can focus on catering student's welfare too. I've been using it to make notes and practice testing with the "toggle" block. I just wish there's an option to automatically shuffle the toggle blocks or show statistical results like score, time, and more. I love Notion so much that I'm willing to quit quizlet and anki.

Overall working of app is good. However, to make text bold or italic in the app, one has to use bold and italic function given in the app's toolbar. But it would be great if we can make text bold and italic just like in windows or desktop app by using ** and *. Thanks in advance.

I love notion, but the app has one big problem: you cannot insert new lines, which makes it unusable for editing for me and my colleagues when we need to add a description or elements to our todos etc. Please add the ability to insert a new line with the new line button on the keyboard. Same problem on iOS

This app has massively improved in the past year and the PC version is a God-send! However it still lacks a widget, an in-app audio recorder, and undo/redo is still hard to reach :c These few features missing really prevent me from creating in Notion as a songwriter. Besides these few problems, I love Notion and share it w/ others if it works for them. It is def the best tool for projects. If Notion had an in-app audio recording functionality I would drop Evernote for good and give 5 stars!!

I tried to like the app, but its too complicated to use. Just looking at the ui already give me headache. I use it in android, and its slow, not fast as in desktop (most videos using notion on desktop/ios). I give up, I just need a simple journal from my android phone. No need sth so complcated. For notetaking, lets just go back to normal onenote/evernote. Update 25/11: One of my friend showed me how to use it, and I love it. Its great!

I love the concept and the execution. The app is minimalistic and easy to use. However, it is terribly slow and laggy. Also, I'd appreciate having widgets in Android. Rest apart, great job by the team for this app! Will surely give 5 stars when the problems mentioned above are solved.

The best note taking app, hands down. One improvement I would like is to be able to see my pages in a grid view, and not only in a list view on the left side of the page (similarly to Google Drive). Additionally an integration to Google Drive would be highly valuable.

Well, i really like the app and although at first I was a bit confused and overwhelmed about how to use it. But I wont give it 5 stars because i have to wait like 10 seconds for the app to start. And it would be better if you implement the google calendar.

Great app, love how you keep it simple yet engaging. Never been a fan of productivity apps but I love it. Just waiting for the widget option to keep track of stuff on my home screen. That'd totally make it 5 stars.

Almost perfect in organising and sharing notes. But I was surprised that you can't add a note widget on your homescreen. I also can't copy and paste a list of lines on phone, which can be annoying to retype.
Notion is BEst note taking app. However, OFFline feature is not available. Offline feature is needed by people who have poor internet connection. So please add offline feature.

I have been using Notion as an Organizational tool to help me with my student needs, and I've got say, the experience has been phenomenal. I can manage all my tasks and note taking on this app which is incredible. Plus the software is also very user friendly.

Bug: from my Android launcher, opening a web link to an inline object, in my case a board, results in a "Content Does Not Exist" page instead of the host page. Web links to the host page work, however. Please fix!

Hello! Notion is very flexible and useful project to plan life! Thanks a lot! But I want to say that Notion's calendar very needs in periodicity of events (how in Google Calendar) because it's good reason not to use calendar in Notion.

Great and all, but what about a widget? I know widgets have been around in android for a long time and are the new thing of iOS... But how come there is no widget for Android? It would be a great simple addition that would make a lot of life's easier by reducing friction.
It's the best for today app to do anything you want. The cons are that it doesn't have the possibility of recurring tasks/appointments, and it takes 5 seconds to open up on Android app.
One of my favorite apps on my phone. Only reason I gave it a 4 star is because it does not work well when offline. I wish they would cache some of my most used pages so I can use them offline.
I tried to go deeper into the app and realised it was amazing. But we need widgets!!! Also reminders on the app don't seem to work offline, wish it did
Amazing idea. But the app still needs more work. It would be a lot better if it was more of an offline app. The interface looks a little cluttered. It could have been more visual and minimalistic.
Great, can find anything needed for a productivity and note app. Just for android, the graphics aren't smooth as that. Please consider it.
The App is Extremely Helpful, I love It! But, It should provide widgets. There are no widgets of this app on Android. Widgets are more helpful.
Great platform, but the app needs to be optimized for better viewing. Everything looks tiny and can be hard to read. Other than that great app.
Notion app installed in Mi 10T Pro has UI issues. The UI won't display pages in full width but once I open the keyboard, the content fills the screen in full. Please take a look on this. Thanks!
Please make it to where you can zoom in on images! This app is amazing for d&d, but I can't view maps easily on mobile.
Problems (mobile): 1.formatting wastes too much space. 2.cant highlight formatted areas, for mass organization. 3.Copy/paste between other programs, requires far to much manual clean up work.
Almost perfect. The only thing that bothers me is the forced system-wide color scheme. I should have the choice regardless of my system settings.
One star away from becoming best note taking app. They need to provide formatting options like the one provided in one note. Need more fonts... Plus need option to autocapitalise after full stop.
Very amazing app. It can manage your whole life you can do alot of things in the app, but it is kind of hard to use
I love this app, and I'm subscribed to Personal Pro Plan. My device is unfortunately limited to android 6, however. Hope you will still continue supporting android 6 operating system.
The notion website application is awesome but I find the app to be not so easy to use.... anyways guys it's an awesome app altogether. Great job.
It was great app, you can customize everything on it. Unfortunately it cant be opened offline, and can't sync with google calendar
It's a overall amazing app! But the website and laptop version is much better! On tablets it's quite slow and not so smooth...
Very good to manage your personal and work related tasks. Fast with shortcuts but app is very slow to open and run.
Sometimes clipping from websites doesn't clip the photos wuth it. This is really something that needs looked into.
Great application to organize information. Just that mobile app. alone takes more time to load.
great concept but needed a bit of animation or some transition move everytime we switched page. it looks so laggy
Awesome app for organizing PIM data. The one thing out meds is local sync and out will be perfect.
It would be great if it had a homesreen widget to link a specific page / favorites / quick note etc. Great app
It'll get the 5th star as soon as the OCR functionality is introduced
Missing some features when compared to ios but overall great experience.
Awesome app Please please can you make a widget that will allow to see to do lists or stuff for today week etc like microsft to do does would make this app perfection
Mobile version is a little bit clumsy, but great nonetheless
This app is Great! But If it support handwritten notes so it will be best
It is perfect app. But why there is long pause in entrance?
Nice app however I would like to request a zoom in feature for mobile users , to let us zoom into photos
This Platform is incredible but i just have one issue about reminders.
Possible to add a theme option please? I prefer my notes and texts to be on a white background but I would like to keep my android system in dark mode.
The only missing thing from this application the aplenty to create routine tasks.
Best app to take note but I hope that they support to make the page from right to left
Takes so long to open (30-60+ seconds) that I usually give up before it loads
Overall this app is a great feature for planning yourself up and to improve your productivity.
When is handwriting support coming Please add a manual dark or light theme switch. I like using this app in light theme while i use others in dark.
Amazing, but needs widget options on android as well ;_;
Great app, but would be even better with widgets

App is great for laptops but not for androids. I hope Notion will be more accessible for android users. Nevertheless, I still love to use it even if it's quite laggy. Thank you for your hardwork! Edit: May I suggest another update? I was thinking that it would be great if we were able to use hex codes for the color background! That way users can get more creative with their works and such. :)

Excellent app! And let's make organize my notes better than any other app. My only complaint is that it takes a lot of time to open when I start the app and isn't very smooth when switching to other pages. Besides that this is one of the best note taking apps! If you need organized notes, download this without question!

This is THE BEST application for productivity. You get to-do lists, plannersand more for free and offline also! But its not entirely optimised for android I suppose, as there are many bugs. When you hold your device in portrait, it js really hard to even edit a property as the window keeps changing. Please fix it.
This app has so much potential. Please add offline support.
Good but there should be some 2FA to secure account. Expect that very good.
Rating 4.5* This is a beautiful app for official works with a group of peoples, not as a personal note taking app.
Missing widgets to give it five stars!
The app is amazaing but need more optimization as it's too slow

Love this app! It has tons of customization features and the searchable cover photo database is a nice touch. But it's not without bugs. 1) When inserting a photo, you're given the option to select multiple. But if you select multiple photos, only the first one appears... so be ready to add them one by one. 2) You're also given two options on where to select photos: capture photo, and files. If you want to add via Google Photos, you have to scroll through "other apps" which takes a while...

This app is amazing, the seamless integrations with my computer, the endless organization and formatting options, you guys are doing an incredible job. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is the app is still a bit slow and cumbersome. Also the undo redo feature doesn't work properly. So if you could fix those issues, that would make it even more awesome! Thanks for creating such a simple, yet powerful program. Reuben

I was recently introduced to notion and I love it! The features are amazing, there is so much you can do with it. The only thing I found frustrating is the syncing between devices. I use notion on the computer, tablet and phone, and I noticed that 2/3 devices would not be updated to the last change I made on another device (even changes that have sat overnight). I'm hoping the app can make improvements to the synchronization between devices, as I rely heavily on Notion.

It's a great app. It's organized and productive, yet the bugs are bothering me. I use it to plan my everyday tasks and it takes a while to load every page. I also use tables for my schedules and some of the columns take a few minutes to appear. Hoping the app would be better and faster on the next update. Also, please consider having the offline mode where the emojis and cover pic would still be visible even though there is no internet connection, those really motivated me to stay productive.TY!

I want a note taking tool which exists for all platforms. The problem with your web version is that, it's way too slow. And there is no offline feature for this app yet. It's a great app. And you have a lot of features. But the basics is not right. Offline feature is a must. And make a Linux app. And the load times in Android is long. I don't know why it happens.

Great app. Very intuitive to use. One big draw back: it takes forever to load up. When you click on the app icon, there's about a 6 second delay before you're allow to type anything. It just shows the Notion logo. Evernote is instantaneous. I want the app to feel less sluggish.

works good overall! really helpful to store lengthy notes, make plans, journals, etc. its a bit of a work to learn how to use it effectively but its worth it! lately ive been experiencing a bug where the keyboard would disappear if i hit backspace once to delete a text character. it used to work well. waiting for the next update!

I've been using this to keep track of my class readings and deadlines for a year now. So far, the loading time has improved, though it's still a bit slow. It would be nice if this could be addressed. Also, I'd like to suggest (for the next update) linking/relating multiple databases to the calendar instead of just one. It helps with organizing a general calendar of activities, especially for students who dedicate a page per subject and would like to see everything on a single calendar.
I love Notion, its all in one, good performance, great organzation, BUT low stababilit, its not processing smooth. It only does go "smooth" when its on PC, so yeah, overall geat job

Really good so far, but I'd love if the app could have more gestures, especially the app drawer which you currently can't swipe away. Also all those views which animate up from the bottom could be bottom sheets, meaning swiping down would exit them. You could also make them only come up half way (as per the material design spec for bottom sheets), because often there's a lot of blank space vertically in those views. Otherwise, really good!

I like the web client very much, even more than the desktop client. However, this app is a few levels below... Almost every time I swipe right the hamburger lateral menu opens against my will (why not making it open when swiping right at the top of the screen like other apps?); the app is a bit slow when opening some views due to the app engine some users already exposed. Other than that, it is a well built app, and one must be cautious with bad reviewing cause it's a native desktop product.

This app is exceptional, although a little slow on the phone but still manageable. I'd suggest some things to add/improve. I wish we are able to read pdfs w/o saving it to our device first like in the laptop version. Next, I wish there was a way to input a handwritten notes, doesn't have to be a full fledged feature like OneNote, just the ability to sketch diagrams/notes and input it alongside typed notes would be massive change. Keep it up!

Even though I began few months ago I was overwhelmed and then quit. But I've now given it a second shot and this has been a life changer for me. I would give a 5/5 for all the features it offers but for some apparent reason there is a significant delay when trying to open menus in the app. I thought maybe it was my ram filling up or due to too many processes running in the background at once but that does not seems to be the case. I would be very much happy if this issue is resolved

The overall concept is great! Some things needed to be improved is that when I have some typos, I can only delete 1 letter and the keyboard is 'gone' so I have to tap the word again and delete 1 letter again and the keyboard gone, and it goes on. Also when selecting items, it change from full page when the keyboard's on, to pop-up when the keyboard is off. That's a bit annoying. I guess everything is fine in the desktop version. It's only with phones & tablets i guess.

The overall concept of notion is amazing. It is so seamless and fast to use but only on computer. The app feels too cumbersome and limited compared to the usability of the website on computer. Multiple select for example is not possible in mobile. Although, it might be difficult to replicate the same features in mobile, Notion as a tool is friggin awesome!

Updating the review. Overall the performance of the app is better than it used to be. With the current free tier being open I def feel like bumping this to 4/5. That said, performance is still not good enough to be something where I can expect to whip it out, make a quick note on the go, and return to what I was doing. I expect this to improve over time but, I'm not sure how long that will take

I've only been using Notion for a couple of days now, but I'm honestly in love. Such a cool extensive personal/collaborative tool. I'm especially impressed with the vast possibilities for customization and the best handling of sync and simultanious editing from multiple devices I've ever seen on Android/iOS/Windows. Coming from Evernote though, I do miss the multilingual OCR (that handles scans, PDFs, DOCs, and photos of post-it note jottings alike), handwriting, and theâ€”premiumâ€”offline options.

I fell in love with notion because it's easy to use, has a clean design, and an intuitive interface. However this Android app feels half baked. I mean it works and you can access your stuff from the go, but I feel like I actively avoid using it in favor of just reaching for my laptop. Get rid of these ugly emojis!

Great, but there are some issues with usability. For eg, the text entry - it creates several nodes for each para. But then doesn't allow selecting of all as a normal Text editor. There's no plain copy text option even in the app. So what stays in notion can never be taken out using mobile app. Web app works but that is due to windows. The app should provide these facilities in phone as well.

An app that will transform how you take notes. Amazing functionality but the app is slow to open and is not very responsive. Also, offline support is not very good. Lack of offline access is the reason I left Evernote. The lack of widgets make it harder to take quick notes.

I love this note taking app. Never imagined how powerful a note taking app can be. True dark theme(black) across all platforms with a few accent colour to pick for theme would be soooo much appreciated. Waiting for linux notion app release and I'm not buying an iPad until notion releases handwriting for iPad app. Love for developers â¤ï¸

This a good tool for nearly everything that you might wish to do to boost your productivity. BUT one thing that I would point towards is that it has a kind of slowish capture in terms of taking quick notes, which cannot be yet compared with fast captures like evernote, or google keep or onenote. Secondly, its offline version isn't as seamless to use which somehow degrades user experience.

Hands down. The best app I have that I couldn't live without now. At first, I thought notion was hard to navigate and very complicated, so it was on and off on my device, but now that I paid more attention, I love it! Amazed by how you can get awesome features with it being free!

I'm in love with Notion but the app needs a little tweaking. The web app has seriously changed the way I organise myself and hands down knocks out all the competition such as Evernote and One note but the Notion app is a little clunky to navigate and I often find myself rearranging order of things by accident or clicking onto the wrong note. I feel the web app is where I find myself for taking notes and the app to view them which I'd hoped would he as amazing as the web app.

Does the job, but definitely isn't as responsive for table layouts between desktop and mobile as some other notation/task management apps, keeps the same widths for sections as desktop so you have to scroll horizontally. Would immediately change to five stars if there were android widgets, the only reason I have to keep an alternate notes app is so I can quickly add and see notes from home screen.

One of the best note taker. Very intuitive, love the features, in particular the shareable notes. Hoping in more features and in some customisable shortcuts to take quickly the notes without have to open all the time the app and looking for the page where to create the new note.

I am genuinely impressed with this app. Android startup times have been improved. It still could use more work but it's definitely not as bad as before. I'm legitimately thinking about completely leaving Evernote and moving to Notion now.

Please add an offline function soon. I want to be able to access my notes without connecting to the internet. The mobile version of Notion seems laggier than the desktop version, especially with long notes. But overall the app is pretty nice.

Love it! Great multiplatform note taking app, one complaint though is the really long loading time when opening the mobile app. I don't have that issue on desktop but it's big problem on mobile since I usually need to do write something quick when that happens.
When i writing with arabic language i can't write from right to left and this is issue for arabs please fix this issue. Thanx
all in all it is a perfect app but we extremly need a VIDGET with notes. please add this feature.. it will be very useful

Very amazing app. It can manage your whole life you can do alot of things in the app, but it is kind of hard to use

This app has been really helpful in organizing pretty much everything. Not to mention, I love the fact that you can make a wiki here as well. This is so far great! Only issue that I faced that required the uninstall was that there is no undo / back / cancel in the profile creation page that pops up if you click Google's federated sign-in. I just wanted to cancel that and sign in with my email instead. Edit: now I'm getting emails suggesting me to finish the registration.

The most comprehensive Knowledge Management System app I have ever used. You really have to see it to believe just how all-encompassing this app is. It has the potential to single-handedly replace my need for Google Drive, Trello and Evernote all at the same time. The sleek, modern interface and the insane versatility of the application make it one of the most enjoyable apps I have ever used. It's also actively being developed & improved, so can't wait to see what it evolves into in the future.
I love how this app helps me in organizing my files!!!! Of course there's more room for improvement (like offline feature, notifications for to do lists, etc.) but so far it's so good!! Thank you.

Thank you so much!

Insanely versatile note taking/project management app. As simple or complex as you want it to be. Just wish the database functionality was more fleshed out. Likewise, permissions need to be more granular. But it's a great platform regardless and 3rd party apps help fill the gap.

You have changed from what you used to be. People gave you five stars for what you used to be and now this app doesn't even deserve one star. BEST APP EXPERIENCE TURNED INTO CLUMSY. This used to be my go to app for researching before going to any place and the user interface and information all were compartmentalized in a neat way. Now, it's all cluttered, complied clumsily where finding the right info is more difficult than ever. Mostly, it takes you to other travel blogs and links etc. I wish they revert to old app if possible at all.

Trip Advisor lets their ReCAPTCHA security system abuse it's customers by forcing them to find mindless tasks for sometimes up to 7 minutes. After doing it once, that should be enough but Trip Advisor doesn't care about it's customers. Plus everything under the "to do" section is just bloated with over priced tours that devalue the experience.

There is no way to contact customer support. Tripadvisor charged me for a tour that the provider cancelled, not me! There is no way to get my money back because the provider didn't get paid! Never book anything through Tripadvisor!!! It is a total rip-off!

Tripadvisor indicates that it is willing to listen to suggestions but does not encourage the person to offer same.For example if i find a restaurant above average would that mean it is "very good" or would it mean it's " above average" or at best " good"?Although i have made this suggestion many times,TA would not include the "good" rating. Hate the app on my phone. I also hate the mindless survey link that appears.

I emailed the developer contact to give feedback about a bug in this app. They don't care, and replied: "Thank you for contacting TripAdvisor. We apologize for any inconvenience, as your request has not been read. You are receiving this alert because the message thread has been closed."

You ruined the app. It used to be my go to app for restaurants and hotels, now it can't even find a location less than 1km from me. Not only that, when I did pull it from the map (which is also wrong) it said it was closed. What a joke. Don't expect me to use this app anymore.

I used to love TripAdvisor, now I hate it. It used to be user oriented, now it just shoves things in your face trying to sell sell sell, like those touts you find in tourist traps. Heavy, slow and clunky. Unable to find things if you're not already smack in the middle of them and keeps using imperial units for search distance even though metric is set in the options (assuming you even fi d how to pick a search distance) Doesn't give any feedback about what it's doing or whether it's even doing anything, just an empty window. Search results (if you get any) are displayed in an awkward horizontal UI. Tried using it for over two weeks during trip and giving up.

There are flashy animations and the look is very shiny, but it's a horribly limited version of TripAdvisor. The UX is inconsistent across platforms; for instance I can often see 9 or 10 photos on the website when looking at a review, but only 3 in-app. In addition, the benefit of a native app is negated when you don't make use of the UI features that enables - why can I only swipe through photos on some screens? Inconsistent. I've resorted to using the desktop version in-browser on my phone.

You guys seems to have messed up your App. It was so neat, clean and simple to use it till few months back, and now it takes ages to launch, and then asks you to sign up. The simplicity is gone. You have made a Facebook of your site. Feeling so bad these days after using it for years. Get it rectified, else you will be vanished soon. Thank you.

I use to LOVE this app, we always had it open when traveling, but with every update it gets harder and harder to use. I spend more time trying to find places near me and every time I hit a wrong button I end up back at the home screen and have to start my search over, and I get different options trying to do the same search. It's frustrating to use and I can no longer trust that it's finding me all the places available.

Great feedback from travelers. However, good luck getting there. You can't copy and paste any addresses to navigate to the locations. You click on the listing, then the address, then it opens the location on a tripadvisor map, so you click on the listing, then the address, and so on. In an endless loop. THREE forum posts about this issue have been CLOSED by tripadvisor. The developers are well aware. They just dont care about this annoying inconvenience.

Problems with the app for months now. Glitches, page keeps moving up and down, can't click on things. Tells me I have some google security protection and won't let me click on anything. Finally just uninstalled it. Gave feedback. None of their suggestions helped. If you read this, it use to work fine until about fall 2019. Never been the same since. Screen just moves up and down up and down, even struggle with being able to close the app since I cant click on anything. When it works its great.
Fix your Deeplinks /Universal Links. Every time I google something and click on it, it takes me to the App, and to the Homepage. Had to uninstall it.

TripAdvisor has shifted its priorities over time. What used to be primarily a tool to rate and review hotels, resorts, restaurants, and attractions has shifted to yet another travel booking app. As a result, the app places less emphasis on the past priorities and more on their current objectives. Submitting a review isn't easy. The preview feature of your review is gone. So, if you make a mistake, there's no way to go back and edit. You have to delete your post and start again.

I've had this app on different phones for years. But this year they've made some huge changes I don't like. A new instagram layout that's unnecessary. It added in links to various booking sites that I have no interest in and keep clicking in by accident because they're in the way. Also there are now a ton of glitches. My saved trips lists are suddenly no where to be seen as of today. There was a time where I kept getting kicked out and pictures wouldn't load. This app is really failing a lot.

Sadly, no longer my go to app for all things travel related. Main gripes: when a search (on Google etc) returns a link to a TA page, I end up at the 'where to?' landing page, not the page I wanted. Trips functionality has been updated, not in a good way. Other annoyances include not being able to search for hotels without dates; hotels being listed in 'best value' order - what does that even mean? (Answer: different things to different people).

The site used to be excellent with helpful and accurate reviews. However in recent years the site has evolved to being about selling product. Site is not as intuitive or helpful in identifying good and bad hotels, restaurants, experiences. Pretty much everything is rated good or better and it's up to you to shift through lots of info and ads to find what you need.

The website/content is really good, for that my review is not a one star. However, the app is buggy and badly optimized: 1. Once the app is installed, opening links of TripAdvisor (for example from Google search), opens the app. However, most of the time (I'd say over 90%) the app goes to homepage and not the relevant page. 2. The app is badly optimized for slow internet connections. When other apps work, this one doesn't.

While I love trip advisor, having the app is absolutely frustrating. If you click on links on google or website that normally would take to you the specific web page on trip advisor, it takes you to the app instead, which is fine, but it just forces you to the home page of the app, and not to the information you were trying to get to. I have no choice but to remove the app because I cannot get around the issue otherwise.

The app is very helpful but if you ever make a typo in a search be prepared to be flooded with emails about somewhere you do not want to go because it is impossible to clear your search history. Do not use it if you are trying to suprise someone for the same reason. We went to Victoria and I used TripAdvisor to research it, still getting emails 9 months after my trip. It would be great to be able to tell TripAdvisor that you are no longer interested in a destination but there is no way to it

Something has changed on mobile. Either Google or TripAdvisor have changed something in their integration, but Google search results that refer to TripAdvisor just launch the app instead of opening the app at the appropriate city/attraction. I've uninstalled the app and now search results bring me where they should. I'll install the app again when this is fixed.

The reason for a low rating is because it is very hard to find RV Parks and Campgrounds. They do not have a catagory for them. They are lumped in with lodging and when you do find a campground they want you to book a room in a hotel! I am not driving around in an old beat up camper. My total rig value, 5th wheel and truck, is over $150,000. So Trip Advisor get your act togeather and start supporting the RV travelers.

I don't like Facebook so not sure why the app has been changed to that format. I think that if TripAdvisor is in the FB format you should be able to dislike a comment about a restaurant. So many people think they are being funny with a mean review and they don't understand the damage they cause. Legitimate reviews are helpful but it is quite obvious when a person is being mean and seeking attention. (The server has no control of the menu! In most cases they make $2.13 an hour)

I used to be a top contributor, but stopped adding reviews the last couple of years because the app continues to get more difficult rather than easier. Or even the same. It's an exercise in frustration, especially when I'm asked for recommendations by friends but can't find my reviews by location unless I'm on my PC. I also don't like seeing all those ads. They don't sway my decision one bit. The reviews are the only things I care to see.

Every time I click on a TripAdvisor search result link on Google, I'm forced to go through this app, which brings me to the home page. Sometimes I'm able to find the same article by searching specifically for it through the app, but it's unnecessary faff, and sometimes I can't find it. As a result, I'm no longer able to view articles on TripAdvisor, which is a shame. I wish there was an option of just viewing it on a browser.

Over the years and with this latest relaunch in particular the site has shifted away from the original purpose of travellers sharing information and reviews, to an online sales and booking agency. The information's still there but harder to get to. The forums are now dominated by persons with agendas: business, real estate or residency self interests. The site still has good info, you just have to wade through dreck to get there. More and more I'm going to Lonley Planet and Fodor's. Sad.

Not able to load bookings, this is troublesome especially if you haven't printed the tickets and are going to use the mobile site. It let me book but then for a few days it won't load my bookings. I'm glad I checked this a few days before my trip and went into the desktop site to print them or I would have been really mad if I couldn't access my tickets when i needed them, it would be too late to ask for a refund then as well.

"TripAdvisor now makes it easier than ever to make the most of every trip" is an absolute lie. I don't need a social feed of people promoting their companies and blogs. I need valid information and reviews about restaurants, hotels and attractions. This update has absolutely ruined the mobile experience for my use case so I will be deleting the app and finding a new source for this information.

I'm unable to change my profile photo, and TripAdvisor keeps crashing everytime I attempt to review a location. On top of this, the map locations are often out of date, and the GPS is worse than Google Maps. Two stars simply because I did manage to find some nice locations with the app during my holiday. Otherwise it appears buggy, and occasionally sketchy.

my trips data has disappeared from my app. still there on desktop. that apart, for many years now, the app experience doesn't match up to desktop. for instance, if you're viewing #10 of 150 hotels in a place, the app doesn't allow you to click on it to see the whole list. great service overall, but app can be better

trip advisor was once a useful and wonderful app. you could download a city guide and use a gps enhanced map to get around a city in which you don't have mobile service. there were lots of helpful tips from travelers. now you are constantly prompted to buy tours and have to scroll through dozens of social media style posts to get close to anything useful. this app was one a crowning achievement of crowd sourced travel information. it's now useless and bloated. back to printed matter!

Keeps getting worst, this was my go to app for everything travel related but lately it's just not fit for purpose. 1. When I am searching on Google and want to view a forum discussion on TripAdvisor or to view a place or review once I click the link it no longer takes me to the specific content (within the app) but puts me on the landing page, literally every time. There are more issues but I have reached the character limit, I agree with other posters that the testers should be fired.

App is terrible. No way you can see your bookings. Looked all over the app. Nothing obvious. I have to go to my email, find the link and click on my booking link in the email to open it in app. It's a joke. No use. So much for mobile ticket!

A terrible app in term of user experience. Of course all the reviews are valuable, but using the app is a disaster. I have stopped using the app years ago and just use Google Map reviews.

No way to manage downloaded cities easily. To download a city you need to search it and download it one by one, instead the app should have a list of all cities available for download queue. Same as deleting, one shouldn't search the city and delete individually. And lastly, it requires online connection even if you have downloaded a city already.

I don't like that you can no longer put in your dates unless you book thru the app. I struggle to find where you can add places of interest once you have added some the first time. We used this app for all of our trips and it was great. Now it may be more trouble than it's worth.

I fail to see the point of a travelling app that doesn't let you download offline content. How am I supposed to use TripAdvisor in cuba for example, or make quick plans inside the plane. I can't.. It is very useful to be able to see reviews of local restaurants, and how far away they are. We use this app a lot. There are a couple of quirks, though. But when I select the text so that I can browse to a link, for example, I couldn't copy the text. I had to uninstall the app and browse to TripAdvisor as a web page in order to copy the text. ... if this is the only technical issue, then maybe they deserve four stars instead of the three I gave. Only leaving a review because it persistently bugs you to. TripAdvisor can be a useful tool in your arsenal as a traveller finding things to do and places to eat, although one should be careful not to rely too much on it. In non-English speaking countries it has a tendency to recommend touristy, often overpriced places over good value local ones. It also tries to sell you way too hard on packaged tours, although you can ignore these. Overall though you can find some hidden gems.

Great place to leave reviews for fellow travellers. When we book our trips, my first choice is finding the location then reading most of the reviews to decide if I want to book or not.
