On my android it is impossible to get help from the helpdesk or to contact anyone for anything. Reporting them should be easy, but it is the most painful thing you have ever done! Therefore... Great for average tourists, not so much if you want to go off the beaten track.

Trip advisor used to be better. Now, having sold out to advertisers and changing the structure of their listings to accomodate that, it has become noticeably less useful. One example, you can no longer simply see an entire list starting at #1 of the best things to do in any given location. They break it up into multiple lists and don't give the user a way to simply view all the things to do, by order of ranking. I used to swear by Trip Advisor. Unfortunately, now not so much.

Used to be better. Can no longer sort the lists in a particular order and can no longer download cities for offline use (which was super useful when you don't have internet access). Still a good app, and I still use it, but it feels like they are reducing its usefulness, not expanding it.

The reviews on trip advisor are helpful. My biggest beef is with finding things to do nearby. The way to do it without limiting yourself to a half dozen choices changes with each release. Currently, I can't see more than 20 things nearby in map view. I have moved to a remote area and there are not many things very close. 2 in list view. Bring back a way to see more things. The distance filter was the best. It worked until a few weeks ago.

Useful App to plan holidays. However constant requests for reviews and minimum length of comments a real hassle, hence don't do the reviews. When travelling on holiday have better things to do than sit writing on my phone. Brief reviews may get done but setting minimum length and adding loads of additional questions means no reviews. Get real please. Time to turn off your Permissions for my location.

gone downhill, the app used to ask me if I was looking for breakfast if it was early morning,or do searches within a defined area, barely knows which city I am in these days. it appears some venues are posted first despite their rating so can you buy your way up the results list? I have even searched areas for places to eat and the place across the road is not shown but is listed if I do a specific search for it. the reviews are still good but the app functionality is poor

As a former business owner and having to deal with this and yelp. I think that being able to rate the customer like Airbnb does would go along way to really improve mutual service for the customers. I cant tell you how many times I was threatened by customers to give a bad review if they didn't get their way. Or former employees or their friends or family giving bad reviews. I took everything personally and due to that I sold because of my health. 180 over 120 was killing me. Former owner Pete

This is my go to website/app to narrow down places to visit, stay or eat. BUT, lowering my rating because: - The Restaurant list used to show the overall rating of each restaurant. You now have to select the restaurant to see the rating. - They do not want you to contact them easily. If you use the email link in the app store it just comes back to you. From your account on the android app the "contact us" link takes you to their website where you must log in again to be able to contact them.

I love being able to look everything up and compare prices so easily. I hate how on several occasions I have looked up plane tickets, refreshed my screen, and the tickets that were literally 650 are now 820. This has happened to me several times, and i don't think its just "price fluctuating". Literally find the tickets, and the screen refreshing jumps the price by around $200 at least.

I used to use this site always but have become too aware of the corruption of it by malicious or opportunistic people. Now I take its advice with a very liberal grain of salt. Also, to those people who write extremely negative reviews - I tend to ignore you because often you're just wining (the kind of person who is never happy with any experience).

Much more difficult to find places than with the old app. I didn't like Trip Advisor taking off one of my posts by not explaining why they thought it was fraudulent. If it was because I worked there for one night as a waitress I can understand the rules about staff, even though it was for only one evening over Christmas. I did stay there, many times, many years ago, and always found it very pleasant. They did serve food then, there was a Christmas do with all the trimmings.

Seems the prior version was easier to use. I had made a review last week and it showed that I had a duplicate. I erased the duplicate & both disappeared . I had to repost. I had posted a review last year and TripAdvisor removed it. I just recently came back from Cancun and did another review, and it is still not posted. I don't know if TripAdvisor is in bed with h10 hotels but if you're not letting people share personal experiences and review hotels, then you're not doing your job.

I have experienced some difficulties with the app. I can't change my profile picture or cover picture. It would be nice if there was a way to 'save' places under a bucket list option. First time user and I find it not to be intuitive. All recommendations are from USA, even though I'm from South Africa

They still need work on searching for nearby places and while I love trip advisor when I'm out of the country.. I really wish when I add a new restaurant that it would allow me to put in my review at the time so that I don't have to go back days or a week later (after they've approved the place I've added) and try to remember. Just include my review when the place is approved!

I love TripAdvisor and it is the key tool I use when travelling. But the Trips section is very buggy. For at least the past two months it doesn't load automatically. Before if you refreshed enough times it would eventually load. But now even when signed in it will only show "Create New Trip" and not load any trips at all. I don't mind the occasional bug but the website and the app have been having continuous problems for the past year. I'm surprised their hasn't been an update with fixes yet

I would've given this app a higher rating, but I gave it a 3 star because after it updated it erased ALL my saved trips! I still use it to search for things to do when I travel and look at reviews, but I use Pinterest to save all my trip ideas now. It was nice having it all in one place before, but I don't trust it to save my trips anymore.

Can't view holiday rentals photos and this spoils what is otherwise a good app. I've tried various browser and the fault doesn't go away. The app has just been updated and the fault is still there. This problem is common as an internet search will reveal so it must be an app fault. Tripadvisor don't seem too eager to repair the problem. late addition....... After an update this app is now working properly again. I just wish i could believe the reviews a bit more, some dont appear authentic

I don't have an issue with content but, for example, it can take days for notifications of a traveller's question to come through. Also today, I received an email notification that someone has sent me a private message. In the email I can see their name and the start of the message but when I click I can't see the specific message.

Really annoying that you cannot see your badges etc on the mobile app , Removing that for me was a backward step. Other than that its a good app, and i use it a lot, here at home and abroad...Definitely gives you a fair insight into restaurants, bars, hotels, attractions etc..

Good app, but increasingly difficult to use. Cystine type is more a ridiculously long list. Make sub categories of you must, but please stop adding clutter. Porterhouse steak is just a steak. Prawn is simply seafood, as is oyster, lobster, crab and crab cake. Pad Thai is clearly Thai so no need for yet another entry. Please have a tidy up so we can actually find eats with some ease again.
Good app but one important option is missing "mode of payment" for people who wants to pay in hotel who can accept credit card or cash

Whilst this is an extremely useful app, it can be very difficult to navigate and often doesn't show things on a search that one knows are on there: Example- we visited a restaurant by recommendation which displayed a TripAdvisor certificate. When trying to rate this, it didn't show up on a search and wasn't on the map. I googled the restaurant and one of the answers was a trip advisor review!! Thus I went into trip advisor (through the back door so to speak) and rated it.

I'm not a fan of the changes that turned this app into a blog atmosphere. I use it for the ratings, and I don't pay attention to any particular person providing the input so I don't care to follow anyone or subscribe to anyone's opinion. Don't turn this into an opportunity for someone to become a "TA celebrity" - stick to the ratings.

It is a good app, and functional. But unfortunately there are still some bugs. I edited my profile several times because it wasn't updated over and over (up to now!). I also wanted to submit some reviews to get Big Point ID, but I didn't find the 20mil button, even though I viewed the place which should have this button (as per friend's info). Also, when adding photos for a specific place after I submitted my review, the photos weren't added automatically to my review for that particular place.
Good to look for review and comparision but it's a bit difficult to find an exact place and leave a review.

Selecting pics to upload from the app is a pain! The pics are in no particular order. There's pictures that I took four years ago intermingled with recent pictures. And recent pictures aren't necessarily at the top or grouped together. How about letting me just browse for the pictures I want using my gallery like most other apps?!?

Overall a great app but it needs work done on the sharing of trips between devices. Even if I use the the same login profile on my computer as my phone, and create trips there, those items and trips don't get shared to my phone. You need to work on this as it's much more efficient to use a computer to plan trips than the phone app but there's no mutual sharing going on. Cheers.

I do find the app can help more by keeping updating the latest communication you have with the booking people. I have sent a message yesterday while on my laptop and is still not logged in to the message board on my phone app. Also found it stuck sometimes whe you want to click on the selected accommodation you want to book and the pictures are not loading. Does help alot when you plan your future trips and need reviews from fellow travelers. Thanks!

frustrating!!!! when you are reviewing somewhere and you're writing more than a few words, the box won't let you scroll back up to edit your review before submitting. One thing I can't stand is submitting and then finding typos. Plus TA doesn't let you edit your reviews once posted to remove typos. I just tried to edit and then lost half of what I was writing. As a top level reviewer it's all frustrating. (android platform)

Good App!! Would grade it MUCH HIGHER!!! HOWEVER!! There is a bug in the APP!! In the App, there is a question asking if you want an email sent to you when there has been communication posted or discussion about a question you have asked or discussed. THIS DOES NOT WORK!! I reported this problem NUMEROUS TIMES over the years and it is still not fixed. You then have to continuously check your question or questions! What a waste of time!!!!! Lary1047

The app should allow folder view while uploading photos, like gallery, or specific folder in phone. It just shows the entire photos stored in phone with a scrollbar. With someone like me who has several thousands photos in phone itz simply not possible to search by scrolling and as such in many reviews we are unable to add photos.
Still looking for a hotel and what deals, so far not looking like any!
Has no distinction between $$ and $$$ in search.
Excellent!!very easy and friendly, I love this app

Overall a good Trip app. If your looking to go to a hotel or a restaurant, they have it all. They give you honest reviews by real people (not bots) Sometimes it is not helpful as you may need to do some digging to find what you're actually looking for. But overall, highly recommend this app to help you get a vacation you need or even some deluxe high quality food.

I can't make updates for "Improve this listing." I have tried to update three different local businesses, and also add the new Skatepark in our community, but they despite doing this on both my desktop and mobile, and making several attempts over the last few months, nothing has changed.

Reviews and advices very helpful from all over the world. But some times they cheat!!! So, when going to the unknown just be careful and not fully really on this. But overall it's a great app. That's why I gave it a 4 Respect

Overall a pretty good travel app. If you're looking for a hotel or any accommodation and want to get a good idea if it's good or not, this is the place to start. You'll find real reviews by real people. Also good for airline reviews, transportation company reviews, etc. It is sometimes not the most intuitive app, but you should be able to eventually find what you're looking for after some searching and digging.

Hi. I find the app so useful when researching hotels, places to go, etc, which is why i post reviews. But i also think that bearing how much time and care i've put into this over the years, recognition, especially for prolific posters such as i, could be better recognised/rewarded. After a while, the points and levels (why is level 6 the highest?!!) Lose their cachet. How about free nights in some hotels, meals, whatever? I'm happy to enter dialogue on this if it helps.

It's only drawback for me is that it's world wide and often I want to research places that are not local or overseas and so you have to be really careful about which country you are searching in as places in the USA /Australia etc have the same place names of areas in the UK that I'm searching for and those other places are first on the list. Other than that it's an easy and useful app and review site.
Very Nice Experience and having almost everything. They must upgrade and allowed to add old visits from mobile and laptop. I like this app and always use for my traveling.
One of the famous and popular apps. Find the airline. Hotels. Tourist places many more. Book through the tripadvisor app. I like it thanks.

Having tripadvisor really help when comes to travel booking, trip and exporting other country. And it's friendly use
Actually marvelous app, love it it gives a lot of information and accurately.

I find the app very useful for finding places of interest, hotels, restaurants, cafes etc. My wife and I often consult the reviews for advice about hotels etc. I haven't used all the features like flights etc so can't comment on them.

so far things are working good...the only thing i dont like is all the different rankings...we just need one ranking so when i want to know the best 5 restaurants i get that number. When leaving a review it asks more questions that as a visitor I wouldn't necessarily know.
Great app for hotel bookings and places to visit. You get the info related to the area to be visited, hotels, cabs details. One stop with all the data.

The best app for finding your way around a new place. It has all the restaurants and is almost always reliable, and is very useful for finding other things like attractions too. Excellent information if you ever are looking to travel or just go out to dinner. They just need an "other" option in the "reason for stay" column. Some of our travels are for medical reasons not business or leisure or even family.
I think is easy to navigate , I like how it recommends things to do around at the place you are staying, this way is more easier to plan for vacation or family trips

The only thing I can say that I didn't like is when I had their line of credit, I spend years with paypal and paid my dues on time but when I was in a major accident and hospitalized I wasn't able to make a payment and account was closed and I submitted proof and they still refused to reopen the account or let me reapply for one.

Overall good, but be careful when trying to transfer your balance to your debit card/bank account. Twice I selected to transfer my balance to my debit card so it would be instant, and twice PayPal overrode my choice and after I'd already submitted the transfer it says "you'll receive in your bank account in 2-3 business days," defeating the entire objective of getting the money ASAP. This issue is almost enough to make me do away with PayPal altogether, but it's still got redeeming qualities.

I would give it 5 stars if it didn't make me use the card to charge me to pull my money off now bc once the debit card got ordered and linked to my account I could no longer pull money off at Walmart for Free!! Also I don't agree with the daily and weekly money limit.. besides that it's a pretty cool app.

I Love using paypal it is such a big help. Paypal makes it so much easier to be able to send and receive money. The fact that it is not a hassle to cash a check especially when banks give you a hard time if you don't have a bank acoount or proper ID with them! Why is there so many fees too take out money ? PayPal charges $2.75 and then you have to pay the ATM machine. That's $5 or more to take out $20. They don't have a list of what ATM or Bank you can take it out of for free.

I love this app. Customer service is great and easy to contact via phone, live agent or email. It's super reliable and safe. I'm currently looking for my rewards for inviting two people who has done all the correct steps as well for my $10.00 bonus for inviting people. When I receive that as they promised I will come back and change to 5 starts and edit my comment but as if now I'm looking for my bonus, thanks.

I like the app because it gives an easy way to transfer money to individuals at various institutions. Sometimes the app is slow. I like the cryptocurrancy part and have taken advantage of the "No fee" period. I lost a little money because the app was too slow when I would do a "sell" at a certain price and by the time PayPal completed the transaction, the price had changed costing me money.

I like the app. It's very easy to send and receive money. I haven't had my issues with the two apps I'm using. Keep saying they can't show me that information right now.

Have has good experience with PayPal app. I would give it 5 stars except they blocked me for a while because I was sending the same amount every month to the same person which their program found suspicious. It's called "rent" PayPal. Had to sort it out over the phone.

Very convenient, and better than CashApp, or Whatsapp for my taste. Just hate the fact they charge a fee, when sending to family/friends. They make a judgement and charge anyway. Kinda shady, and not for them to judge. But it's fast and convenient. 4 of 5 stars. PayPal:get your act together, for that 5/5.

It works well once you understand what's going on. I liked it PayPal sent me money and took it back to see that my account was connected to PayPal. I test sent $1 to be sure everything was working well. Overall I love the app.
Very good, except the cost of transferring moneys is a little high,

Im only giving this app 4 stars because the only issue I have is that you cant add money to your account from another bank account you can pay things using a card thats linked but you cannot just add money to your account which every other money transfer app I have used does. I love this app!! Very convenient to send to friends and family. I would also like if they would upgrade the look of the app and make it look fancy. 4 and 1/2 stars!â˜†!

If you don't have a PayPal account, there is no reason to not get one. The downside with them is the fees. For example, if you sell something for $440, you pay a fee of $13.06. And to move it to your bank account instantly, instead of waiting 1-3 days, it's another $4.27, making your actual profit $422.67. And if you made a sale on eBay, their cut is separate! It's pretty aggravating... and even more so that we're still using money and hardly anyone knows the truth but hey, whatever...

This is one of the best apps I use. Makes paying friends, storing rent money, and buying things online way easier and more convenient. Love it!! Except I wish that peoples email account was more readily available. Sometimes I need to get in touch with a customer or send a message and cant find their email ANYWHERE!!!

PayPal app seems to be reliable. Unfortunately it's not always clear to people that if they send money from a credit card source, there are fees involved. And PayPal doesn't reimburse fees if you refund them.

Like the app but could use some improvements in the speed, the website loads slot faster using Firefox and the auto capture for check cashing is extremely difficult to get to capture its either too close not far enough or says to flip the check when it's on the correct side already and having a well lite area on a dark surface doesn't change the difficulty.

I love paypal it's the best app out of Venmo, CashApp. Paypal is the easiest to use and they have no fees to use atm's. I recommend to anyone But the app has been super slow lately after the update. So I deleted it. I haven't downloaded it since. Hope they fix it so I can download it again.

pretty easy to use...but as always theres room for improvement. Just be ready to be locked out at an inoppurtune time to verify your identity, seems everyone i know dealt with it as soon as they had a decent amount of money in account.
